column4: Great spot to visit during late spring-fall. Can easily enjoy a quite and private walk. Cafe on location is great. Lots of beautiful flowers and trees

What a beautiful place to visit. You can stroll at your leisure and it's so peaceful and quiet. You can sit and just watch nature. It's a place where you can spend a whole day enjoying the tranquil atmosphere. I would definitely go again.
Not large but lovely garden. A place where you you can enjoy the summer weather besides Water Front. Close in Winter.

The Public Gardens in Halifax is a must see when you go to the Maritimes. The flowers abound and the fragrances surround you as you stroll over bridges and along meandering paths. My personal favorite was the dahlia gardens. So many varieties and colours! Truly one of the most peaceful tours I have ever done.
A great escape from the city streets. Quiet, clean, relaxing, lovely sights like the water, gazebo, gardens, etc. Would go back again.
No visit to Halifax is complete without a stroll though this beautiful English garden . Level paths for mobility challenged with lots of benches rest on.

Often on our trips to Halifax we will wander the Public Gardens. The landscape is always changing as the spring and summer progresses. Quite often there are wedding groups in the park and this is always fun as well as interesting to watch. The bird and animal life is another interest here. Because the park is so central it is...

The Halifax Public Gardens is a 16 acre oasis of beautiful Victorian gardens, pathways and water features in the heart of the Downtown. It is a tranquil place for strolling, relaxing or reading. You may even find the occasional chess match under the shade trees or take in a free evening concert throughout the Summer.
I love this park. Just a great place to stroll and enjoy the beautiful flowers in the summer or sit on a bench under a tree and have a little snack or meal.

Memorial Gardens in hub of uptown Halifax is a relaxing delight in the middle of a busy and vibrant part of Halifax.It is planted beautifully and is in full bloom. Afternoon music at the Gazebo.....how civilized

In the heart of the city the gardens are beautiful. Lots is shade if it's a warm day. Entertainment may be scheduled in the gazebo. Lots of ducks in pond.Much of the trees were damaged years ago with Hurricane Juan. Things are looking good

I can't recall the dimensions... but you enter a fenced in green space in the middle of the city.Duck pond, multiple different types of trees and the lilac bush that my children have played in for 45 minutes without coming out... it's the size of a house.1. Kids and Family place2. Couples and picnicing3. Center stage...
The Public Gardens is a beautiful place for a stroll, any time of the year. We are very lucky to have this beautiful place in the middle of our city!

Beautiful public gardens! We were easily able to find parking along one of the major boulevards by the Gardens. We really enjoyed the short time we spent in the Public Gardens and we were especially impressed by the tranquility. Everything and all the displays were immaculate--we would have liked to spend more time here!
I used to walk along here everyday on the walk to work, except in the winter. Beautiful scenery to distract from a stressful work day.
Must see part of Halifax only a couple minutes from Citadel Hill. Quiet, peaceful and historic. Great place for a pic nic or to just relax and observe the landscaping.

I love when the Halifax Public Gardens opens in April as that is when I know that Spring is finally here. It's truly a beautiful Victorian garden. I take a peaceful stroll along the paths and remember when I brought my daughter here when she was a little girl, 40 years ago. The landscaping is beautiful as are the pond,sculptures,...
Beautiful in summer. Wonderful place to spend an afternoon walking through and admiring the natural beauty. Clean and quiet. No pets allowed.

IF you have some time and like to stroll in the sun then the public gardens is a great option. Although small in its size it has a wide variety of flowers and trees to explore. Also the birds are a feast for the eye.
We spent an easy evening here, and it has left us with memories that we will cherish for a long time to come!

Love to stroll around on the pathways. Stop and look at the flowers and shrubs and best of all watch the goose, swan and ducks. Enjoy sitting on a bench and soaking up the fresh air, sunshine and reading a relaxing book or just people watching. Enjoy the Sunday afternoon music at the bandstand.

Not that Halifax is by any means a place of roaring chaos, but these gardens are a historic delight in the heart of the city. Kudos to the municipality for keeping up this treasure. Complete with some of the oldest ornamental plants in Canada, if you read the plaques. Totally kid-friendly. Enjoy!

Beautiful public gardens in the centre of downtown Halifax, offering an escape from the hustle and bustle of downtown. Often at weekends in the summer there is free live music on the bandstand but there is also the option to find a quiet corner to sit and meditate. A must see during any visit to the city.

The Halifax Public Gardens are well worth a stroll through on a warm spring day. They are Victorian style and simply beautiful to walk through. Located in the heart of Halifax, this gem has been lovingly preserved. One of my favourite features are the big ornate cast iron gates that guard the entrance.
Stroll through the public gardens on a nice sunny day. It has the feel of a European city. Once in the gardens you feel like you are in Paris. Close to downtown and a number of good lunch spots.

Does this look like part of a large park to you? It is not. The gardens fills a small public square, but one can use one's space to create an idea of openness and expansiveness. Victorian England may not have known about Feng Shui, but they had their own sense of the idea. The circular Bandshell features concerts, and is...
Great spot to spend some time, take a walk, enjoy the gardens, or visit with a book and a blanket. Lots of space to lie back and people watch.
Beautiful and tranquil area, very pretty and romanticGood for meditations and walks, jogs ,and just the right place for pictures if your photogenic

I love going here when I get a chance. A nice place to get away in the middle of a city. Transforms into a place to relax, read, stroll on a sunny day. A nice duck pond, historic trees are well maintained. If your lucky enough you could catch a brass band or musical act playing by the Gazebo. A...

Such a beautiful public garden, right in the middle of the city. Very Victorian and English, which it why we loved it so much. The iron gates were wonderfully stylish and provided a grand entrance to grand gardens.
We visited the gardens for about an hour. You could definitely stay longer. It's well laid out and a very relaxing place to visit.
Great place to spend your afternoon reading, relaxing, or taking photos. Usually gets busy in the summer with Weddings/Proms/Grads coming for photos.

If you want to feel like you are no longer in the city, but never want to actually leave, then Halifax Public Gardens is the place to visit. During the spring, summer and fall, this place is a must see place to go.
A nice size park for in the middle of the city. Great photo spot! The gardens are beautiful. Sometimes there are concerts or special flower shows.
Beautiful park in the city, a peaceful place to walk and sit,,,beautiful flowers and birds,take a picnic..enjoy the sun and quiet

The Halifax Public Gardens is one of the most beautiful gardens in eastern Canada. It is extremely well kept "Park" located in the centre of the city. The summer flowers are gorgeous and the flower plots always have a thyme. A must see when visiting, or living in Halifax..

Perhaps I am a bit biased from the many visits to the gardens when I was a boy but visiting them again this summer was really nice. The gardens are beautifully kept and the park is a real pleasure to send time in.
This place is beautiful, the scenery is amazing and you can tell its kept well. On a summers day this place is very enjoyable and is located near by to a busy shopping district/ Downtown.

A must see for those visiting Halifax. These beautiful gardens are a peaceful place to stop and smell the roses. Lots of places to sit and relax and enjoy the nature around you. In the summer there are often free concerts at the gazebo.
Great place to take a walk, sit in the sun, relax, enjoy with a close friend, admire the scenery and even get a great ice cream!
Very beautiful garden in Halifax. I spent some time strolling with a tour. I was surprised by the history associated with the park.

I love going to the Halifax Public Gardens when I am in Halifax during the summer. It is so beautiful! The towering trees, beautiful flowers, little ponds and the ducks and geese are fun to watch. There are benches to sit on or if you prefer getting even a little bit more closer to nature, you can sit on the...

Our e visiting the garden during our trips and it always charms us. Loved it better when feeding ducks and birds were permitted. It attracted wildlife and made is amusing. Since then it is pretty quiet but probably best this way for wildlife safety.

The public gardens are a staple of downtown Halifax and a must visit for tourists in the spring, summer and fall. There is occasionally free music and there is plenty of seating and neat places tucked away with the gardens. The gardens are big relative to Halifax but don't expect a central park sizes experience. With that said, my one...
Beautiful strolling through especially when all is in full bloom with the colors and sweet scents relaxing and tranquil , peaceful also nice little café souvineer shop as well.
Beautiful place to have a picnic or just a leisure walk to see the ducks and all the beautiful flowers.

Beautiful gardens and paths to go for a relaxing stroll....grab a ice cream or a coffee from the Historic Horticultural Hall and enjoy a seat around one of the three lovely fountains. Great place for photographers...Sunday afternoons in the Summer there are free concerts at the bandstand and there is an annual Mayor's Tea. Great place to relax and people...

I love the Public Gardens - every visit is a treat. Unfortunately it is closed in the winter, but it's magical whenever I walk through the gates... So many specimen trees, well-tended beds of flowers and some special spots like the Dahlia show in late summer. This display attracts thousands of visitors and the photographs I've taken are really special....

The Halifax Public Gardens is a little piece of paradise in the middle of Downtown Halifax. There are many paths to meander through, quiet spots with benches to sit on, and lots of ducks and swans to enjoy as you stroll by the ponds. There are name plates by many of the plants and trees and descriptions of the flora...
I only wish we had, had more time to enjoy this luxurious garden, taken care of with the help of volunteers. I could stop taking photos. And now I'm drawing from them. Lovely, lovely.
Halifax Public Gardens are beautifully maintaned. The gardens though not large has everything, A lovey place to spend an hour of two to catch your breath during a busy day of touring.

The geese are super obese and there are only two. The ducks/swans have been few and far between. I suspect this is due to drunks breaking in and hunting said waterfowl as gifts for their young children. You see they spent all the birthday money on hookers and booze. At the end of the day, it's all very depressing.
While it may be a lot smaller than most public gardens in major cities this one does not disappoint. Make sure to take the time to see this well maintained garden.
It has both beauty and history.. also, an awesome little canteen.. I also walk through sometimes on my way to work.. great place to visit!

The perfect place to enjoy a coffee and a great book. You can wander around and enjoy the scenery or pick your favourite place and take a moment to simply relax. I recommend the bench under the willow tree near the Sackville and South Park entrance.

It feels a little of place, but the gardens are one of the best public spaces of any cities in Canada. Halifax is not really lacking for wide open public spaces, but this park is one of the better ones. The ponds and trees help to create a relaxing and peaceful environment, and it feels very natural, despite being in...

We were on a bike tour with I HEART Bikes! One of the stops on the itinerary was to the Halifax Public Gardens. My only wish is that more time was allotted, but I understand about the time constraints due to seeing lots more things in the area. We got 15 minutes within the gardens, which definitely is not enough...

This is an excellent, calming and beautiful little park nestled in the heart of the city. Spend time on a bench with a good book, visiting with the locals or just bird watching; you're guaranteed to have a peaceful, rejuvenating afternoon.
Beautiful gardens with large array of flowers to feast your eyes upon. Lovely walking paths to wander! Great central location! Best on a sunny warm day.

This is a beautiful garden place. All my children have had their grad pics done here, and I had my wedding pics done here. This is one place to visit when your in Halifax during the summer months. Quiet but busy

Each day on my morning walk (from Spring until Winter) I am blessed to be able to cut through the Public Gardens on my way to and from work. This beauty of this park, which is in constant change, always centres me gracefully. I highly recommend a stroll through it, or taking time to sit down and submerse yourself in...

While my wife was hospitalized in Halifax I walked through the Gardens ever day for over a month. They are beautiful and restful. Lots of wildlife (ducks, geese, heron), fountains, beautiful flower beds, trees, ponds and lots of benches to sit on. The park dates from the Victoria era and is unchanged since then. If look at the large trees...

The most relaxing place you can visit,the sights and sounds the quite spots even when there's is people in large numbers. To have a place of this quality in the center of the city is of great value to Halifax and to NS.

The Public Gardens are an iconic must-see experience whether you are visiting Halifax or live here. Although the colours are spectacular, try converting them to black & white to see phenomenal detail.
Gorgeous in July & August. Well worth a walk in the park. They also have live performers. Great day to spend a day in Halifax NS

at its finest. A spring season, or summer, visit to Halifax wouldn't be complete without a walk through one of the city's most picturesque attractions. Trees and shrubs, flowers and ponds, ducks and squirrels everywhere you look, and under sunny skies, if not too hot, you just can't get a better place to enjoy an outdoor picnic lunch on your...
This is one of my favorite place for a walk on a summer or fall day. Amazing gardens and a bandshell that features music from local performers and even pipe and drum bands.
Very nice walking trails and lots of history would reccomend it to anyone. would be better on a warmer day. lots to see and do. relaxing

I was absolutely in awe of the public gardens. It was all so beautifully maintained and the gardens were just gorgeous! I could have spent hours there walking through and looking at all the beautiful blooms and reading the monuments and plaques.

I walked through the park every day on my way to work for almost a month.I noticed something different each and every time.There are so many different species of trees, flowers and plant life, it is just beautiful.Large picnic area for larger gatherings or plenty of benches for a more intimate setting.

Just stunning ... the huge rhododendrons! The water. The birds. Beautiful flowers. But the cleverness is also enjoyable. Flower beds arranged to create surprising sights sometimes. Come. Bring some food or a book. Walk. Sit. Relax. In the middle of the city.
This is a great place to spend 15 minutes or 2 hours. It is visually stimulating with plants, flowers, water features etc. When you are there you do not feel you are in a city,
Walk through this beautiful park with its bridges over streams and marvel at the variety of plants and trees found here. There are bands that play from the gazebo at various times.
Although my visit was in December, it was still beautiful. I would love to see this in full bloom. Very interesting paths and ponds that take you into a variety of spots.
An absolutely beautiful gem in the heart of the city!!! It is so peaceful and relaxing and you are in awe of how much work must go into maintaining such an amazing place!!
Very frustrating. Because it was November I couldn't get in. It was a lovely sunny day and I had to resort to talking to the ducks through the fence. I did want to see the big pond and the bandstand.
The Public gardens has a mixture of tall trees and beautiful duck ponds, perfect for enjoying good weather and getting fresh air!

We walked uphill from the waterfront to this community garden, and it was worth the effort! From all the plantings, to statuary, to the friendly people, history, and ice cream at the café, it's definitely a must see when visiting Halifax. If you walk like we did, you'll see many historical buildings en route. All of this is free, and...
Only got to see the gardens briefly before closing (they close the gates right at sunset, so don't get locked in!), but what I saw was absolutely beautiful!

Lovely gardens with great displays. Nice spot for walking, talking, or sitting. Very family friendly and surprisingly large for a public garden right in the heart of the city. You should visit while in Halifax.
The gardens are so beautiful. You want to bring a camera or video recorder with you when you tour the gardens. Such a breath taking view.
I have been coming to the Public Garden for many years and it is always beautiful and well maintained. It is extremely popular.

I took my Dad here! He loved the beautiful scenery. The trees, huge and cared for ; birds happy where they are, not a worry in the world; Ducks, the same! It made us forget the outside world and dwell on the tranquility of animal life and the beautiful scenery God had for us to enjoy and off course, you...
Beautiful place to walk and unwind. Lovely flowers and shrubs, birds everywhere and fountains. Worth a couple hours just to walk and enjoy.

The public gardens were well worth the trip even in November. There is careful attention to 4 season planting and the remaining foliage, late season blooming roses and fading annuals added to the seasonal interest. A wide variety of trees and native plants along paths which revealed architecture and focal points of interest provided a welcome few hours for out...

Halifax is so blessed to have such a wonderful Victoria Public Garden in the centre of the city. It is wonderful to stroll through the gardens, so tranquil and peaceful! I love visiting with my 5 year old Grandaughter...the duck pond and of course the ice cream parlor on site. Spend an hour or the day...you may be lucky to...

The gardens are beautiful from the first tulips of Spring thru to the late fall colors. The paths are well maintained and meander thru gardens and by the duck ponds. The azalea's and rhododendrons are among my favorites to take photo's of. When in bloom they are spectacular to see. Hours can be spent walking thru the many themed gardens....

Lovely.The fountains were turned off.The barberry very red and leaf dropping, but you know what? Even though it was in a late autumn lookIt was beautiful, pleasant and very inviting.Big iron gates, old carved fountains, geese and ducks.delightful!
It isn't a huge garden so it's good for a lunchtime walk or a small way to fill sometime. There are birds and ducks so watch for droppings. They are well maintained grounds and can be a bit busy.
A few hours spent at this place can make you relax and recharge your mood. Beautiful colors and healthy air.

Visitors to Halifax can wander and relax in the gardens many sitting areas. Especially nice when all the flowers are bloomed, plus the pavilion in the centre is am interesting spot to hear local music at times.
Indescribably lovely, well designed and maintained. Could easily spend all day here and not see it all.

The Halifax Public Gardens are gorgeous. Special displays, pretty little bridges and streams flowing through the grounds, beds of rosebushes, beautiful gazebo. Take a picnic lunch and enjoy it. We didn't have time to do that, but it's a place to spend a couple of hours, relaxing and soaking it in.
Beautiful Victorian gardens just in downtown Halifax, at the rear of the citadel. Great pathways great for a walk.
Really nice Victorian Garden in the center of Halifax. It is well maintained with secluded pathways. Has a variety of fountains and statues. It's oldest Victoria Garden in North America.

Halifax public gardens is one of my favorite places. I love going for walks especially now that it's fall. It is a must for first time visitors and repeat visitors like myself. The colours are spectacular even at this point.
A visit to the public gardens is so lovely. Beautiful when the flowers are all in full bloom. So peaceful to just take a break and enjoy!

Surprisingly beautiful, and well kept city garden. There was no litter.There is a gazebo where a band plays music. Weddings are performed in this garden.Wild ducks swimming in a lovely pond. This is a very tranquil, relaxing place.

Very beautiful gardens. Nice place to bring your camera to take nature shots. Safe for children. Lots of different types of flowers, and ponds. Feels like your away from the city, while walking through
Very pleasant walk around some beautiful and well kept gardens. Excellent displays of flowers and very easy to walk around... not a long visit required but enjoyable one

We visited as part of a site seeing tour of Halifax and these are lovely gardens and beautifully maintained. There is a large array of flora and the gardens have areas and sections devoted to different things.They are most definitely worth a visit and do get you away from the hustle and bustle that surrounds them.
Well worth spending an hour here; a variety of interesting planting. Impressive displays & useful information boards
This local area park is a beautiful site. Lots to see in terms of trees and flowers. Great spot for a walk and picture taking.

It's not too big, it's not too little; it's just right! We've been to Halifax a few times now, and we always enjoy the stroll on Spring Garden Street to the Public Gardens. The gardens are beautifully maintained but not in an amusement park way. It's a soothing place that can transport you to a simpler time.
These gardens are located close to Dalhousie and are very nicely kept. They have a charming amount of ducks and other birds in the park. Also a good amount of pokestops!

The park has a variety of themed areas to look at although were we there in late October it was still really good with the changing colours. A nice coffee shop on the lower side N,S,E,W was lost to me. The small manmade river was full of surprizes. Overall a good way to spend around an hour in serene surroundings.

We went through the gardens in October of this year and everything was pretty well spent. The guide thought it was a place of quiet contemplation but we heard a lot of traffic that surrounded the gardens. Not particularly quiet and I'm sure summer would be worse.

The Public Gardens is one of those places I got taken as a child, so every visit is tinted in the watercolours of nostalgia. Feeding the birds was always a focal point, and now that activity is discouraged it's less fun. However, the space is gorgeous with walking trails for those who like the shade as well as those who...
We enjoyed a visit here after walking along the Boardwalk. The gardens are well kept and lots of flowers and plants to photograph. We stopped off for a hot drink at the Cafe which made a good break.

As a gardener I can say this garden is definitely a must see. It is was designed in the 1800's and has gorgeous walking paths lined with so many different trees and shrubs . I love it best in Spring but even in the rain today it was gorgeous. Perfect for a nice walk, it will lift your spirits.

Any Haligonian will tell you that the Public Gardens is a special Victorian Garden and that you should visit. Before we moved to Halifax we visited, found the gardens by accident and rightfully thought that we'd stumbled on a gem. It's not a huge park, but it is truly beautiful at any time of year. Tranquil.

This is a nice garden in downtown area to go to after visiting Halifax Citadel which is right behind it. It must be really nice in the summer, since going in middle of October, only few flowers were still in bloom, a few water fountain were still working. Nice big Gazebo/bandstand for summer concerts.Easy walk back down to the...

A lovely public garden. Well maintained and clean. Not very big but nice for a stroll and to get away from the streets. Pathways are the perfect size for couples as this was designed by the Victorians for two single ladies to walk next to each other with their large skirts! Nice coffee shop here too
We visited the Public Garden while on a tour of Halifax. Even in Kate October there were some flowers in bloom. The grounds are well maintained, and a pleasure to stroll through.
Nice park to get away from the hustle and bustle of small town Halifax. Very central. It's near shopping etc. Nice place to grab a seat and rest up.

A stroll through the beauty and peace of this public garden is sure to calm the nerves of any frazzled traveler. There are a variety of botanicals here, some of which need the be brought indoors for overwintering. Excellent opportunity to study trees. Look for the tree planted by King George and little Queen Elizabeth as you stroll. This is...
We ended in this garden by serendipity. A great place for pictures and relaxation. We enjoyed the fall plants and as a whole the botanical architecture. Very pleasant surprise indeed!

This beautiful garden encompasses one full city block, square. Easily accessible from the waterfront (uphill walk) with great views of Citadel Hill from Sackville St.Lovely wrought iron fencing surrounds the lush garden, which even on this fall day was a lovely green. Nicely maintained gravel paths, architecturally tasteful bridges over the ponds. A large gazebo is the highlight of...
Beautiful and well maintained gardens, lots to see and photograph! Although we didn't do it, we did see signs for a walking tour around the gardens.

If you're looking for some lovely scenery in Halifax, I recommend checking out the gardens. Very beautiful and lots of picture opportunities. Went in mid to late October this year and the leaves were just turning.

One of only two Victorian gardens in Canada (Victoria BC has the other), the Public Gardens are a must-see for every visitor to Halifax.To be classified as a Victorian garden, it must have a wrought-iron fence, bandstand, fountain, pond, bridge, raised flowerbeds and wide pathways. This has them all.It is so peaceful to sit and ponder (a cafe...
A wonderful walking experience including flowers, trees, pond and other water features. The pond features a model of RMS Titanic and a WWII RCN Corvette.

Halifax Public Gardens has beautiful ponds, a gorgeous gazebo, and age old trees that have survived hundreds of years. You don't get this sort of garden, which opened in 1867, everywhere in North America.

The hop on hop off bus took us around the gardens and gave us the history. We went 2x.Oh my goodness!!They are beautiful and it is free!!!We only had one day in town and had already bought tickets for Citidel and did not have time to walk thru and take pics.Next visit will be a long...
Have been here many times through the year is always so nice to experience peacefulness in the centre of the city. Or they do have summer concerts here as well for free, outstanding value !
This is not a large garden area-but it was a lovely respite. We saw the Dalia show and it was spectacular.

This park reminds me of old England. There is a willow tree draping a small hidden pond - a favourite place for ducks and folks who want solitude and/ or quiet conversation. Beautiful flowers and trees throughout the park, a small bridge ....nearby which you may find two swanky swans snoozing.....a safe oasis where kids can play; a stroll that...

When we visited, they were in the midst of re-doing several of the planted areas so I imagine in the summer they are lovely. The garden was created during Victorian times and is laid out as such. Wide paths to allow for full skirts. No animals are allowed in the park, which I thought was interesting. We spent about 20...
I was lucky to have a fantastic sunny day when visiting this beautiful gardens. Pleasure for the eyes and the soul to walk around.
A very relaxing 'time out area' in the middle of Halifax. Beautiful Victorian design. Just duck in for a few minutes to catch your breath or spend some time just sitting on a bench.
Beautiful to visit in summer. Has small creek and bandstand with concerts. The ornate metal entry gates themselves are worth seeing! Also cafe on site. Nice place to relax and read.

In the centre of the city, surrounded by a mix of residential and business buildings, the Public Gardens is the perfect spot to take a break from a busy schedule. Listen to music in the bandstand or feed the ducks while you enjoys the flora!

It is a very beautiful and peaceful place. Walking distance from the Citadel and a great place to rest after a long day walking around the Halifax city center. I went in late September and there was lots of flowers and foliages and very beautiful landscapes. Definitely worth the visit - to walk around or sit by a lake with...
We went to the park first then crossed the road to the citidel. Nice place to relax not busy on Sat am. Different plants to see. Very clean and well tended.

Take a long walk or a short one...........there are plenty of good walkways winding through a large Victorian garden, with the comforting presence of other folks, just as yourself, finding a relaxing and beautiful spot to sit in sun or shade or just browse amongst the beautiful flowers.

This lovely and extensive garden is worth a visit - must be glorious in spring/summer - we were there in the autumn (fall) and the dahlias were amazing! We borrowed a wheelchair from the info/cafe cottage for Mum which meant she could enjoy most of the gardens too and the pushing wasn't too difficult! Very tranquil wandering through the gardens...
This is a must see while in Halifax! We did a bike tour and stopped by only wish we could have spent more time here.
The Halifax Public Garden has an old world feel. A place to stole, contemplate and to pause. It may even inspire a poem or two.

The Halifax Public Gardens is a beautiful garden in the midst of the city. It features some of the most beautiful landscaping with native and non-native flora. You can sit and enjoy the beautiful colours or wander around to all of its little niches. There is even a small café to grab a bite or a java. It's a must-see...

What a wonderful place to visit and see all the fall foliage. They have the gardens arranged so there is abundant color everywhere. So peaceful and tranquil, to sit and just people watch. I can't wait to go back.

Until 2 months ago, I lived across the street from the garden. Now that I moved outside the city centre, I miss the garden. Beautiful place to sit and have a coffee and look at the flowers. Can't go there without getting acquainted to Thelma and Louise (the old geeze) which have been there for years. They still haven't figured...
One of the best Victorian gardens in North America. Not to be missed if you are visiting Halifax. Closed in the Winter.
Wonderful place to stroll around during a visit to Halifax. Superb variety of plants and flowers throughout the garden.
Awesome, peaceful place in the middle of the city. A stroll through this park is good for the soul. It is certainly worth the experience.

In the heart of bustling downtown Halifax lies a peaceful urban oasis, the Halifax Public Gardens. Whether you’re looking for an ideal picnic spot or just want to wander through and take in the gardens it’s a great place to relax for a little while and a nice respite from the busy streets of downtown.

Upon the pond, you'll see a model of the Titanic, reminding all of the importance of Halifax to the story of the Ill fated ship. For our group of six, on a tour with our private guide hired at the cruise port, we found this location to be a pleasant stroll, and imagined how beautiful it must be during the...
Only about a mile from the harbor but it's an uphill climb. You can follow Spring Garden Rd and it's easy to spot. You can go to the citadel from the public garden.
These gardens really are nice place to walk and just relax. There's good atmosphere. A lot of space still everything feels intimate. Go for a walk if you feel stressed out!
Unexpectedly beautiful in October. Well taken care of. Dahlias and Zinnias..even the trees are labeled. Nice stroll in the middle of the city.
This public garden is a lovely place to walk and has several garden spaces to enjoy. We especially enjoyed the dahlias which were in glorious bloom in early October.
Want to picnic? Cute spot inside, gardens are wonderful, too. Have an ice-cream and stroll around, viewing the fantastic flowers everywhere. Remember to check out the water birds as well.

I love the city gardens in England and Europe. The Halifax Public Garden shows its roots in England and Scotland. Lovely strolls among well-maintained flower beds. A snazzy gazebo band shell in the center. A small spot for coffee and snacks. It's not a big garden but it is a beautiful spot, not far from the Citadel and next to...
Nice gardens with an impressive variety of plants, trees and flowers. Very easy to walk and there are many good picture spots.
Beautiful and quiet place to spend your time. The flowers were blooming and the trees were incredible to look at during our visit.
Gravel paths wind through this oasis of trees and plantings. Roses and dahlias plus a gazebo and various sculptures for the landscape.

We visited public gardens on a VERY rainy day, (we weren't expecting rain so we even had to buy an umbrella), but they were beautiful anyway. It's a peaceful and tranquil setting and the flowers and trees were so beautiful the rain didn't even bother us.

We were at the gardens in September, so the Dahlias were in bloom at this time. The weather was spectacular, so were were double lucky. The grounds are very well kept, and it is a relaxing spot in the middle of a city. This is a must for anyone who enjoys flowers!
Still blooming in October. An easy walk. Parking adjacent. Well attended. Plenty of benches for sitting. No pets permitted.

Lovely, free public garden. Visited before Hurricane Matthew's residual rain and winds. At it's fall glory in early October. A gardeners dream. Nice bridges, bandstand, and fauna. Some of the largest aloe plants I have ever seen in Canada. Amazing flowers. The Dalias were wonderful. Lots of varieties never seen before. ute bumble bees hiding in them.

Our group of 6 adults (several passionate gardeners) enjoyed our stroll through the public gardens. It has some lovely varieties of trees, a couple of beautiful fountains and 2 very fat Toulouse geese. Very much worth visiting especially at a complimentary price.
We decided to travel through this park to do through into another part of the city,, amazing gardens, ducks, statues, waterfountains and huge gazebo where outdoor music is played.

If you are in Halifax and the weather is nice you should definitely take a stroll through these gardens. Beautiful flowers and gazebo. Perfect for some nice pictures. If you are strolling leisurely the paths are winding enough that you could spend 20-30 minutes here (or longer). If you have a picnic lunch there are benches you could eat at.
Even in late September, the garden was beautiful! We stopped here on our Segway tour and learned so much about the area and all the quirky rules of the gardens.
Centrally located, free and very pretty!Great place to spend a couple of hours or bring your camera and spend the afternoon. Great mix of families, seniors and students.

We attended the complimentary tour put on by the patrons of the Halifax Public Gardens who volunteer their time to maintain and promote and raise funding from governmental and private funding for maintenance and beautification of the gardens.The design of the S shaped flower gardens was to promote the new gardening sensation, the lawn mower. The flowers are incredible...
Lovely public space - nice for a stroll or take out lunch/picnic if the weather is nice. Read a book or just take in this peaceful space in a busy city under a lot of construction at present.

I was concerned at first that it might be past the season to see the gardens maintained. I was wrong. It was late September when we were there, and the gardens were still beautiful. Also, the weather has cleared out a bit to be more sunny. I great place to visit with couples or families, especially after visiting the Citadel...
Eric with Halifax Tour Guys took us here. Lots of time to explore and enjoy the gardens. They are beautiful and even at this time of year full of flowers, roses and lush ponds and gardens.

Lovely walk around the gardens. An escape from the city. Best part was seeing a miniature replica of the titanic floating in the pond during the wind and rain. Well done. Loved the stream with the mallard ducks swimming around. Flowers were just about past but I'm sure they would be beautiful in the spring and summer.
Beautiful spot! Lovely calm area to stroll through or sit for a while. Wide variety of flowering plants and very old trees. My favourite is the cacti garden. There are ducks and geese to entertain.
This was our second visit to the gardens in recent years. What a beautiful place. The dahlias were in bloom and gorgeous.

Been to Halifax, NS, Canada many times because I am a crew of a cruise ship but I only had one chance to visit this park. It was a sunny day when I visited the place. It's just like a "botanical garden" full of flowering plants, trees, fountains, a lake and even wild ducks. I bet it's also great to...
A nice park in Halifax with some beautiful plants and a lovely band stand. A good place to spend a sunny day.
What a way to kill a couple hours. We came here just to kill some time and it was a great idea, so many beautiful flower gardens, fountains, and ponds. A very relaxing environment!
Try to visit here. Lovely garden, one of the prettiest in Halifax. Many varieties of trees, some not typical to rest of Canada.

after visiting the Citadel we walked down to the public garden. It is a lovely park with fountains and flower gardens, there was a flower growing contest going on the day we were there. Well worth a visit.

was on a cruise and took the hop on hop off bus. We stopped at the gardens and was amazed at the beautiful flowers and the statues in the park. Being the end of September the flowers were still in bloom and one area was prettier than the other
I would suggest that you visit the gardens as it is peaceful place to view a lot of different species of plants, bushes and trees

My first visit to the Halifax Public Gardens was in 2003, just a few weeks before Hurricane Juan struck September, 2003. The park was devastated by the heavy winds. But the Garden reopened Canada Day 2004, thanks to all the efforts of the people of Halifax. When I returned August 2016, the Garden was as splendid as my first experience....

A beautiful piece of Nova Scotia. Gardens were lovely but only one thing the garden was closing and the care taker was exceptionally rude. He wanted us to head for the gate when we still had half hour to look.
Absolutely beautiful. What a surprise to see. So glad we took the time to explore. Even on a rainy day it was worth the time.
This place has well maintained beautiful gardens. We were here in October and there still was plenty of blooms

We visited the gardens as our hotel was opposite the gardens and I am so glad that we did. What a stunning place to stroll through.A great many of the trees/plants are labelled and the displays were wonderful. A breath of fresh air - literally.The small cafe/gift shop in the centre of the gardens is run by local...

As a general rule, parks and gardens aren't much to write home (or Trip Advisor) about, but I really liked this one. I really got a kick out of the geese that are massive. I'd recommend going JUST to see the geese!

Our friends took us to the Public Gardens when we were visiting in Halifax. We loved it! Flower were blooming, even though it was September, and the entire area was so tranquil and beautiful! I wish that it was in MY home town!
Spend a few hours relaxing and strolling through this garden oasis in downtown Halifax. Serene and beautiful beyond words.
Me and a few friends walked through the garden, mainly because I was visiting and they were looking for "touristy" things for me to do!!! I loved the plants and how well maintained the grounds were..

Nice large park which is pretty well maintained right in the middle of downtown halifax.. A nice picnic area and place for children to run around at the end.. Some nice varieties of Dahlia- about 50+ varieties atleast..good for a couple hours..It has a washroom and a cafe too inside..

A beautiful oasis in the middle of a historic city. We were there on a sunny Sunday afternoon and enjoyed the music in the park at the lovely old gazebo bandstand. I commend the park on having lots of bench seating for people to listen to the music and around the park. Smart.
Just to sit and enjoy the beautiful gardens on a sunny day is breathtaking. I feel it is an attraction that is not advertised enough to the visiting public.

If it's a nice day in Halifax, you'd be wise to spend at least part of it in the public gardens. Even in late September, the plants were in terrific bloom and it was lovely to wander around and enjoy the variety of offerings. We also had ice cream at Sugah!, and while it didn't outdo the ultra-creamy Cows version,...

The Public Garden is a must see. All volunteers make this garden happen. We visited with a Segway tour & heard all the details of the hurricane that destroyed it - to the volunteers that rebuilt it - to the planting of trees by the Queen & family on visits to the city - to the meticulous pruning of weeds...

Just across the street from the Citadel, this beautiful English Garden offers a wonderful escape from the hustle and bustle of a busy city. With its lovely paths winding through gardens of a wide variety of flowers and trees, pond and fountains, this is a great location to take a break and relax.
We stumbled upon this beautiful park while searching for the Citadel. This is a great place for a stroll and to enjoy the flowers and trees and other plants.
Calm oasis with lots of plants and displays. Very quiet, and nice place to go for a gentle walk around with one's mother.

had the pleasure of visiting halifax for a week so had to make time of the gardens. ended up having two specific visits and other walk throughs. weather first class. lots of effort gone into these gardens. a relaxing and peaceful place to unwind and relax yet in the middle of the town. many of the trees clearly been there...
We enjoyed all of the beautiful plants and flowers. We also enjoyed just sitting and watching all the folks who walked through the gardens
So much beauty in the heart of a beautiful city....it's my fav place to stroll when the weather's nice!!! It's a perfect escape to relax and enjoy nature ;) my fav spot !!!!
Love the public gardens. Always have. Great place for a stroll or sit on a bench and read or people watch. I always visit when I am in Halifax
It is central and small so very doable at any time of the year. Roses in late September. See the band stand.
We were in Halifax for a couple days. This garden is a short ( up hill ) walk from the waterfront. It has beautiful variety of flowers, ponds and walkways.

My husband, cousin, and I visited the Halifax Public gardens recently and although we are getting towards the end of the season the gardens were still beautiful.. Many dahlias were blooming as well as some other beautiful annuals. A lovely Victorian garden.

This is a pretty location in the centre of Halifax. There are plenty of benches to sit or you can stroll easily around the park. The ducks are very friendly, clearly they were expecting to be fed- please don't.There is also a lovely tea house where you can grab a light lunch or a snack.It's a very pretty...
These gardens were really pretty and it was a nice way to take a moment to relax on our jam-packed trip in Halifax.
A lovely leisurely place to spend time walking or resting. Beautifully kept flower beds. Enjoyed the Dahlia beds.
Lovely gardens - well taken care of - enjoyed the peaceful walk enjoying plant life from all corners of the world - a 'must' see !
This is a nice public park, minutes away from the Halifax Citadel, to stroll around and admire well-thought out plant & tree arrangements. It is not huge so don't plan spending hours here.
Great place to stop if you're on a cruise. Many acres of beautiful flora. We were quite surprised to see pink roses this late in the season.

This is an extremely well designed and well maintained English garden that is a highlight of any trip to Halifax. Even in late September the garden is in excellent maintenance and is a tremendous place to spent a morning or afternoon wandering through the flowers.

The Halifax public gardens were really nice, but probably not at peak when we visited...due to the time of the year as well as the draught that area has been experiencing. None the less it was still very enjoyable. They also have an ice cream shop right in the garden, with a great spot to sit and enjoy your ice...
The Gardens are adjacent to the Citadel property and comprise 16 or so acres of gardens, ponds and sculptures. It is free; there are concerts on Sundays. It is very peaceful.
Lovely gardens to walk through. Very beautiful and well maintained. We enjoyed sitting in the sun even though it was a chilly day.
Beautiful and peaceful place in the heart of the city with a lot of history. It has survived some hurricanes and storms but retains its Victorian elegance.
The Public Gardens are true Victorian Gardens, complete with fountains, statues, band stand (gazebo), ponds, and serpentine shaped flower arrangements. The dahlia section is particularly beautiful.

Easy to get to and not so big to get lost but big enough to take a leasurely stroll. Lots of different flora and fauna and situated in downtown close to the business area but far enough away to be well situated.

Our tour stopped at the gardens and we truly enjoyed the beauty of the gardens. Lots of color, unique plantings, simply refreshing!Even though there were school kids and cruise ships in town, it did not feel crowded.

We thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Victorian public garden in Halifax. Especially the amazing Dahlia collection and the gazebo and fountain. Open only about 4 months a year, definitely worth a visit.
The Halifax Public Gardens are a "must see" while you are visiting Halifax. We strolled through beautiful flowers and thoroughly enjoyed the "quiet time and space" in the middle of bustling Halifax.

We had a beautiful stroll through here on a fine September day. The gardens are really beautiful and so well tended. Being English, it reminded me of my childhood.... until we went into the little café and asked for 'tea'. Over here, there are no questions, over there several questions were needed :) It was a lovely place though and...

We popped into the gardens after a busy day at Pier 21 & The Citadel, hoping to enjoy a later afternoon cup of tea & a treat at the café. We had a lovely walk through the grounds where the warmth of late September meant many flowers were still in full bloom. This hadn't gone unnoticed as several large groups...

This is the second time my husband and I have visited this garden, and we were just as impressed the second time as the first. It is truly a feast for the eyes and a soothing, peaceful place to be. It is amazing how beautiful it is and what variety of trees and flowers are there. It never seems crowded...

The Halifax Public Grdens are one of the oldest Victorian Gardens in North America. Situated in the city centre they provide a wonderful opportunity to take a stroll amongst beautiful flowers, shrubs and trees from all over the world. There is a lovely old band stand that has weekly musical shows with lots of places to sit and listen to...

The park was very pleasant to walk thru. It had a nice mix of water features, flower beds, grass and benches to sit on. There was a snack shop that seemed to be reasonable priced. A nice place to visit on a hot day.
Nice scenery, lots of plants nice location in the center of a busy area, great for photos and relaxing
Great gardens and features. Nice sunny day and the flowers were all out and the park was full of people. Visit is free and was a great first place to visit in Halifax.
Very nice municipal garden....nicely laid out and very well maintained...ponds, lots of benches, tea house.....freeGreat for an hours leisurely walkRecommended
very pretty gardens with quite a variety of different flowers, shrubs and trees. excellent for a nice stroll in the park

This place used to be so much better than it is now. No running, no dogs allowed, no walking on the grass, no picnics. Pretty much, stay on the path and look at the flowers. When I was younger we used to come here for picnics with our family dog, but those days are no more. Still a great spot...

One of my favourite spots in Halifax. I love all the gardens and the beauty of it. A great spot for a picnic or to sit and relax. I always visit when I am in the Halifax area. One of the last Victorian gardens I believe. Make sure to visit the lake with the two small boats - one is...

Take the walk to this lovely garden, still preserved from it's original layout. Go when the weather is good and the flowers are in bloom. More care could be given to the ponds. A freebie for those on a budget.
Nice park in the centre of the city to go for a stroll. Perfect for young kids to let off some steam or for a picnic.
Beautiful peaceful place to stroll in heart of city . Many stunning rose flower beds as well as other quite unique displays . Was not in gardens for concert but would have been enjoyable I'm sure .
The Halifax Public Gardens are quiet and peaceful. It's great to unwind here and take some photos. When a Cruise boat gets in, this is a busy place with city tours.

Spending a couple of hours in this wonderful historical garden in the middle of the city is pure pleasure. This is a masterpiece of sophisticated horticulture which is so well-planned that the visitor feels as if he is in nature. Enormous ancient trees, a burbling brook, a pond, Victorian statues, beautiful flowers and a cafe serving excellent coffee and pastries:...

The gardens are 10 minutes away from the citadel and perhaps 20 from the harborside. The gardens could use an upgrade in planting and maintenance but has nice walkways places to sit, and a lovely central bandstand. It's not a critical stop but a welcome respite from the business of sight seeing.
This is a free formal public garden. It is quite popular. A leisurely stroll through the garden is well worth the effort.
Great place for a nice walk a lot of nice flowers! I loved it, this was my first time here and I'm glad I went, definitely worth to stop by, its beautiful

We have the opportunity to visit here in Sept 2016, though it may be at the end of the flower growing season both my wife and I were amazed by the beauty of the gardens overall and the flowers. This really is a must see in Halifax. The local residents must be so proud of this attraction as it is...

During our first visit to Halifax, two couples strolled through the Public Garden on a drizzling afternoon. The flowers were absolutely gorgeous! Most of the paths are stone dust so that there were few puddles. The only knock is that the park is somewhat small and can be covered in about 45 minutes....including picture taking.

My husband and I had a lovely time here checking out the history and trees for a geocache puzzle. My garden club made a donation here after Hurricane Juan. It's great to see the gardens are nice again after losing so many beautiful trees.
The public garden is adjacent to the Citadel via a short walk. It is only 19 acres but the flowers and small ponds are beautifully laid out. It is a perfect area to take a short break.
This a very beautiful historic park. If you are even a little interested in horticultural, you must not miss this site. Amazingly beautiful trees and flowers, ponds, fountains, gazebos and so on.

Our organized van tour stopped here and gave us plenty of time to stroll around. It's absolutely beautiful in mid-September. It's very easy to get to from most hotels in the downtown area, so if you have been cooped up in a conference, escape for a nice walk. Visually stunning and filled with life.

The Victorian public gardens open in 1867. Even if you're not an avid gardener or horticulturist, a stroll in and around the gardens is a feast for the senses. Sit for a while, people watch, listen to a live performance, marvel at the flora - and best of all, it's free! The gardens are located In the heart of the...

If you are looking for a restful and quiet place in the heart of the city this is it. Great place for lunch breaks or just for strolling. Plenty of ducks and geese roam the gardens. Lots of beautiful flowers, trees and other plants. There is a bandstand in the middle of the gardens and on certain days has a...

Stroll the boardwalk, check out the shops featuring all sorts of products made in Canada, try a local favorite-the poutine- have an ice cream from Cow's, visit the fascinating exhibits of the Maritime Museum and expect to spend at least a half day having fun and mingling with a wonderful variety of people.
I had forgotten just how beautiful a jewel this is. Grab a coffee on Spring Garden Road, and wander this free park at will. Gorgeous!

Spent an afternoon in the gardens on a late summer afternoon they are well kept and although there were lots of people about they were still very calm and peace full gardens would recommend spending time here
It's a pretty garden but it's also pretty small. It was on our way and I'm glad we stopped but I would not make a detour to go there.

I was looking forward to a Sunday afternoon stroll here as I visited my university student son. We arrived at the enclosure after reading great reviews to see a sign say "no dogs". Why, in an outdoor garden, would dogs not be allowed? Most dog owners, including myself, are responsible and ensure the dogs are clean and not a nuisance....
beautifully maintained gardens, peaceful and relaxing with plenty to look at. The lake is lovely, there are some statues around there as well.
We walked around the park while eating homemade ice cream. it is a beautiful park near the center of town.
This is a favorite spot each time I visit Halifax. Very clean and well kept up. Perfect for strolling, relaxing and educating yourself. The ice cream is place is a bonus!
Spent the afternoon walking - it was beautiful, relaxing and restful - worth taking some time!! The bandstand was so fun and the flowers were stunning!!
Beautiful, worth seeing! It is a small city park that is very calming. Nice for a short walk or à picnic.
This very well kept park is jam-packed with beautiful trees and flowers from all over the world. Spring, summer or fall, there are always an abundance of flowers! Must see every month!

Even with all the construction everywhere in the city, this was a beautiful and relaxing place. You can tell the city has been experiencing a drought, but the gardens have been maintained with water from the large pond in the middle of the exhibit. There is a large variety of trees and plants. Lots of benches to just sit and...

Absolutely stunning gated park. Immaculately kept. Check out the fountains, lake, gazebo and especially the cafe in the old church/school house. There are many entrances and exits from the park so explore at a whim.

A real Victorian garden in the heart of Halifax. Bandstand, ponds, fountains, large walkways and of course flowers and plants. It is small and easy walking but you see so much! Plan for a peaceful, relaxing time of at least an hour.

I haven't been to this park in years and I was so delighted that I took the opportunity to stop by again and check it out beautifully landscaped, flowers, the pond and gazebo just a beautiful spot! Love the rod iron entrance just so much history felt here.

I walk through here often and it's beautiful all year long. I just think it's unfortunate you can't enjoy all the seasons.Anyway the place feels rich with old school ambience. Halifax is one of North America's oldest cities and you can really feel it strolling through the lanes here. It's something you're unlikely to experience out West and something...

We enjoyed sitting on the porch of the cafe inside the park drinking our beverage and admiring the beautiful gazebo and the flowers surrounding it. We enjoyed our stroll thru the park with the lovely gardens.
Strolled through here after doing the harbor hopper tour to enjoy the late afternoon.Ground were well kept. Flowers gorgeous, and the people all friendly.
People, plants and more: plentiful and beautiful. It is an old haunt for me as I took my son there all the time when he was 2 and he is now 27 so this gives it a special feeling for me.
The park is great to visit. But it is only open in late spring and closes in early fall. You can take pictures on the paths only. Unless otherwise instructed.

Amazing spot in the middle of the city. Quiet and lush and very well landscaped, they do a great job taking care of the Gardens. Great place to have your lunch, take a walk or just park on a bench and breathe in the fresh air.
Wonderful place to stroll and inhale the natural scents...right in the middle of the city! Truly beautiful!

Lots of benches, lots of water views, lats of space to sit on the grass. A number of groups (exercise, knitting etc.) convene there. There is a small restaurant with a small menu but good for a quick snack or to quench a thirst.
Walked here and enjoyed the gardens on a weekend afternoon. Lots going on, - totally relaxing and enjoyable.
Beautiful gardens. Very well maintained. Reasonable admission fee. Friendly staff. Clean toilets. Very peaceful.

This garden is a real delight. The variety of plants and flowers, water features and the intricate design of the garden are something which one does not see anymore. There were a number of interesting memorials, as well, to various wars.
Walked through on a very warm September day, and found this to be a lovely oasis of calm in the city. Charming and so pretty.

Grab a coffee and snack and take your time wandering through these well maintained and peaceful gardens. You can enter from a number of places off the surrounding streets. They offer a Sunday afternoon concert series if you like to sit and enjoy some music, Nice pond area with lots of seating. You can take a quick walk through or...

Gorgeous park within the city, well maintained and really worth a visit. I was doing my morning run and saw the garden/park so I decided to enter and continue my run. I was approached by a staff who gently told me running is not permitted inside, oooopps my bad. Pets are not allowed inside too. But park is beautiful and...
A quiet place to walk and enjoy the flowers. A wonderful place to visit when walking around in the city.
Lush flowering colorful flowers. A quiet respite downtown. Lovely place for a stroll. We went there at the end of a busy day and appreciated the benches and views
A great place to bring a blanket, have a picnic, and relax. We only had an hour here but could have spent a whole day if not on a cruise ship. Wonderful display of flowers. Beautiful and tranquil.
Walked here from the waterfront. Lovely place to walk through with beautiful planting seeds. Place to have something to drink and a snack. Lots of benches

As someone who has been to other garden environments, I can say that this public garden gives all of them a good run for their money. Longwood Gardens is an attraction touted in my area, & I found the public to comparable in beauty, organization, maintenance. It also is not as pretentious in its displays, you get the feel that...

It's one of the finest surviving examples of a Victorian Garden in North America and isrecognized as a National Historic Site in 1984, They have a Dahlia garden the is just amazing. I never knew there were so many beautiful dahlias. There are gazebos with music in the summer, ponds with different flowers and benches all along the way...
Very pretty and manicured gardens. It's a bit of a climb up from the water but the paths through the gardens are lovely.
Fascinating garden in the middle of downtown Halifax. Well maintained, fountains, washrooms, even ice cream. Across the street from the Lord Nelson.
Nicely located and a beautiful display of flowers and shrubs. Great for a slow walk taking photos. And it's free! Well done Halifax!

We walked through this garden and we were very impressed with the variety and quality of the flowers and trees as well as the monuments. The garden is free. Parking is free. The garden is full of local people as well as tourists and it is definitely worth a stop.

The public gardens are a lovely place for a nice walk with friends, family or solo. The city does a great job with the flowers and maintaining the gardens during the spring/summer seasons :).It's a popular place for wedding and prom pictures, but it's usually not too busy :).
We enjoyed an hour or so walking in these lovely gardens. A large variety of people, from families with children to older couples.

Extremely relaxing. Very colourful gardens and a pleasant walk. This is almost in the center of the city 16 full acres of park and gardens. Lot of ducks and geese . Really took the time to look at what can be grown. Yes they had pine apples, coffee trees and even figs. This is well worth the visit. You might...
well kept grounds. quiet spot to relax or read a book.gated are even a secutiy guard.nice walk,,a little walk ffrom downtown area
Beautiful garden with excellent maintenance, an oase in the city. Dahlia flowers where in prefect condition, just before the Dahlia day celebration

We took a taxi up the hill and after visiting the Citadel we took a small leisurely walk to the gardens. It was a wonderful experience. The stroll around was a very relaxing. The gardens were well kept and inviting. I would highly recommend seeing this public garden.

Wonderful, well cared for public park & garden with an excellent display of trees, shrubs & flowers. Where ever you wander be it around the park area or the lakes walking is easy & there is shade on those hot dyas
It's a short walk from the waterfront, but well worth it. It's well tended and tranquil and a pleasant place to sit and watch the world go by.

Once spring start it open back to public. Different kind of tree ,plants and flowers. Each labeled with the name and some detial of where it came from. Relaxing spot to sit and unwind. A small coffee shop. Area to sit and have a picnic.
Many good trees and gardens....I was especially interested in the King George Tree....Tree was planted by King George VI of England in 1939....Interesting to see history right in front of me!
Up the hill from the Waterfront, follow Spring Garden straight up, while window shopping. Lovely gardens across from Lord Nelson Hotel.

This garden is centrally located with many shops and restaurants within a block or two. The maintenance of the gardens is as good or better than I've seen anywhere in the world. Take the time to relax on a bench or listen to music when an event is happening on the bandstand.Not to be missed.
This is my favorite place to visit in Halifax, so many beautiful quiet spots!!! And the cafe has great coffee and treats!!!

We walked to the gardens from our Marriott hotel.We were impressed. Beautiful mixed with peaceful. We walked every path and checked out most of the beautiful plants.Plenty of people were enjoying the gardens but that did not take away from our experience.We spent a couple of hours in the gardens. You will find plenty of places to...

Totally worth the effort to visit. Lovely, varied plantings, with a small lake and water birds. Historic bandstand at the center, and multiple gardens with a wide variety of species. Dahlia collections especially notable.
Nice place for a quiet wander in the morning. An on site coffee and pastry shop is a worthwhile stop. There is a beautiful gazebo and several pathways around the property.

A must see for those who have a passion for gardening. Flowers, shrubs and trees will fill your eyes with delight! Amazing fountains, ponds and benches are everywhere throughout the gardens. Take your camera and stroll the pathways through a marvellous setting.
Nice gardens, ponds and birds. It sounds boring but even my two teens enjoyed the 45 minute relax mode we took strolling through this park.

It is a Sunny Saturday, with scattered clouds in a deep blue sky. The Gardens are still in full blooms, even the lovely roses. The quite swishing of the leaves and the birds songs as you enjoy the stroll, add a lovely background.It is a Serene place to spend lazy afternoons, a morning walk or a full day, for...

The Halifax Public Gardens truly are a jewel in this lovely city's crown. We were on the hop-on-hop-off bus during a cruise port-of-call and stopped here for a relaxing stroll amid the lovely plantings. The groundskeepers were in full swing caring for the plants and there was a beautiful dahlia exhibition underway. There are many picture-worthy sights in the garden...

Wonderful place to visit and stroll around. Grounds are very beautiful and lots of friendly people to talk with. Seemed to be lots of special exhibits as well. Nice little pond with replicas of ships floating. Just a great place for a leisurely stroll.
We strolled through the gardens on a hot afternoon and it was lovely. Lots of families with small children, older folks visiting, people sitting reading and just enjoying the sunshine.
Lots of paths, awesome fat geese, lots of beautiful flowers.Ice available but I did not try. Often go here for a walk. ???
There was a great concert for "Natal Day"---yes I know, weird, not Naval!!!Free soda, bottled water and Cake!There is a coffee shop/ice cream place with the best ever ice cream!

A must do for any person visiting Halifax. Also the only monument to Crimean war veterans in Canada. Family friendly and a great time for any age . lastly it is also a pokemon go Hotspot , biggest in Halifax.
It was very nice walking around, lots of flowers (dahlias were in bloom!) and several fountains. Fun for the whole family!

We entered the Gardens on the lower side near the Citadel and walked counter clock wise around the large park which has ponds, a variety of structures, statues and flower beds including a special rose and dahlia display. There are many plagues to explain what one is looking at and the historical significance of some features. No running is allowed...

This place is a respite from the hustle and bustle that surrounds it. The paths are lined with trees and flower beds, and watching the ducks in the duck pond is a nice way to spend a few minutes. There are occasional concerts in the bandstand and don't forget to get an ice cream!

We are very fortunate in the City of Halifax to have a beautiful Victorian Garden in the heart of the city. Many people have Wedding Photos taken there and at Graduation time the cameras are out again as the Gardens has thousands of different flowers and colours . A must visit to Halifax for anyone that loves nature and flowers
I have many childhood memories coming to the gardens. Nothing has changed here since I was a kid, 40 years ago.Clean and simply beautiful. Take a stroll and stop to smell the flowers.

Very easy to walk around. Beautiful flowers, trees, and lay out. Bathrooms are available. We actually just sat on a bench and watched the swans and birds enjoy the lake (along with the boats). Worth the visit

Stopped by on a walking bus tour. Beautiful grounds. We only had 30 minutes and would love to have more time and a picnic lunch there to really take in the beauty and tranquility. Worth the time so don't miss it.
We enjoyed strolling through the gardens. It was a relaxing and beautiful spot, and the price was right (FREE!).
This city garden was beautifully maintained and I full bloom at thee d of August. The arrangements are simple and surrounded by plenty of grass to set them off. It is simple but striking.
Amazing collection of plants in a compact area. The park is not large but has a beautiful collection of local and exotic plants. A good network of trails make easy access for the whole area.
The dahlias are in bloom and the garden is full of color. Dahlia Day is on Wednesday, August 31, 2016 so be sure to stop by. This is the nicest place in Halifax to relax and go for a stroll.

The public gardens are beautiful. Walking trails with benches so you can enjoy the gardens. Areas with shade and sun. Plenty of public parking available if you are not walking. No entrance fee like some botanical gardens.
Well worth the time to walk around this timeless place. Reminded me of Hyde Park in London. Well cared for and respected- how lucky to have this beautiful space on your doorstep!

It was kind of relaxing to have a walk there. Nice flowers, free admission, delicious ice cream. If you are not a big fan of flowers, you will still enjoy the walk. If you love flowers, definitely worth to visit.

We had some time to kill on a Sunday afternoon. We were surprised to catch a free concert that added to our enjoyment go the gardens. Very Old Empire. The only thing missing was the band playing. Lovely garden, very pleasant place to visit. A nice little ice cream and coffee place near the centre. Watch out, though. The ice cream helpings are not only delicious, they are enormous!

Wasn't planning on visiting gardens, have seen many but we were running out of things to do in Halifax for our 4 day stay so we visited. It was awesome and we are happy we did.

We vacationed 10 minutes from this incredibly beautiful place. We were nearing the end of a two week trip in the Maritimes. We chose to visit these gardens last minute. It was a peaceful and relaxing way to end our trip. Every city needs one of these. What a beautiful spot to wander, relax and reconnect. Just amazing, a must see when visiting Halifax.

Easy to see why the Halifax Public Gardens are the number one attraction in Halifax. The Halifax Public Gardens are Victorian era public gardens formally established in 1867, the year of Canadian Confederation. The gardens are located in the Halifax Regional Municipality, Nova Scotia on the Halifax Peninsula near the popular shopping district of Spring Garden Road and opposite Victoria Park. The gardens were designated a National Historic Site of Canada in 1984.[

if you want to smell flower and discover trees this is the place ,if you enjoy music that is at the gazebo walk and bring a lunch to enjoy the fountians there is a place that sells coffe and small plates of food

This was not the first time I've walked through the gardens but it was a new discovery all the same. Halifax public gardens is a beautiful spot in the middle of the bustling city of Halifax. Lots of beauty to surround you and people and animals to watch.

I have always enjoyed a walk through the Public Gardens. It lets me bring my mind down a notch or two and to just come to the realization that there's more to life than whatever is taking my attention at the moment. Wonderful gardens with great comfort and convenient viewing paths, benches, etc. flowers in colorful bloom and designed showings.

We visited in August and loved these gardens. The dahlias were exceptional. The beds were well maintained and beautifully landscaped. A great place to relax and enjoy peaceful reflection in the middle of an urban centre. Wonderful that it's free to everyone and lots of shade to sit and soak up the beauty. It's nice you can enter it at so many spots, very accessible!

Beautiful plants, great variety. Obviously a lot of care and thought went into planning these gardens. Highlights include a large succulent bed, a duck pond, interesting trees, a gazebo, and many paths.

I could spend hours here. There are ample benches and places to lie in the grass. There is an open grass area to play with your kids or do yoga (or anything else). I would so recommend these Gardens. There is so much variety of plants, trees and foliage and it is very well labeled. The current exhibit of Dahlias is wonderful.

This Victorian garden is so well planned and maintained that I was in awe from the moment I entered the gate off Spring Garden Street. Lovely place to wander and spend an hour or two... and on Spring garden Road in Halifax ... close to all things you want ... Citadel, Pier 21, Point Pleasant Park, etc

Beautiful flower arrangements ... And garden has a lot of creativity in it. They do need to dig out the pond though.
