Lovely for a quite wander, a place to read and a wonderful spot to take photos. Stunning flower gardens and majestic old trees.

This lush green gem in the heart of the city of Halifax provided an amazing experience for my friends tonight during your vacation. In spite of the numerous Pokémon Go players who were quite a bother to deal with, the garden was otherwise very nice and well-tended. The garden has a gazebo which should be opened up to the public.
This garden was what I liked the best in Halifax. It is a beautiful park with beautiful gardens where you can find all kind of plants and flowers, it is well kept and the best of all: it is free!

Our son is a horticulturalist, so we try to visit botanical gardens whenever we can. This one is located right in the middle of Halifax, NS and was beautiful. I thought it was prettier than the Botanical Garden in Montreal, Quebec. Nice walking paths, places to sit, with plants identified. There is a small shop when you enter and can...

Well laid out, not very big, with pond and plenty of flowers / interesting trees. Statues are a bit militaristic for my taste. Nice for a quick visit or to sit on a bench and read a book. Very close to the citadel, so can visit that next.

A lovely, free, public garden in downtown Halifax. Garden was diagonally located behind The Citadel, and easy walking distance to downtown/harbor area. Flowers, fountains, and pavilion all appeared to be well maintained; nice quiet respite for 1-2 hours.
We happened upon this public garden with rhododendrons in full bloom. It provided a beautiful respite for people wanting to rest from all the wonderful things in Halifax!
Always something to see in this great botanical display in the heart of the city! If you are close by be sure to step inside!

A great treat. The garden was in full bloom with lovely and charming plantings, from callas to roses, all sorts of trees. We came inJuly, and the pink dogwood was in full bloom, which we Southerners see in March and April. Ponds and fountains, sculptures and a Victorian bandstand.
These gardens are beautiful, and free to visit. It's truly a charming spot, well set up for wandering and picnicking. This was my favorite thing in Halifax.

Lovely, lovely gardens with meandering paths by babbling brooks. Fountains in good working order adding to the ambiance. This gem is nestled in the city proper within walking distance of most downtown areas.Quite an impressive array of plantings, neat as a pin, a feast for the eyes and soul. Very family friendly but I believe dogs are prohibited.If...
Visited in the late spring with family. Have visited in summer months when many flora in bloom. Family friendly. Bathrooms and ice cream shop.
Such a beautiful park in the middle of the city. Quiet and tranquil! lots of benches to take a seat. flowers are just stunning
Beauitful place to go for a walk or to have a picnic in Halifax. Just a peaceful place to relax and unwind. Great place to people watch or to feed the ducks.
Loved the gardens and gazebo with chairs set up. Little house with ice cream fudge and baked goods was great. Gardens beautiful and very well kept. Lovely place to strol
I always love to visit the Public Gardens and stroll when I have time when in Halifax. The property is so well cared for and it is wonderful seeing so many people enjoying this gift of the city.
After spending 7 days on a bus, this was the perfect place for us to stretch and unwind. It is meticulously tended and seems to be as appreciated by residents as tourists
The gardens are not spectacular but the overall experience in walking through the park and sitting on a bench was levely.
Nice park, lovely gardens. But I'm surprised it has such a high rating, I've definitely seen more impressive gardens. Good to visit but not a must-see
Wonderful public gardens in the middle of the city. Free admission, great landscaping, excellent photo opportunities.

This was a stop on a cruise excursion tour. The gardens are truly beautiful! This is a Victorian Garden with a love gazebo, several sculptures, a fountain, a pond, and fancy shaped flower beds. It is a lovely green spot in the middle of the city. It is a great place to pass pleasant time in lovely surroundings. Restrooms and...

This garden is a cornucopia of trees, flowers, fountains, ponds, birds and people. What a lovely place to share a picnic, read a book, relax, explore and even listen to music preformed at the band stand.

What a gift this garden is to the city!Halifax's own version of Central Park (on a much smaller scale). This park is also in the middle of the city, an incredible oasis from traffic and business. There is also a charming coffee house on the Spring Garden side where you can grab an ice cream and take it along...

The walk around this incredible garden is such a treat. The history alone is worth the visit, not to mention the amazing flowers, plants and fountains! One great perk is it is located in the downtown core, with so many other great stopping places. The walk is easy and suitable for all ages. There is an ice-cream shop open in...
Gardens are very pretty and well maintained. If you're an avid gardener it's worth the trip. If not, there's lots of other things I'd put ahead of it on the list to see.

What a delight to find a free beautiful garden - perfect for looking at flowers and a nice shaded stroll. It's a bonus that there are public bathrooms that are clean, and a lovely little teahouse with delightful date bars and other treats. This is just a short walk down from the Citadel so you can plan on visiting both....

This formal Victorian garden lies right in the heart of Halifax. It is beautifully laid out and the symmetry is a thing to behold. As a photographer, I love gardens. So, I seek them out in any area I visit. This was worth the trip (A little over an hour from our Truro campground).It was a bright sunny day....

Did this garden as part of the Titanic Tour with Paul McNeil and it was absolutely gorgeous. Well manicured and extremely healthy foliage. It's very evident to appreciate the amount of work to maintain and re-plant the more tropical species in this garden. The day we visited was sunny approximately 20 degrees C and everything was so lush and green!...
Nice public garden with some fountains, statues, gazebo and beautiful plants and trees. Next to the Halifax Citadel.
These are very nice gardens to stroll through. There are benches scattered throughout to sit down and enjoy the scenery and watch the ducks. Lots of great spots for taking pictures.

These beautiful gardens boasted bright, diverse colours coming from all the flowers. A great place for a stroll. There is a small cafe located in gardens where you can stop for water/coffee/tea.No fee for entrance.
This is a beautiful little gem in the city. It's a great Victorian garden. When you leave, take a walk down Spring Garden Road to see some sort shops & many other sites in the city.

Its not often you find a garden maintained by a city in such beautiful shape with such attention to the horticultural details that this garden exhibits. The thoughtful perennial planting designs are well thought out and striking in their maturity. The annual planting beds on the other hand are not so successful - I don't know how long their growing...
The gardens are great for all, families with children or anyone who appreciates a relaxing pretty location. There is a lovely bandstand with a free concert Sunday afternoons
We went through the gardens on probably the hottest day of the year. They were beautiful, and interesting. The history and care taken with the gardens is evident in every corner.

Great walk through a beautiful but totally charming public garden-really more of a park but dogs are not allowed. I can't think of a better place to sit and read and people watch while staying downtown. Lovely!
The garden is beautiful and a wonderful place to spend a half-hour or more. Bring your camera, and maybe a book to read.
These gardens is the oldest Victorian Garden in Nova Scotia. The entire 15-acre garden is well-cared for and beautiful. Well worth a visit.

Visiting Halifax from Atlanta, Georgia we are used to the world famous Atlanta Botanical Gardens. Halifax Public Gardens was well worth the visit. It is tranquil, colorful, and lush. The gardens are centrally located and walking through them feel like you could be in Paris. There are beautiful Victorian fountains, a very pretty gazebo, all surrounded by lovely landscaping.

This is a great garden to walk around! Beautiful landscaping and fountains, close to shopping and leads to the big central library which is another must see if you love architecture or libraries. Must go if you love parks and gardens!

Part of the Victorian history of Halifax these gardens, like so many public spaces in the city, are wonderfully maintained by the city authorities.Walking around the many floral displays, trees and plants from around the world as well as the well-kept bandstand is very relaxing and enjoyable. They say they have trees and plants from every continent and most...
The gardens were great. Many blooming flowers and water displays. The pathways wind around in the park and give you one peace from a busy day.

Even on an overcast morning the gardens were beautiful. No admission is charged and you can wander at will or take an organized tour if you plan ahead. The city is obviously proud of this space and maintains it well. You don't have to be a gardener to appreciate the gardens---just appreciate all the delight they offer the eye.

This is a well-used public park in the city with lovely plantings, fountains, ponds. We enjoyed out time here and chose to return a few times to enjoy the beauty of the place. It's one of the prettiest public parks that we've visited.

What a wonderful jewel in the middle of the city! The gardens were stunning, with a wide variety of plantings. The park was much larger than anticipated, with ponds and bridges and walking trails. A really nice way to spend some quiet time. My entire family, including teenagers and grandma enjoyed it.

An enjoyable place to walk and relax in the midst of downtown Halifax. Very beautiful. The trees are labelled which I always like -- would have appreciated the same for the flowers. Lots of different areas to wander through with plenty of benches to sit and relax. There were lots of people sitting and reading. There is a cafe/ice cream...
The public gardens are wonderful! The space is easily accessible with lovely paths for all. The plants are kept wonderfully healthy and the colors are vibrant. Taking a stroll is a real treat!

This block of public gardens is a beautiful place to spend time and reflect, however I found it was quite crowded. My opinion could be bias though as I went on Canada day and many more people would be out walking around then normal. I could still see it being quite busy on a normal day as it is in...
We wandered through the gardens and appreciated their beauty. A band was playing a concert in the gazebo, which we enjoyed.
there is no charge to stroll through these beautiful gardens. The flowers are awsome and clean rest rooms.

Delightful, fun, interesting, varied, great for the whole family. Understand they have many different events over the summer. Terrific coffee shop, ice cream, clean washrooms, and the fun just keeps going.

We were able to walk from our hotel near the waterfront to this park. What a lovely spot to explore, look at all the gardens, statues and water features. Very relaxing and lovely, good clean washrooms on site and a cafe as well.
Public Gardens is a beautiful setting for the grandchildren.We loved our stroll and visit with the ducks and fish!Awesome ice cream at the cafe!

We, in Halifax, have the good fortune to have this gem in the middle of the city. It is located a few minute walk from the shopping district. It is an oasis free from bikes so a leisurely stroll is the order of the day. There is plenty of opportunity to watch the resident geese, enjoy the old trees and...
This is worth the walk through the gardens that are well maintained and found it surprising to have free outdoor concerts!

I've spent time in Halifax before, but never had a chance to experience the beauty of the Halifax Public Gardens! Walking through the beautiful iron gates was amazing. Walking along the paths and seeing the beauty of all the different trees and the flowers was breath-taking. The smell of the flowers walking by was wonderful.The fountains and bridges were just...
A beautiful Victorian garden in the heart of Halifax. A lovely place to take a picnic lunch. On Sunday's throughout the summer a band plays in the afternoon. Take a book and be with nature.

These gardens are very well-maintained. They're in the style of the traditional Victorian gardens found across the UK. Of course, weather will play a part - I visited on Canada day and there were plenty of people there enjoying everything that was going on.
Great way to kill a couple hours without spending money!! Nice and relaxing to just walk around and enjoy the beauty.
In 2009 my then boyfriend proposed outside of the gardens at night so it was awesome to come visit with our three year old. Really beautiful and lots to see!
Definitely worth a visit in the summer. We visited on Canada Day, gorgeous flowers, loved the Victorian feel and history behind this park. Great live music this day at the Gazebo!
But worth a visit if the sun is out and the birds are singing .The planting reminded us of England with lots of similar species .
Beautiful gardens, saw baby ducks and pretty birds. Very nice place to walk through. Loved the trees and the bridges and the museum of natural history was right down the street.
It's a beautiful garden in the city for everyone to enjoy. Other than the scenary, it also has so much history.. Recommend to everyone to have a walk in it.
Very beautiful gardens, and a peaceful spot in the middle of the city. Definitely a nice spot to see if you have the time.
We let our young daughter run around the well manicured gardens. They are a great example of Victorian era gardens. She loved the ducks!

Behind the gates, away from hustle and bustle of Halifax, is a five and a half acre Victorian oasis. Lovely gardens, pond, fountains and buildings make up this quiet area. No pets, bikes, jogging or smoking is allowed here. Just birds singing, water flowing, benches to sit and relax on among nature.A bandstand is a focal point of the...
Beautiful gardens, quiet and peaceful. One can easily imagine a Victorian Era family going for a Sunday walk down the Grande Allée and stopping off at the band stand for a concert.

My teenaged sons and I spent about 45 minutes walking through these beautiful gardens. So well maintained and so peaceful.We stopped and got ice cream in the little cafe - which has outdoor and indoor seating. We didn't sit, though, we were too excited to walk on all of the lovely paths, so we ate as we walked.Simply...
This is such a beautiful park. I thought it was another big park as in other cities. I was wrong but happy about it.Un petit lac, des canards, des roses, des arbres superbes.
Definitely worth a half hour of your time to wander about this pretty garden. The trees in particular are beautiful. The geese were a nice surprise.
Victorian era themed geometric gardens are thrilling and beautifully maintained. Do not miss the bandstand!

I have been stopping here of a number of years. It has long been a favourite stop for my sons to run off excess energy after a long car ride to the City. The gardens are absolutely beautiful. The long paths are so relaxing to stroll along. A treasure that Halifax should be very proud of.
Very sweet, small, well-maintained city gardens. Nothing fancy (although a very attractive gazebo/bandstand), but very nice for a brief stroll.

The Halifax Public Gardens were impressive in size and beauty. We stayed at the nearby Lord Nelson and walked in the gardens each day. They are sizeable, well-maintained, and diverse. For a city Halifax's size, it was truly impressive to have such a great, quiet, nature getaway in the city.
Absolutely beautiful. Flowers, ducks, peace and quiet. Very relaxing, a must see.Within walking distance if you are staying Close to downtown
So much beauty in the summer. Well kept. Lots of well trimmed flowers and shrubs. A nice place for reflection. There are clean rest rooms and benches to sit on to enjoy the surrounding areas.
Flowers, trees, shrubs, ponds and fountains in abundance only a short walk from marina. Plenty of park benches on which to relax and enjoy.

The garden is stunning, and a tribute to the city. We visited the gardens every day, and made time to stop in at the small emporium located near the middle of the gardens. This place is not to be missed.

We had seen the park from the street while on the Harbour Hopper. Nice central location. A very pretty park which had lots of flowering bushes and flowers. Also had some swans. Took lots of pictures. There was one tree that looked like it had a face. Ran into a park ranger who shared lots of interesting info. It's free...

Do not miss this park - even if you only have 30 mins, you will not be dissapointed. Stunning curated displays of flowers and trees of all kinds and beautifully kept. Easy to walk from the waterfront area and near lots of hotels/Dalhousie so it's central to get to.
A beautiful and free trip for admiring the many different botanical delights that this park has to offer. It was a short walk from our hotel and easy to locate. So peaceful & tranquil.

Sometimes you just need to refresh your spirit in nature and this is the place to do it in Halifax. A small but gorgeous garden in the middle of the city. The flowers and plants are pleasing to the senses and your soul is allowed to soar in the beauty. This was my 2nd visit to Halifax and I made...

I would normally not spend my limited time in a new city strolling through a park I could see anywhere, but my wife and sister insisted, so I went along. Glad I did, as it was a great way to start the day. Flowers and plantings very well done, and it really is an oasis in middle of city. Give...
Beautiful gardens! Shady and accessible. Perfect for all ages. Worth dedicating 30-60 minutes of your time to seeing.Great for a morning stroll. Free and close to the citadel and Dresden row.
A friend and I took a quiet stroll through the gardens. Is nice when you are not in a rush and you take the time to look at everything. Good place for photos

Halifax Public Gardens would be a beautiful respite from the hustle and bustle of city life any time of year. My visit was still early spring, flowers just beginning to bloom. Very well laid out for strolling the different flower beds and ponds. Lots of places to sit and enjoy. There's also an enclosure with two big fat geese that...

We visited the gardens under the rain... It was beautiful just the same! If you go on a Saturday, you will surely see brides and grooms taking pictures! That's always a beautiful sight!Free attraction in a less touristic area but easy walk from the Riverfront.Bathrooms!!
Went on a morning jog and headed over to the public gardens to learns that it's actually quite small. Very pretty, but essentially just a few blocks big.
It was a nice park with lovely gardens. We had a nice walk and enjoyed the fountain. It was free and we took some nice photos.

Situated in downtown Halifax like an oasis, this multi-acre property is refreshing, peaceful and beautiful. Lush trees, and so many varieties of flowers. There was also live music being played right in the center of the garden. Excellent photography opportunities for the camera buff.
Great setting of flowers, bushes, and trees. There is ice cream on sale inside the garden area. Nice place to enjoy fhe Halifax area.

I spent a wonderful quiet hour by myself wandering through the garden while my partner slept in. He's not really a garden guy but I loved it. Just one beautiful pathway after another, one beautiful vista after another.

A proper public garden in the English tradition but with Canadian openness and variety. Great for plant detectives and for those who simply want a quiet (and lovely) spot to sit and think (or check you phone?) For Americans, I should add it seems to be safe at all times. Enjoy.

We were in Halifax in late May and stopped in the gardens for a nice break. The flowers were blooming and beautiful with plenty of interesting trees for shade. The ponds and statuary were nice features along with the ducks and geese. There were workmen in some areas and one stopped us to let us know that the main gates...
Always beautiful there, and in the heart of the city. Gorgeous flowers, trees and wildlife. Have loved visiting since I was a child
The flowers , ducks and paths are worth taking the time to visit.Benches to sit and just take in the sights and sounds of this peaceful part of the city.Lots of photo opportunities!

A lovely park with a small lake and ponds with many trees, and nicely designed formal flower beds, absolutely beautiful, and well taken care of. There is also a Victorian bandstand with summer concerts. We enjoyed swing band music when we were at the park. The flower arrangements around the bandstand were simply amazing. A nice way to spend a...
A lovely pond, many beautiful and very old trees, nicely designed formal flower beds. Gorgeous Victorian bandstand with weekly summer concerts.
An oasis right in city center! And free! Well worth taking a break from walking, very close to the Citadel

It's a few blocks to the central core of downtown Halifax but Spring Garden Road (and a couple of blocks of shops and restaurants) leads directly to its entrance. I suppose it is the size of four city blocks (two in each direction) with lots of room for walking or sitting and relaxing. The flowers were lovely, shrubs and trees...
Again visited, for the umpteenth time, the Public Gardens. It is a lovely respite from the hurly-burly and a great place for restoring your equilibrium.

This 16 acre urban park is one of the few remaining Victorian gardens in Canada. It is a lovely arboretum with lots of flora and fauna to admire. The walkways serpentine through neatly manicured flower beds and tall trees offer full shade. There is an oak tree planted in 1939 by King George VI in honor of Queen Elizabeth.
I had my first date with my wife of forty years there. It is a beautiful, tranquil place steeped in history.

These gardens are well worth the visit; it's a peaceful and beautiful oasis located a short walk outside of the Halifax city centre. It's a lovely place to stroll on a warm summer day with a mix of trees, flowers and water features to enjoy. We were lucky enough to come across an afternoon summer concert at the bandstand and...

The Halifax Public Gardens are situated at the corner of South Park Street and Spring Garden Road. As you stroll through the historic iron gates, you enter a paradise of flowering shrubs and gardens. The colours are fantastic and the fountains are inviting to view as you sit on the park benches and take in the colourful scenery. Don't miss...

Every visit to Halifax should include a stroll around the Public Gardens. There's a mix of shade and sun, gorgeous flowers, shrubs and trees - paths to explore. We thoroughly enjoy it, and see something different every time we go.

The Public Gardens are just that, a beautiful public park in the center of the city. You can take a stroll and enjoy the variety of gardens or just sit and people watch, maybe read a book or enjoy an ice cream cone.

The best part is this opens early, so you can get there and easily do the Citadel. Well, not the best part, as the gardens are that. A stroll through the beautiful and diverse gardens, and if you are lucky, a chance to talk with one of the wonderful garden staff / volunteers. You have to spend the time to...

This is a magnificent oasis in the heart of the city. It is a MUST see. In June the Rhododendrons are in full bloom and they are massive! The main gates are beautiful and there are fountains and a huge pond. Please don't miss this when visiting Halifax in the Summer.

The Halifax public gardens is beautiful! Great place to take a stroll early in the morning or during sunset. Lot of different trees and flowers to see, nice ponds and bridges. There is a large gazebo with benches and plenty of places to sit and relax throughout the park. There is also a little cafe near the gazebo that has...
Nice old park tucked in near the Citadel. Ample street (metered/coin) parking surround grounds. Dated but well maintained. Pretty.
Beautiful park plus Sunday afternoons they have a "Music in the Park" series that was great. There is a coffee shop for coffee and ice cream as well.

The Halifax Public Gardens are beautiful and a great place to spend a Saturday or Sunday morning either getting a walk in, or reading a book on one of the many benches. The flowers are beautiful, and paths well kept. Great place for families, couples, or just solo!
You can hardly tell you are in the city,everything is colourful with all kinds of flowers and trees of so many different species.

Of course, these are gardens. As such, they are only open during the warm months. That said, these gardens are lush and beautiful. So many kinds of flowers and trees! Excellent backdrop for photography, and often used for just that. I didn't know rhododendron bushes could get that freaking big! I love the main gates, made of wrought iron. In...
Parks are central downtown, a wonderful place to walk and enjoy everything neat, clean and well maintained.
Always a calm peaceful walk through the park. A great picture opportunity And a beautiful spot for lunch.

I live in Halifax and one of my favourite things to do is to visit the Gardens from spring to the fall. It is a continual change of colour as the gardeners are planting and replanting with the change of seasons. It is such a delight to walk the meandering paths; look at the swans and ducks and stop for...

Perfect place to take a stroll & reconnect mind, body & spirit. A truly lovely setting with meandering pathways, mature trees, flowerbeds and ponds. A bandstand & seating for summer concerts completes the garden. Great location within easy walking distance of downtown Halifax.

A great place to spend a quiet afternoon, walking through the grounds. There is also an ice cream store in the park if you are so inclined. Great place for pictures with your family or your loved one. (There are many weddings and prom photos taken within the park.) open three seasons, closed in the winter. Free admission! Visit it...

The Halifax Public Gardens is a beautiful well kept area in the heart of Halifax, The gardens is open to the public from sunrise to dust. Not so large that you need to spend hours there. Aside from the enormous rhododendron beds, not much else caught my eye. In the middle was a bandshell where live bands played. Minutes from the Citadel and steps from the main streets.

This is a must on any sightseeing tour of Halifax. It is a stunning Victorian style garden and is free to the public. The amount of walking the paths or sitting on benches is individual and is totally an individual preference. It is extremely well groomed and maintained. The flower beds were varied and very pretty! It was a serene...
A must see in the city. Beautiful grounds. Great walking paths. Lovely coffee shop to sit and relax together. Great picture taking opportunities. Can be busy at times
In summer or fall, this is a lovely place to take a walk or have lunch. It's a little piece of green tranquility in the downtown core. My only complaint is that my dog can't walk there with me.

I toured my 92-year old mother around in her wheelchair and she loved it as usual!!The flowers were all planted beautifully awaiting more growth to take place; the bridge was being painted but otherwise it was nice to walk around.

The Halifax Public Gardens is a magical place. Beautiful beyond words. A photographer's heaven. So many beautiful things to photograph. We visited it during grad night and it was incredible. This is a must for anyone who visits Halifax. Stroll through the gardens, take your time and experience peace and beauty.

A wonderful spring, summer and fall destination in Halifax. A beautiful, relaxing space to spend some time. Great to just walk through instead of taking the sidewalk. Sit down and eat your lunch. It is a very popular spot for prom, graduation and wedding photos. Full of beautiful flowers, shrubs and trees along with a pond full of ducks to...

Located next to the Citadel, the Public Garden is an oasis of real beauty and quiet in an otherwise not so beautiful city. Itnseems to be very popular with locals. It offers numerous beds of beautiful flowers , fountains, gazebos amid tall shady trees..
Beautiful, lush, fragrant garden in the middle of the city. Great place to relax and recharge your batteries.

The Halifax Public Gardens are a botanical oasis with ponds, waterfalls and fountains amid some of the most interesting floral displays set in an inner city park. While in Halifax, take time to enjoy this serene, peaceful and beautiful space. A photographer's delight.

We bought an ice cream outside the park and decided to stroll through. Hadn't been in a few years...pretty place still! Lots of beautiful rhododendrons and flowers. My favourite tree was still there. The tree provides a canopy from the hot sun...where you can sit and admire the fountain. A jazz band played while we ambled through. Nice respite from...

A haven at the end of a long winter. The gardens were just beginning to waken up so can imagine that they were going to be beautiful in another few weeks time. There is a lovely tranquility to be found here.

If you are in Halifax, you should certainly stop and visit the Public Gardens. This place is so beautiful. The grounds are clean and the atmosphere is peaceful. You can grab a coffee and sit back and relax while you listen to some music being played in the gazebo. This was one the highlights of my visit to Halifax.

I always take time to walk through the Gardens, and admire the detail and work to make such a beautiful place available in the center of the city. I am a former halifax native and remember Hurricane Juan, and so I am so glad to see that this is still a wonderful spot to visit. A recommend.
Have a coffee and enjoy the birdsong in the middle of the city. Beautiful trees and flowers. Meandering trails with lots of benches for relaxing and enjoying the view.
Take a walk around these lovely gardens you will not be disappointed, it right in the center of town and a good way to relax and enjoy the clean beautiful air of Halifax.

Went here with my Aunt while visiting from Ontario and it is fabulous. Lots of shade, lush... you know that kind of summer day where everybody looks good and kind- it was part the day and part the park, regardless, can't get enough of those kind of days.
We decided to walk here after eating our lunch and had a wonderful time walking here! The gardens are very well kept that makes for a very pleasant walk!

The public garden is a formal garden adjacent to the Citadel and the Natural History Museum on the south end of the fort. It is a Victorian style garden, with numerous flower beds and, ornamental ponds, and specimen trees. There are numerous specimen trees and unusual plants. In late May, most of the flower beds were bare but later in...
Beautiful walk at the public gardens right in the city ! Takes about 30 min but worth it. Nice easy walk to do. And best of all it's free!

spring arrives late here but the flowers and trees create a nice simple park to stretch you legs and escape the city. the city is very close so you can enjoy both within a short walk between. the people are so nice and friendly, including the groundskeeper who explained some of the trees to us!!
Beautiful place to walk and enjoy nature. Very centrally located. I recommend you go to Halifax Public Gardens on your trip to Halifax.
The flowers and bushes are beautiful. The gardens have a lot of variety and the grounds are immaculately groomed.
I never tire of walking through the historic gardens. Relaxing place. Always beautiful. Interesting to see the names of plants and trees and who planted them. Love the architecture and statues.
This is a must on every visit to Halifax. Enjoy a stroll by Spring Garden road to these magnificent garden. Make sure to buy ice cream, watch the ducks, and take lots of photos.

We stayed for 5 days at the Lord Nelson Hotel, overlooking the beautiful Halifax Public Gardens. Every morning started with a lovely walk through the gardens, and each day we saw a new plant or tree. The rhododendrons were absolutely spectacular - some sorting to 40 feet tall !
Definitely worth a walk through. Grab a coffee or ice cream and relax on a bench in the sun. Lots of flowers and really old trees!
June was a great month to enjoy the rhododendrons. The Public Gardens have easy access and make for a relaxing walk. There were interesting memorials for history buffs.

Some flowers had bloomed but must are still not ready when we went. Its still a great place to relax and stroll through. The fountains are pretty and there were geese and ducks near the ponds. Wish we could see it in full bloom.
Located just off downtown Halifax. Free. Many types of local plants, trees and flowers. Plenty of benches to take a rest. Figure about 45 minutes to see the park. Worth your time.
what a wonder time for a walk we took a ton of pictures it was so refreshing and beautiful there in the heart of the city
A lovely garden, not too small not too large. A nice variety of settings with wonderfully cared for plants. An oasis in the city.
Beautiful public gardens off Spring Garden st.Well maintained with old trees & flowers.relaxing & peaceful.free entry.established 1867.
A lovely downtown garden. We walked from Citadel and spent about 1.5 hours wandering. I felt we saw most of it in that time frame.
Great place to visit. Incredibly well maintained. Flower beds and big trees. Only thing is you can't walk on the grass.

Any locals know that the public gardens are always pretty. It's free and is a nice way to spend a day in Halifax on a sunny day. It's always well groomed, and the trees are old and beautiful. Love the public gardens. Been there a million times, definitely recommend.
It's a peaceful place. I visited there with my little kid and wife. Very charming scenery and cool place. One who likes to sit lonely for a couple hours they can have a visit at that place.
Halifax is a small city and these gardens are with in the small city. They are kept up beautifully. The flowers and greenery are really pretty. The gardens are a must to do, also they are free.
It's early spring but the gardens had their usual beautiful calming effect in the heart of the city. The rhododendrons were beginning to bloom as well as a number of fruit trees and flowering shrubs.

Walk through the Public Gardens. Many amazing flora that would not be seen in other locations throughout Canada. The iron fence imported from Scotland. Small gift shop, ice cream and washrooms. Gates locked at night. Rose garden and Dahlia garden.

The Halifax public garden is a quiet retreat in the heart of Halifax. There are numerous plant types, from huge flowering shrubs to unique trees. It is a great place for a stroll away from the busy streets, and is 100% free!

The rhododendron was in bloom in mid_June and there were 12 foot high bushes full of blossoms! Also, some unusual trees that I don't often see, like horse chestnut, magnolia, a huge elm, and some kind of beech tree with weeping branches. Overall, a well laid-out and designed Victorian garden.
Although early in season, the flowering trees were very nice. Well groomed grounds and very peaceful to walk.
I would highly recommend going to visit the Public Gardens. Beautifully kept and a nice area to walk around and take a break. Great for pictures too!
What a lovely way to spend a hour walking through the gardens with the family. Great photo opportunities.

Being a cool and gloomy day , didn't get the whole experience out of the park. Would be nice to sit and relax with a picnic basket on a towel but not . The best smell was from the lilac trees that were in bloom . We parked down by the water front and walked the whole down town and...
Located between the harbour and the Spring Garden shopping area, this park is a lovely stroll or a great place to sit and relax.
It was a short but nice visit. The garden was maintained beautifully. There was a small pond, a tiny lake-like, and lots of greens and colorful flowers.

The gardens are lovely. They are well worth a visit if you are in the area. It's a lovely experience to walk along the paths and admire the flowers, water features and trees. Many of the trees were planted on special occasions.

The day we were there it was cool and cloudy. It is free and well worth the trip. It is not Butchart Gardens in Victoria but a great way to spend some time looking at the flowers and trees. There is a shop on site that you can pick up a sandwich a dessert or coffee/adult beverage. Warmer weather would...
We enjoyed walking through the Public Garden. It was a peaceful oasis in a noisy town. Great break from the usual in Halifax.
Right in the middle of downtown Halifax lies the Public Gardens. In May the bulb flowers are blooming in profusion. A very pleasant, peaceful place to walk through.
Wind down and relax in this utopia of greens, trees and flowers. No smoking allowed easy to find on Spring Garden Road.
While shopping, I accidentally stumbled on this beautifully manicured park. It has beautiful flowers, arbors and ponds. You will enjoy a tranquil break in this park and feel rejuvenated.
We spent an hour or two wandering around the gardens with our two year old. Everything is well kept and the flower displays were beautiful.

Really nice park, lake ,cafe, toilets, still early in the season, but no doubt later on it will be in full bloom, well done to all who look after it. Very clean and all the borders well kept, wife loved it.
The flowers were just coming into bloom when we were there. But still well worth the walk a walk through the park.
My wife and I had some spare time and decided to go for a stroll in the park. We were amazed by the variety and size of the trees and different flowering plants.
The gardens are in full bloom and we will be very busy in the next few weeks as Proms begin to take place throughout the city and surrounding areas as this is a very popular place for picture taking.
Well maintained and full of flowers, lovely escape in central Halifax. Weather obviously needs to cooperate in the Maritimes...
A stay in Halifax is not complete without a visit to this absolutely stunning garden!! It is truly beautiful in Spring, Summer or Fall. Don't miss it!

It is a beautiful little park with nice landscaping. Good for bringing your kids on a sunny afternoon. It is close to spring garden road, so if you get hungry or in a mood of shopping everything you need is minutes away.
Beautiful old park in center of Halifax near Lord Nelson hotel. Old style gazebo and beautiful flowers. Set up for concerts and shows and very clean. Has restrooms and a snack/coffee bar.
My husband and I went for a long weekend trip to Halifax, and visited the Public Gardens. Not terribly large, but very pretty and centrally located - a nice place for a sunny day stroll.

The Halifax Public Gardens is, I believe, the oldest Victorian garden in North America. The few acres are enclosed by a beautiful iron fence and inside you will find meandering paths, fountains, flower beds, shrubs and trees from all over the world. It's so peaceful and there is a resting place for everyone, whether you want to sit in the...
A must see in Halifax. The gardens are meticulously cared for. The trees are so beautiful. You can go morning or evening.

This public park in the centre of Halifax is a real gem. We visited towards the end of Summer and the colours were dazzling. Plants, water, sculpture, bandstand - a mix of everything that makes a good park. Highly recommended.

Spring - Summer and Fall are all great times to visit this wonderful English style Garden in the heart of Halifax. The different flowers, winding paths, music stand and water gardens/ponds are amazing. Take your lunch or ice cream and relax as your eyes wonder from plant to tree to others doing just what you are doing, relaxing.P.S. It...

The Public Gardens is an oasis with the city. The staff have created a multitude of flower scenes that will stimulate the senses. This is a perfect place for an afternoon stroll, mid afternoon break to read a book (or grab a nap) or share a picnic with your family. Terrific spot!! highly recommend a visit.
Beautiful gardens, with many walkways, fountains, small pond with swans and there isa small café (which we did not go to). Many be a little boring for children.
I spent an hour just sitting under a tree next to the fountain here because it was so nice. If you like being surrounded by nature, definitely check this place out.
If you fancy a stroll, picnic, or somewhere quiet to sit in lovely surroundings, then this gem in Halifax is the place to go.
We traveled too early in the season to see all the plantings, but they had beautiful trees, they had a small enclosure with geese and ducks, lots of walking paths and easy parking.

Our group used the gardens as a short cut back to the hotel after supper. It was close to closing time so we were being asked to leave, however, I can't wait to return to take advantage of this beautiful spot.
A truly wonderful creation lovingly prepared and maintainedWe were both stunned by the creativity and calm found in this fabulous city park
Wish we could have been there for several hours. Would go there frequently for lunch, a walk, a moment of peace if lived there. Wish we cold have seen all the seasons
Lovely, peaceful oasis in the middle of busy, downtown Halifax. Lots of green spaces and well-kept flower gardens and paths.
A very quite place in down town Halifax to take stroll or just sit and take in the beautiful sounds and sites. A great place to meet at lunch time .
I always try to take a walk through the gardens, each visit. There are many paths to explore, which gives you a different perspective each time. Interesting flowers and trees. (Plus it is free !)

We did a park tour the other day and this was my favorite. It reminded me of a recent visit to Paris. Spring flowers were in bloom and the trees were just starting to pop. I will definitely return throughout the year to see the seasonal changes!
there can be many people in the park and one does not feel crowded. Tourists and city folks as well use the park. All plants are tastefully labelled so interesting to learn about the vegetation.
Lovely, relaxing gardens in the centre of the city. Many flower varieties, old trees and a rich pallet of colours. Very pretty. Just lovely. If you want a place to relax, this is it.

We stayed in the Lord Nelson right across the street and the Park was just gorgeous. We walked around several times. Many varieties of gorgeous flowers and bushes. If I lived in the neighbourhood I would have been very sad that I could not walk through with my small dogs on the path.

We were visiting during the May long weekend and due to the foolish weather a lot if the plants have not come up yet. Daffodils ,tulips and magnolias were the main event. No annuals were planted yet. The geese were even huddled so you could not see their faces. It seems it would be very good a month or so...

We went on a beautiful May afternoon and were surprised by all the rules at the garden. We were even more surprised when the garden "warden" asked three separate groups of people (just one or two people per instance) to not sit on the grass. I was very surprised by that. Anyway, pretty but not relaxing, or a good place...

We walked, following a walking tour suggested to us by a lady in the information centre at the harbour front. This was the third week in May on an absolutely gorgeous day. I commented as we walked through the park that most of the trees and bushes were just 'ready to pop'. I think one week later, it would have...

There are many different areas of the garden to enjoy - lots of different plants found around the gardens. Gazebo's to relax at and of course a great little coffee/ice cream shop to relax and get a snack at. Love the different groupings/displays of plants to be found there. Great for a relaxing stroll.
I love being there this garden is one of my favorite one in halifax city you would love walking there
One of the highlights of my trip and the flowers were barely in bloom and the trees were still bare! Look forward to coming back when everything is in it's prime. Gorgeous. Just gorgeous.
We had a wonderful stroll through this beautiful picturesque garden. I thought it was like walking through heaven, beautiful, quiet.
Nice and quiet area if you are stressed out in downtown area. The whole garden is well designed with different entrances and walkways around it.
It is not a large area, but it was lovely to stroll through, even early in the spring when there was just tulips, daffodils, etc. I can only imagine how lovely it is in the summer.

It is very nice park to relax. There are some nice flower compositions, beautiful lake. There is an oak tree planted by King George VI in 1939. The park is not big, and located pretty close to city center, about 20 minute walk.
When we first moved to NS, this was the most unexpected gem we came across in Halifax. Just lovely. The paths are easy to walk (I have mobility issues) and it was so relaxing and serene.

If in Halifax this is a must see if you appreciate nature. From spring to fall the gardens are an incredible place to take a walk,have pictures taken( a favourite spot in summer for proms and weddings)or just to sit on one of the benches and marvel at the beauty..an oasis in the middle of the city :)

If you are looking for some time to rest and relax this is the right spot. The gardens in the summer are breath takin. They are suited for all ages. There are trees for kids to play in, benches to sit on and watch the ducks. The landscaping and flowers are beautiful. It is a wonderful spot in the day...
Perfect place for a picnic lunch on a hot sunny day, stroll or just quietly sit and read a book... bring a friend or go by yourself.

A gorgeous and well-maintained public Victorian garden in the heart of downtown Halifax. Much has been done to recover the losses suffered in the hurricane a few years ago. The duck pond and flower gardens are lovely. It is a good place just to sit and relax after a busy day.
This park is gorgeous, and an easy way to spend some time. Each area is picture perfect, with unique plants and victorian flair. Walk through every day if you can ;)

Part of our tour of Halifax included a walk through this wonderful area. Amazing designs and plantings, flowers in bloom everywhere we turned, and small ponds and streams. A gardener's delight, and a stroll through here is great for the mind and soul! Do not miss it!

After lunch across the road a nice walk through the gardens, it was a horrible day, but the gardens are clean and I love the band stand and fountain, no wild life I guess they got out of the weather.A must visit, and it is close to other places you need to visit.

The name pretty much describes the area. We visited in may so not much was bloomed, mostly buds! Was a relaxing walk though. I'd say it's beautiful there in the summer. Oh and you have to visit the geese!

Lovely, well-kept gardens in Halifax. Great for a stroll around to escape everyday life. Very peaceful and relaxing. We actually came across them by chance, after walking around the shopping area, and had about an hour just wondering around in the sunshine. Definitely worth a visit.

My favorite place in Halifax. The flowers are so pretty, lots of benches to sit and people watch, have an ice cream from the stand, or on Sundays watch the free show at the band stand. No matter what time of day or what day, you are sure to enjoy!
Beautiful spot. Great to walk around in. Very spacious and well kept. Flower beds are glorious. Easy walk from most city hotels. Refreshments and restroom available.
I have only seen pictures on the Internet way better in person.nice place to take the family for a afternoon walk.

We happened upon this well-preserved Victorian garden when we were walking down South Street on the way to the Citadel. It is completely worth a visit with well tended and pretty flower beds, fountains and statues.
Close to the Citadel, Dalhousie University and downtown. Well maintained and very pleasant. Lots of bench to stop and enjoy.

We went to the Public Gardens on a Saturday afternoon and even though it was busy there is so much room and beautiful areas to see. It is simple and natural, buy breathtaking and serene and worth the visit

This is a beautiful park, and we love going here as a family. BUT, the local mla's have to work at getting more funds to keep the local parks clean and safe. It is too dirty and needs garbage cans and cigarette buckets to avoid forest fires, messy nature and hurt wildlife.There is also great potential to improve the...
I loved the gardens. Very good place for photography. Plenty of places to just sit and enjoy the scenery. Its a long, easy walk from the cruise port.

One of my favorite parks to stroll, I enjoy watching the wee ones chase the ducks, and smelling the abundant roses when in bloom. Photographing the many colors and textures in this Victorian garden is such a pleasure, especially those gorgeous magnolia trees. Sitting on a bench to read is nice too. But my all time fave is coming to...
Such a nice peaceful park to walk through and enjoy the scenery! I loved to see the daffodils that have bloomed and the other flowers that are just beginning to flower this spring!
Been there over the years very enjoyable and interesting for all ages lovely gift shop on site very educational.

I just recently visited so it is still off season, but the public garden is pretty. There is a nice trail system throughout the grounds. I enjoyed walking around to see the bandstand and the ponds and stream. A must see.

Public Gardens in Halifax NS is very beautiful. Lots of different trees and beautiful flowers and shrubs everywhere. A great place to take your lunch and read a book. Also it is located off of Spring Garden Road which is also a trendy place full of unique shops and lots of great places to eat. A must see when touring...

The gardens are very well attended to, and despite being in the middle of Halifax, the flowers and bushes are tended to very well. Parking is well laid out around the gardens, maybe tourism should take a lesson from Halifax, as to how it's done.
just sit back and let nature do its thing in the middle of a very busy area of Halifax. Lots of bird life and flower gardens. I really like my once a year visit to the Public Gardens

Whether for a quick walk around on your coffee break or a long stroll during some down time, the beauty of this place will never disappoint.Flowers and trees and shrubs.. oh my! The geese living in the garden are here all summer. Due to their size the geese aren't able to fly south so they are moved to a...
Beautiful gardens, great ornate fountains, bandstand which has summer performances. Great place to peacefully wander.
This garden in the middle of a busy city is an urban oasis.It is a great place to take a break from everything . It is a must stop for anyone who visits Halifax.

Flowers, beautiful trees, the buzzing of bees, green grass and the lovely ponds are just a few reasons to enjoy a walk or your lunch in these beautiful gardens!! I have been visiting here since I was a child and still love the serenity of the gardens.

Gardens were in full bloom. Colors were spectacular and people were very friendly. Lots of space and benches for just sitting and watching. Quiet beautiful place just to get away and relax. Beautiful gardens for taking lots and lots of photos.

Halifax Public Gardens are modelled after English country gardens. It is a serene place In the center of a busy city. A place where you can find serenity and y find families with their children having fun playing in a gated safe space.

I have often walked through the gardens, sat and watched the world go by and usually stop for an ice cream. It was a bit early in the season for the flowers but it was a nice warm sunny day. I recommend this as place to see while in Halifax.
A small public garden in the centre of the city. It's not a large garden, but beautifully maintained. We visited in April but I imagine it would be stunning in the summer.
I love walking the garden! The best afternoon is walking through the gardens with a coffee, looking at the flowers and people watching. especially during prom season!
It was amazing! All was green, a lot of colorful flowers. Great for some family time! A lot of ducks around, the kids will love them!

My husband and I visited this delightful place last July during our stay in Halifax and it was definitely one of our favorite sightseeing experiences. So much was in bloom and there was one spectacular site after another. If you love flowers and nature, this is a must see. It is meticulously maintained and all the workers in the garden...
A nice place for a stroll, even in April. More of a "park" than a "garden," at least in the way someone from the US might use those terms. I'm sure it's even lovelier in summer!

Always nice to spend time in the gardens and enjoy lunch at the cafe.Perfect spot for lunch or a break during the afternoon. Stroll along the paths or claim a bench to read. Usually there is a band on Sunday afternoons throughout the summer.
I took many pictures with my family ? there we like itPlease visit on summerFor children this place is amazing

Found this lovely garden area while walking the streets. Even in April the crocuses and daffodils are starting to appear and bloom. Must be beautiful in summer. A quiet place to wander and enjoy the sun and fresh air.
a great place to bring the kids or a date! I went here with some friends and it was nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Any time we vist Haifax we make it a point to stop at the Public Gardens. Always landscaped beautifully and well taken care of. Nothing better for photos or just sitting on one of the benches enjoying the beautiful plants and flowers.

This wonderful spot in the middle of our city is a beautiful,relaxing area to walk during your lunch break or just a walk with your family.The gardens are gorgeous and there are several shaded ares to sit and watch people go by.There's a gazebo where they sometimes have music on Sunday's and there's a canteen too.Enjoy!!
I haven't bee to the gardens for a couple years but would certainly go again...I have been off and on for over 60 years. It is absolutely gorgeous. Do not go without your camera!
When I was there in February of course I could only see from my room into the winter garden and the lights on the gate. But if you go in summer to Halifax DO NOT MISS!

What a great spot to take a walk on your lunch break or just to relax and people watch. Lots of shaded benches and open areas to soak up that vitamin d we all crave!My only wish is that it remained open during the winter months like Point Pleasant Park.Pets are not permitted in the Public Gardens and...

A great place to be on a sunny day, in the summer. Its free! Sometimes bands play there. Great place to walk around to look at birds. There's a place to buy ice cream and sit-down to rest. A great place to exercise or let toddlers run around.

The Gardens are opened for another wonderful season. Can't wait for the first bollworms of the year. The Mayor's Garden Party is certainly a highlight and a chance to enjoy local music and an ice cream cone.
beautiful spot to get away from the busyness of downtown to enjoy the flowers, trees, ducks and sometimes music in the bandstand. Popular place to get wedding or prom pictures done.

Open seasonally but much loved by the locals. Mix of Victorian floating flower beds and French formal garden. Easy to stroll the pathways or just sit on a bench and enjoy nature. Bandstand has summer free concerts and small ice cream parlour near the public washrooms. See if you can find the floating "Titanic" in the summer months?

It's a public gardens, there's not much to say. If you like a well maintained garden that's very big and want some nice relaxing time in the middle of Halifax bring a book or a partner and have a stroll.

I have visited these gardens in the Summer when they are a blaze of colour and recently at the beginning of Spring - despite just coming out of Winter, the gardens are well kept and clean and still really pleasant to stroll around.

This park is beautifully landscaped. Variety of flowers and plants with many different colours. Lots of benches to sit and eat your lunch or drink your beverage. Nice little ice cream/sandwich shop in park that offer some yummy treats and great coffee. Don't forget to say hi to the feathered friends.
I love to visit gardens in cities. This one is small but very nicely done. We went in the summer and it was well maintained and a lot of people were there enjoying the garden.
Great spot to take your kids for tranquility in city center... Nice ponds with ducks to feed and lovely gardens
My kids love the gardens they really enjoy seeing all the birds and ducks. This is a wonderful spot for family pictures and the backdrop is beautiful

I had brought my sons home to see where I grew up. This was one of my favourite places to go as a kid. Hurricanes had done a number on the gardens years ago. So I was very happy to see that it was restored for the most part and as beautiful as I remember. This was a nice relaxing...

Well laid out gardens with interesting monuments. And s story to tell about the City of Halifax. Parking is not the easiest and should get there early in day if possible. Small snack but only seasonal. Overall and great place to talks some breather moments and enjoy the gardens.
Free, serene, peaceful place to take a walk or have a picnic. Great variety of flowers, plants and trees done in a traditonal Victorian style

Took my Mother in law and her sister for a Autumn stroll. My Mother in Law was in a wheel chair which was fine. There are lovely paths and ponds with ducks and geese. Beautiful flowers set for the time of the year. Good parking nearby and close to all the shops of Spring Garden.

These gardens were begun in 1836 by the Nova Scotia Horticultural Society as a Victorian garden, and ten years later the society built Horticultural Hall for their meetings. It was about 30 years later that the society's garden and an adjacent city garden was merged to become the magnificent 16 acre garden-park that it is today - rated one of...
Visit the Public Gardens when your visiting Halifax. Its a stunning place for a walk.Gorgeous flowers and a great place to have some alone time.
just all around beautiful place to people watch, have lunch, relax, stress free environment enjoy the sounds, listen and feed the birds, awesome getaway for an afternoon.

Situated in the heart of the city centre, easy to find by transit, car or on foot if staying downtown, the Halifax Public Gardens is a beautiful, well maintained authentic Victorian Garden which has been part of the city since its beginnings. Acres of gravelled walkways, ponds with ducks and swans, little bridges and flowers and trees of every kind...

The Halifax Public Gardens are beautiful. Simple as that. If you enjoy green-space, gardens, or parks, you have to come here. There is also a great little building inside the Public Gardens where you can purchase snacks and drinks.The only downside is that the Gardens are closed for all of Winter and a bit of Spring. If it wasn't,...

Feeling a little stressed while on your holiday, well a stroll through the Public Gardens will have you feeling relaxed. It's a lovely place to bring a picnic lunch - where you can sit on a park bench gazing at all the beautiful flowers, or maybe watching the white swans
This is such a beautiful place to relax for a lunchtime escape or a lazy Sunday afternoon. So many hidden gems to uncover with the incredible variety of trees and plants. LOVE IT
A spot for a peaceful stroll amidst the beauty of these gardens. So unexpected in the middle of the city.
The Halifax Public Gardens are gorgeous and a very nice place to hang out. The scenery and critters hanging about in there are fantastic. No complaints.

Always a pleasure to stroll through with a special person. Enjoying the sights of flowers and other people You can Sit and relax have a picnic, or enjoy an ice cream cone.A great place to relax and enjoy the day.

I haven't been to the gardens in awhile but will be visiting several times this spring and summer. The Victorian gardens are a immaculately maintained and a quiet contrast from the down town area. Plus the Citadel and lots of resteraunts are minutes away.
Beautiful Victorian Gardens. Nice pathways to stroll through. A pond and a bandstand. A wonderful place to spend an afternoon
Took our kids here when we first moved to Nova Scotia they had fun running around very beautiful.Would definitely go back.

The Halifax Publc Gardens are snuggled into downtown Halifax and offer visiters a tranquil oasis of floral offerings and birdlife....large and small, swimming and flying. The Gardens are free and the only wheeled traffic you will encounter are baby buggies or wheel chairs. There is a bandstand for summer concerts and nothing is hurried. Meander and appreciate natural beauty....a rare...

Absolutely beautiful gardens with a Victorian touch. Pathways, water features with ducks and swans, Victorian gazebo provides space for relaxing concerts, trees donated by foreign dignitaries provide shade on those hot summer days. Benches to sit and read or just day dream. One of my favourite spots in Halifax.

The Gardens is one of my favorite places to visit when downtown. With its mixture of sunny and shady areas, its pond with the ducks, the bandstand, gardens and canteen there is something for everyone. If you so desire there are areas that are more private where you can sit and relax away from the crowds. I never get tired...
My Summer favourite spot for an evening stroll, or morning reading by the pond. Great for photography. a classic English garden in the heart of downtown..
Pretty destination for taking photos and for walking around. I wouldn't spend more than an afternoon here though, it's not that big.
I love going for a walk at the Public Gardens, or taking the time to read on a bench there. Runners, be aware that you can't run in the park but instead must walk!

A beautiful park in Halifax where you can enjoy colorful flowers, stately trees, large shrubs, waking paths and benches and swans and ducks in the ponds.A popular area in the city.I enjoy strolling through after work for some R & R.It is pretty from Spring through fall.

Beautiful Victorian garden just off Spring Garden Road in Halifax...Historically significant, glorious maintained garden with hundreds of ancient flowers, trees and bushes...large water features with swans,ducks and other species...sit and listen to music in the 160 year old bandstand..a jewel on the middle of a noisy city
Gardens were beautiful and I wouldn't hesitate to return again. Especially pretty in the summer with all the flowers. Very well maintained
The Public Gardens is one of the most beautiful urban parks I have ever been to. It is immaculately manicured. You must go there!

A trip to Halifax from Aoril to November would be incomplete without an excursion to Public Gardens; a step back into the past where one can imagine ladies elegantly dressed holding parasols, and gentlemen in suits wearing top hats.The main gate is a wrought iron splendour on Spring Garden Rd. Once inside, one is treated to meticulously sculpted gardens,...
The Halifax Public Gardens is beautiful.It was worth every minute spent here.. Have enjoyed.Its so quite

Beautiful gardens to stroll through on a nice day! My grandparents met and dated in Halifax and they spent a lot of time here in their prime so a sentimental visit for me. The gardens really are beautiful, lots of great photo opportunities.

I was pretty skeptical moving to a new province and hearing about this park and being downtown halifax and not sure what to expect.I have gone here many times in the summer to take pictures of the flowers and trees or to read my book by the pond and watching the ducks land in the water or people watch....
Beautiful place to get away for some peace in your day. A break from work school or if you have someone in one of the hospitals.
An afternoon stroll in summer is a must. So much to see and it is so well maintained - I spent hours there. Take a book and a blanket and spend some time!

We visited the Gardens in October, so a lot of the flowers were gone, but that didn't make it any less beautiful! There were some flowers left and they were gorgeous! It's a beautifully laid out garden with a park setting, benches and beautiful old trees. It;s just lovely and you won't be disappointed!
We spent the morning walking through the public gardens. It was a misty morning but that didn't take away from the beauty of the gardens. Housed there were two very large ducks!
There are few places in a busy city where you can sit down and just relax. This is it. Sit. Relax. Enjoy the beautiful gardens.
This is a real gem in the heart of Halifax. A peaceful place to unwind. Lots of beautiful flowers shrubs trees etc. A big pond with numerous ducks and swans

This is a wonderful place to visit whether you work downtown and want to enjoy your lunch outdoors or if you're unfamiliar to Halifax and just want to take in a beautiful little park in the heart of the city. Lots of gorgeous flowers and trees as well as seating areas to help relax and take it all in. Wish...

I wasn't expecting to find a place like this, but I'm so happy we stumbled onto it. It was gorgeous and very well maintained. Very impressive flower beds and decor. Would love to go back on our next visit to Halifax.
Fabulous gardens, well kept and great park in the heart of the city - summer concerts and weddings can be observed during the summer time

This is free activity. Just make sure to schedule it well as the garden closes with sunset which in August is early... Beautiful collection of dallias. Beautiful views. Stunning in the morning when it is quite empty!

These gardens are totally amazing! You will rarely experience gardens like these! All for free! There are easy to walk paths, labels to explain the various florals, and a little coffee/ice cream shop. Benches are sprinkled liberally throughout the park, which make it a favourite spot for elderly people. On summer days there are various artists selling their creations along...

A peaceful place to stroll and sit to think of the beauty that surrounds us.The flowers are very well placed and abundant.There are plenty of different varieties of water fowl,and other birds.There is entertainment at the gazibo at certain hours.It is a great place to visit in the center of a fine city.

Even when it is winter just looking at the gates covered in ice and snow and seeing the trees all covered swell is quite pretty. I can hardly wait till spring and the park opens its gate for all to enjoy. Walk around the outside and you still can enjoy the beauty of this place in the down town.

One large city block in area, a gorgeous oasis in the centre of downtown Halifax, highly maintained, with a small food bar. Vintage bandshell occasionally gives performances. Ponds with waterbirds, exotic trees, etc.Great place of solitude and beauty in midst of a bustling city. Closed in winter.

column3: Nova Scotia's Bay of Fundy and Annapolis Valley, Canada
column4: The Halifax Public Gardens are a peaceful, pretty spot in downtown Halifax. These historic gardens are extremely well kept, and are delightful to stroll through in the Spring, Summer or Fall. The dahlias are amazing!!
What a wonderful summer Park to go to, to feed the docs, and sit on nice day. Right on Springgarden Road, had a chance to grab a few ice cream cones and relax with the kids

When in Halifax during the Summer season ensure you take some time to visit the Public Gardens. They are a rare example of Victorian Gardens in North America. Featuring statues, fountains, several different garden types(including a desert garden!), ornamental trees, winding pathways and even waterfowl, including a few swans. There is a snack canteen in a historical building as well...

The Halifax Public Gardens are jewel in the city. Once you pass the large iron gates, you're in a paradise. Lovely trails, flowers, trees, benches and water foul - a lovely spot for a break with nature.
a pretty spot to take a walk, with lots of species of trees, a duck pond, well cared for gardens and more.

I have been to Halifax Public Gardens many times. It is a little piece of paradise within the busy city limits. The beautifully displayed plants, shrubs, trees and flowers are very creative. Very relaxing strolling the Gardens.
The Public Gardens are always on my show off list for visitors to Halifax. Truly gorgeous array of blooms and trees spring summer and fall. They are closed in winter. An interesting history also.

The park was larger than we expected and has very diverse parts with sometimes very big trees. We enjoyed strolling under the trees, the diverse bordersn the impressive pond and the very well maintained borders and flower beds.
If your visiting Halifax in the summer, or early fall the Public Gardens are not to be missed! Beautiful flowers and very enjoyable.
Love love love the gardens!!!!The rose gardens are especially pretty and the way the grounds are maintained is very beneficial for the visitors and the plants!

So beautiful! There are HUGE trees planted in the 1800's by the royals. Four of us adults linked arms around the trunk and still couldn't reach! This place is close to the historic graveyard that holds the victims of the Titanic.

My husband and I live in Halifax and we make a point to go to the Public Gardens at least once or twice a year to see the beautiful flowers, the ducks swimming and often expierence wedding photos being taken there.....lovely!

This was a short stop on our Halifax City tour, but the gardens are simply not to be missed. Many different floral varieties, immaculate grounds and a very peaceful setting in the middle of the city. A highly recommended stop!

Was on our 4 Hr. tour of Halifx Titanic Historical and this was 1 of our get off stop.We had 20 minutes to take a stroll among some beautiful settings. Seem like enough time to enjoy the walk. Of course you couldn't sit and relax and really absorb the beauty it has to offer.Lots of plants, and trees...

Such an interesting place to check out! You could spend as little as 5 minutes or as long as you want exploring the grounds. It's mainly a gorgeous garden but there are tons of little unique things (including a mini Titanic replica) and ducks! Would be a nice place to read a book or have a picnic in the summer!

The Halifax public gardens is at the edge of the Spring Garden Road shopping district. It is closed during the winter season.The meandering paths, are well maintained, easy to walk, and easy to wheel around chairs and strollers. Frequent benches allow visitors to rest and enjoy the beautiful surroundings flowers, people watch or enjoy the antique fountains. You can...

One of the jewels in Halifax is the Public Gardens. Ever changing with color throughout the seasons (except closed in the winter) this is a lovely place to take a stroll and enjoy the sun and fresh air. If you have children there is a "children's play area" along the Summer Street fence. Sunday's in the summer are wonderful as...

This is a beautiful place for Wedding , Graduation pictures, or any other function that would require beautiful flowers and scenery. The gardens are in the middle of Spring Garden road, which is one of the Main streets in Halifax and is packed full of shops, restaurants, shopping, movies, hotels, all within walking distance. Fantastic location and a great place...
A great place to relax and enjoy nature. Whether you stroll, sit or eat you will be captivated by the beauty of the gardens.The gardens are constantly changing so they can be enjoyed in any saeson.

This place is just beautiful, gorgeous gardens with lots of places to sit and enjoy the views. There is a rotunda and coffee shop with outside seating and lots of big shady trees. It's right in the middle of town so easy to get to, definitely worth a visit.
Spent a couple of hours in this park of an early Saturday morning in October. Beautiful park with lots of friendly dog-walkers, nice wide walkways and very clean. Wonderful Autumn walk.
Perfect place to stop and smell the roses, have an ice cream, sit and watch the swans, or just stroll through and enjoy the history of Halifax.

The Halifax Public Gardens are pretty much in my back yard. They are beautiful and look terrific in mid Spring right through till winter. Once a friend and I saw a hawk dive into a medium size lake for a little fish. They say Halifax 's Public Garden is a replica of a garden that is on the Buckingham Palace...

Easy to reach by public transport as there is a stop right outside of the gardens. Entering the gardens through the gates there were many pretty patches of flowers and well taken care of paths take you trough all there is to see.Funny thing was there was a guy feeding the two canada geese (which is actually not allowed)...

What a lovely place this is.......really! As a local I pass by often,and always enjoy looking in ,getting a glimpse of one thing or another,I find it to be such a calming place an oasis in the middle of the city.,Once you walk a few steps inside the city noise fades you can wonder down or around numerous meandering paths...

The Public Gardens is located right in the heart of Halifax on Spring Garden road. It is especially beautiful in the summer. It's a great place for a romantic stroll or for families. When I was a kid I used to go most Sundays to feed the ducks. For those of a foot tour around Halifax, the Public Gardens are...
Great music, beautiful surroundings and no cost to the public. Family were able to gather and enjoy their day.
Came here to relax, read and people watch. Unlike some gardens in Europe, however, you are not allowed to sit or lay on the grass and must remain on the provided park benches.
A gem in the middle of the city- what a beautiful place! Everywhere you turn is a different type of arrangement. It's a beautiful, peaceful place.
Had a great stroll through the gardens and our family thoroughly enjoyed the gardens and the buskers entertainment . Really a must visit for tourists .

If you are looking for a peaceful place to eat your lunch, this is it. Beautiful gardens, ponds with ducks, seating, canteen. I often take my lunch and drive to the public gardens to sit and just enjoy looking at the beauty of nature. It resides on Spring Garden Road across the street from Citadel Hill. Very historic garden in...

The gardens are an excellent way to spend a summers (or Spring) day. Bring a sandwich and have lunch. Appreciated by all in Halifax. Victorian style gardens with old fashioned bandstand. Live music in the afternoon and beautiful flowers all around.See the model of the Titanic in the pond. Sit on the many benches, relax and enjoy!!
The city had decided for the last few years, instead of closing on a specific date, to let the weather decide.This year they closed long before any winter weather was in evidence.Too Bad

The gardens are a beautiful peaceful place to take a walk and enjoy the unique flowers and plants. It is well looked after and very clean. Take a break from a busy day or pack a lunch and have a picnic. It's so nice to have such a pretty place so close to downtown. The ducks and geese aret a...

This is a nice place to stop in to get away from the busy downtown Halifax streets for a few minutes, It isn't huge, but there are many little trails you can go through, and many interesting plant exhibits to see!

Public Gardens is a well maintained gated oasis in the city of Halifax.It is located off busy Spring Garden Road, and is a great place to enjoy a quiet stroll, take some great photos and relax.Whether you are there for a leisurley afternoon or simply spending your lunch hour away from the office, it is a great way...

A lovely oasis in the midst of a busy shopping area. Fenced and gated, it is a peaceful stop for a stroll, or to sit on a bench to read, chat with others, or listen to in-season band concerts. Beautiful beds that change with the seasons, a well kept park with a duck (and swan) pond, lovely shade trees and...

I do tour guiding for cruise ships during the cruise season, and a number of our tours go through this beautiful Public Garden. I can never get over the beauty of the flowers, trees, walkways and the various statues, fountains etc, during the summer months. Should you visit Halifax any time between June & Oct, this place is a must...

The Halifax Public Gardens are a wonderful peaceful place to stroll around or just sit and enjoy some moments of quiet.For plant and tree lovers there are a good number of rare varieties on the grounds but in general. Having said that, I have no green thumbs and I simply enjoy the beauty of the place.There is a...

I have nothing bad to say about the park, except for perhaps that it is closed in the winter and there are no dogs allowed. It is a beautiful labour of love for the gardeners and a great place to discover and walk around, while not being too overwhelmingly large. It is suitable for seniors to enjoy as it is...

This is a place of memories for me, Each time I return to my home town I have to take a day to stroll through the Public Gardens, buy an ice cream, and listen to the concerts on Sunday afternoons. it is a peaceful place in the middle of a big city.
Great place to sit and relax or walk and enjoy the beautiful flowers throughout the park. Close to downtown core and lots of summer activities take place here

Halifax Gardens are found in downtown Halifax and they are a gem and all Haligonians are proud of their gardens. Walking, talking, photography are some of the pleasures to be enjoyed here. Beautiful trees, flowers and a small pond with plenty of ducks add to the delight of tourists and locals. The gardens are closed during Winter but in summer...

We made a stop at this garden from the hop on hop off bus. It was suggested that half an hour would be enough, but I would recommend longer. When we were here in October some of the gardens had been turned over, but the remaining beds and fall colour still presented a very picturesque spot. The pathways are wide...

There is no better place to stroll around in than these gardens in the centre of Halifax. These gardens are kept absolutely beautiful throughout the whole season by dedicated people. The trees, the flowers everything is perfect and such a peacful and quiet place to spend time.
This is a very nice place to stroll. Lots of pretty flowers. Don't miss the pond with the model Titanic and Lighthouse.
