Relaxing on a park bench with a coffee and a book is one of my favorite things to do in the summer. Public gardens has history, charm, and beauty.

A lovely place to walk through, I went once in the spring and it was naturally a little dreary from a harsh winter, but when we went this past fall it was beautiful!! I can only imagine how wonderful it is in the summer.

We've been many times to this unique, centrally located, very beautiful gardens, c/w duck ponds, food service, restroom facilities... the fauna and flora, with local edible plants, this garden is a must see, when in the Halifax area

I love the Public Gardens in the Summer. This is a great place to meet up with a friend for an ice cream and a walk, or to bring your children as well.The gardens and ponds are beautiful and their just seems to be a very happy, positive, relaxed feeling in the air. When I used to work at...

I'm usually in Halifax in the late fall or winter. I stay right across from the Halifax's Public Gardens at the wonderful Lord Nelson Hotel. However the gardens never seem to be open. This year I was there in May - hurray - the gardens were open, but there was no quiet place to sit. Between the workers planting -...

Beautiful place to walk in with many trees, plants, ducks, and also has a small store. A wonderful place for wedding pictures. Very serene, could spend hours there. There is a lot of seating for the public and a great place to read a book or just daydream. There are many paths to walk and this gem is absolutely free...

We stayed at the Lord Nelson hotel which is across from the park. This is a true gem in the center of this commercial area. We were there on a Sunday. We had icecream while listening to live music being played in the pavilion.

My best friend and I traveled to Halifax via Cruise ship and it was great to have a day out and see the see some of Halifax. We spent an hour or so in the Gardens as the weather was delightful! We traveled in Oct. 2013, but I'm sure it's still lovely today

Halifax public gardens is one of the nicest places to visit in the city. This Victorian garden is so beautiful and tranquil. Relax by the fountain or walk the paths. A great way to spend a couple of hours and it doesn't cost a cent!
Had some time to kill before we had to be back to our ship and came across the public gardens. I is bigger than you would expect and some very nice plantings.
I wish we would have spent a little longer here. It was beautiful but we chose a cold day to go and I couldn't wait to get back inside.

Halifax Public Garden is a beautiful park located in downtown Halifax. A wonderful location. It is a quiet spot in the city. there are a variety of trees in the park, with all kinds of flowers in summer. A nice place to visit.
love this place ..love the flowers and even open until is snows good for a walk have music in the park on summer afternoons right downtown lots of history and flowers etc

Only had time for a quick walk through the park & we were here in November. Lovely pond witha gigantic weeping beech, pavillion & flowerbeds. There were still a few roses trying to bloom at this time of year. I can only imagine how beautiful it is in the spring & summer. I will definitely make time to come back...

I was thoroughly amazed at what I beheld on my stroll through the Halifax Public Garden. I had no idea this pleasant locale existed, and that it would be so lovely, even late in October. I would dearly love to come here daily if I lived here, and eat my lunch and enjoy the beauty and serenity. What makes it...
To see the Gardens first thing in the morning is better than coffee, and to walk through them at the end of the day reminds me that nature triumphs.

Beautifully manicured city gardens near the Citadel and Commons. It was free to walk through and so peaceful, we plan on spending several afternoons relaxing in the beauty, weather permitting. It was one of the cleanest parts of Halifax we had come across yet.
This is a small but lovely and peaceful public garden. Well maintained, great paths and interesting flowers and trees you wouldn't expect to see there. A great break in my day.

Just a few minutes walk from the port and near the old Fort this Victorian style park has a lot to offer the the amateurs botanist. There is a lovely little lake in the middle with a tribute to the Titanic and HMCS Sackville.

Came here in November so it was little more than a few die-hard roses and glorious Autumn leaves, still worth it though. I bet it's great in summer! Definitely worth strolling through. The ponds were pretty, and loved the geese!
This is supposed to be the oldest public gardens in North America. We have visited the Halifax Public Gardens several times over the years and it never disappoints.
If you are a gardener and/or enjoy flowers this is a beautiful place to visit. I only walked around part of the gardens and they were so well taken care of.
Wonderful gardens to wander around with a lake complete with scale replicas of a Cunard Liner and a Corvette. Bandstand, ducks, streams with bridges add to the scenic delight.
Beautiful Gardens, flowers, swans, ducks, a place to meander / rest Enjoy Free to all to come and enjoy
Love love love this park! It is worth stopping in and walking around, everything about it was beautiful and well thought out including the titanic boat in the water and the duck pond!
It a good depot to stroll though and take a test on the benches. There is a pond n the middle of the Baden with ducks and a model,of the Titantic.

This is said to be the oldest public garden in North America, and that's easy to believe. It is absolutely classic English garden architecture, a decent array of statuary, wonderful flower beds (magnificent dahlias), trees (some quite old) nicely labeled, a lake with a natural creek running through it and on out across the garden. It's all there and more...

The Public Gardens are just a delightful place to unwind and relax. The flower gardens are colorful and beautifully laid out. The lakes are spectacular, and you can just wander around and take it all in at whatever pace you like.
Even though it was Autumn the garden was still a lovely walk. The pond was pretty and it was a busy place.

What a beautiful place. We arrived fairly late in the afternoon, planning to enjoy the late sun. Advertised as open till dusk, we got shooed out by an assertive worker on a ATV telling us it was time to leave......not anywhere close to dusk....was somewhat disappointed with that but the gardens are lovely.

These gardens are wonderful to return over and over, and enjoy something different every time. The dahlias this year were absolutely stunning, and it was so interesting to see so many different varieties. The staff do an amazing job to keep these gardens so beautifully. Thank you for bringing so much pleasure to so many people.

Even with the annual flowers gone, this oasis is gorgeous. I just love the way the paths meander through the space. Beautiful use of water, little bridges, and geese all add to the beauty. Wish I could see it in the spring and summer.

Went here in September as part of a tour from a cruise ship. It's only about 1/2 mile from the Harbor walking distance to get to the beginning of Spring Garden Road and this is a couple blocks further down. Easily walkable from a cruise ship.Normally, I'm not huge on walking around a garden on my trips but this...
We were dropped off on one side of the gardens and walked through to the opposite side. Plenty of colour still in October. Lovely Bandstand
This is just a lovely place to take a stroll and people watch, duck watch as well. Not many flowers this time of year but still beautiful and well maintained.

column3: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
column4: We were able to see the fall beauty of this public gardens and could see how lovely it would be in the summer months.
A great area that is accessible to one and all. Borders on Spring Garden & Robie St., in Halifax & has concerts in the summer months. One can also enjoy the flowers, bridges and ducks!

You really have to see the Gardens.They are quite wonderful and the plants and water features are beautiful a old band stand were you can sit and enjoy the music.There is a cafe This is a perfect place for wedding pictures.The gardens are just so relaxing in the summer.There is a tree planted by Charles and Diana.in the 80s

This is a must see for any tourists. Although I live in NS, I come here a few times throughout the summer. The gardens are magnificent and after you park you can stroll down Spring Garden Road for some dining/shopping. Usually in the summer, there are free live jazz concerts on Sundays from 2-4.
we didn't know what to expect for September gardens but this garden was just beautiful; so much variety and such beautiful blooms, fountains and statuary; a definite must for a Halifax trip

Halifax Public Gardens is a great place to spend an hour while in Halifax. A security guard (it's not dangerous, he is there mainly to enforce the Garden's rules) told us that it is not a park. It is expressly a Garden. The Garden is strictly a pedestrian zone and does not allow any sort of wheeled activity (well, probably...

The Gardens are really beautiful, and are located right in the middle of downtown. They feel very European. Don't go jogging here- and don't bring a bicycle or a dog in. They are very strict about enforcing these (archaic) rules.

The public gardens are small but then that makes them that little bit more accessible to a wider range of people. They are beautifully laid out and even in the fall there was plenty of colour and interest in the garden. There was a dahlia display going on which the bees were still loving. Useful public toilets here too and...

I really loved these lovely Victorian gardens in the core of Halifax. It is a great place to take refuge from crowds and noise. Well planned. Whether for a stroll or to sit on a bench this is is the place

These gardens were more impressive than the ones in our city of Boston. In the fall flowers were lush and abundant. There were many fountains, a gazebo, and a pond with "ships" floating in it including a little Titanic at one time.
This is a beautiful park like setting in the heart of the city. A must when visiting Halifax. Wear your walking shoes as there is much to seee.

Definitely take time to stroll through these gardens but unless you just have time to kill, a diagonal walk from one gate to the other will suffice. These grounds are well maintained and after being on a cruise ship for two days, they were a welcome stretch on solid ground.
This is one on my favourite places. Always enjoyed a little bit of peace from the outside world...The location is great because its right downtown.

I'm a gardener from Ontario who visited Halifax in early October. A visit to the Public Gardens was high on my list and I was truly delighted to be able to see so many lovely garden beds still in flower. There was a display of dahlias - many different named varieties, all in full bloom. We liked the pond, the...
It was October, but the weather was the lovely and hot, still lots of flowers blooming. I enjoyed the variety of plant life in the park along with all the fountains, etc. Not to be missed.
Really pretty gardens with lovely sculptures, flower beds and interesting features.peaceful and well maintained. Very colourful.

We spent some time on a Sunday afternoon relaxing in the wonderful autumn weather which was better than our Scottish 'summer 2015'. Nothing spectacular, but just very pleasant. A very good coffee shop with great ice cream was visited to great affect.

We had time to walk the gardens on our trip. Even in October the Public Gardens were beautiful with fall flowers in bloom and the trees starting their fall foliage colors. It is such a lovely oasis in the middle of Halifax.
I had a few minutes to spare while I was in downtown Halifax and decided to take a stroll through the Public Gardens. They were as beautiful as ever.

We had some time on our way back from Cape Breton. We plugged this park into our GPS and were thrilled that we did. Simply gorgeous. If you want some pretty pictures of flowers, grounds, or a natural setting for a portrait, this is the place. Be sure to use GPS as it is a little tricky to get there....
Beautiful green space in city. Easy walk from cruise terminal. Nice to have map at entrance, trees, etc identified.

As we stayed in The Lord Nelson, it was a foregone conclusion that we would visit the Gardens which lie adjacent to The Lord Nelson, We visited the Gardens on a grey, drizzly day so avoided large crowds which added to our enjoyment of this lovely green space.

This was also part of a larger all day tour, so we didn't get to see the whole gardens, but what we did see of them was beautiful. The gazebo and the fountain were two of my favorite things. We visited in Oct, so some plants had been removed because of the cooler nights. I would love to see them...
This is an extremely well kept park in the centre of Halifax - a credit to the city.It has a wide variety of plants and lots of water. It even has a bandstand.Well worth a visit on a fine day.
Beautifully maintained park with a large selection of exotic plants. Central Park of Halifax. Nice place to rest and relax.
In a walk around Halifax from our recent Cruise trip, we walked through the gardens. We found them to be beautiful and had more flowers than we expected for our late September day.
Great way to spend time on an outstanding Fall day. Very classic in every way from the bandstand, classic gates, and wonderful paths to stroll and enjoy.
This park is well done and looked after a nice quit place to visit in the summer months you will enjoy everything part of its beauty.

The oldest Victorian gardens in North America, are a must see. In the midst of the city, an entire city block is dedicated to plants, trees, and flowers. Gorgeous. With a duck pond, benches, a café and sometimes concerts at the band stand, the Public Gardens are a treat.

This is an excellent garden in the middle of the city. Not too big but big enough to have some nice places to sit and relax. The flowers are a plenty and have a very good variety. it is almost impossible to visit on a Saturday without seeing a wedding party having their picture taken on the little bridge. The...

My husband and I visited Halifax for a day on a cruise port stop. We took a tour which gave us a few hours to spend in the downtown. We visited the park and had enough time to admire the flowers and walk through the park. It was beautiful. There is a lot of care put into the gardens and...

When my husband and I walked through these gardens I never wanted to leave. Honestly, in my opinion, the most beautiful gardens I have ever been in. So beautiful and so peaceful. Beautiful flowered bushes and ponds and pathways. Such a perfect way to end our day after a day of sight seeing, if I lived in Halifax I would...

Had occasion to walk through the gardens on an unseasonably warm sunny October morning and was treated to spectacular array of colours everywhere I walked. Dahlias and fall colors on the trees priduced a sight to behold. If you're ever in the area, take the time to walk through. You won't be disappointed.
I live locally and love taking the kids to the gardens when I am in the area. Its a great place to picnic with your little ones and the flowers are gorgeous!!
It is really pretty. Perfect place to sit and read a good book or just have a quick look at your map to see what else do you need to wisit in Halifax.:)

A must-see if visiting Halifax! Many unique and interesting varieties of plants, trees, shrubs and flowers. A pond, ducks and other birds. Quiet, serene, pleasant. Take a romantic walk, a healthy stroll or happily waste time. Had great conversations with strangers. Really lovely and a crowning jewel of Halifax. Enjoy!

Walked around the Victorian Park after visiting the Fort Hill for the viewsVery well maintained with beautiful vistas across the whole area. I'd guess the bandstand is used for public concerts and that would be a real treat in fine weather as well.

The Gardens are Victorian in both their history and their current rules. No jogging, no exercising, pets, no weddings, no smoking, no picnics... and yes, the rules are enforced! However, if you're just looking for a quiet stroll, and want to admire some very well-tended gardens, it's an easy hour or so. Really lovely, fairly quiet, very soothing, and easily...
A beautiful park loaded with trees outstanding gardens and just a great place to spend an afternoon very clean and extremely well maintained
Went there on thanksgiving 2015. Everything was very clean. The floeers still blooming. The ducks and goose very cute and entertaining. A lot of big and lovely trees.

We visited this on a tour of the city. Though it was October, almost all the flowers were still in bloom. Touring with a guide gives more meaning to the gardens, but even if you don't have a guided tour, it is beautiful and so well kept! Even if not a flower-lover, you will enjoy it!

Not much to see, just a garden or a public park in business downtown area. Our tour bus drove by, but did not stop, we can see some visitors walking around. It is not a big park, you can see through from one side to the other side. From a Texan's point of view, it is just a small public...

For the first week in October I was surprised to see so many flowers still in bloom. The park was full of people walking around and enjoying what the park had to offer. Very glad I chose to check it out. Well worth the time spent walking there and would like to see it again in spring or summer.
A beautiful setting to see, stroll and absorb. This is stunning example of exquisite formal design. You really need time to be able to do this park justice.

If you're in the city. You must visit. It is a enjoyed treat by locals and visitors alike. Plentiful beautiful plants from around the world. Visit with friends or bring a lunch and watch the ducks hang out.
You do not want to miss these gardens. This is one of the best I have ever seen. Halifax taxi is a good way to also get around the city

Beautiful Victorian Garden in the heart of the city that I stumbled on during a walk. It's got water features, friendly ducks and gorgeous landscaping. Great place to come to take wedding and/or romantic photos.
Walking around the gardens was very relaxing.The flowerbeds were pretty interesting. There was a gazebo and there were geese? in one area.
Gorgeous garden with a beautiful layout of a French garden style that has 100's of flowering plants. You can stroll the gardens or just sit and enjoy
A pleasant oasis in the middle of the city- although Halifax isn't a big noisy place when compared to major European or North American cities. Just a nice place to commune with nature and relax.

Lovely gardens. We took a hop on hop off trolley to get there. The 1st time we went a couple of years ago we did not have thetime to really enjoy the gardens. This time we took a leisurely tour and enjoyed.
Even though we went in June, all the flowers and trees were not in blossom, but you could still see the beauty of the garden..

Hop on hop off bus tour. Took walk through this beautiful park , with the leaves just starting to change color and flowers still blooming. They take good care of this park. Workers were already raking the few leaves that had come off the trees. Nice place in the city.

I asked our tour guide to stop at the Public Gardens at the end of our private tour since they looked so beautiful when we drove by earlier in the day. I only had 20 minutes but I enjoyed every one. The gardens are absolutely beautiful and I forgot that I was in the middle of a city. The day...

This is just a wonderful place to wander through or sit on one of many benches gazing across the pond. The flowers are lovely and colourful and everything is so well maintained. The dahlias in particular were quite amazing! It isn't a huge park but there are different areas to explore and even a cafe on site. Great respite and...

The variety of types of flowers they have at the gardens is amazing. The grounds are impeccable. Even if you are not a plant lover, just take a walk through the gardens, it will surely put a smile on your face.
One square city block consisting of border and serpentine paths. Multiple gardens including two sets of dahlias, fountains, ponds, gazebo, trees and benches.

The public gardens is always an excellent way to spend a relaxing afternoon when you are looking for something non-complicated to do on a sunny afternoon. The grounds are well maintained and there is plenty to catch your eye.

The Halifax Public Gardens are right in the middle of the city of Halifax, easily accessible by public transportation. If you're in Halifax for at least a day, get to these gardens. They're not big but they are absolutely gorgeous. We were there in Mid September when the weather was uncharacteristically beautiful. The gardens are very nicely landscaped with paths,...
A gorgeous spot to visit right in the heart of Halifax. The serenity and peaceful transformation from the street to the park is stunning.

We only had a quick stop in the Public Gardens but it was so worth it. Even though it was September there were still so many flowers in bloom, they were beautiful. If you go, do not miss the dahlia display -- it was by far the highlight of the garden. Just spectacular!

When we arrived at the port on our cruise ship we got a map from the information desk which had a walking tour. This was one destination along the way and proved to be a highlight. The gardens are magnificent. Very much of the Victorian era, well maintained, spotless really. There is a coffee shop. A small pond and amazing...
Beautiful well-kept public gardens. Lovely gazebos and displays of annuals & perennials. There is a tree planted by Queen Elizabeth when she was a little girl.

The public gardens are free and provide some beautiful floral experiences. There's fountains and ponds and ducks and bandstand and cafe and lots more just to wander around. I particularly enjoyed looking at their small area of amazing different couloured and different varieties of dahlias.
The public gardens were still wonderful in late September. There is a lovely tea/coffee house with plenty of outdoor seating. This is a must-see for a Halifax visit.
This is a great place to relax and enjoy the garden that was very well kept. Lots of locals seemed to enjoy their lunches in this park.

The Public Gardens are one of my very favourite things about the City of Halifax. From the tulips blooming in the spring, to the giant walls of rhododendrons in the summer, to the gorgeous dahlias in the Autumn - it's always a nice break. Grab a coffee from Uncommon Grounds or an ice cream from Sugah and take a break...

Be sure to visit this Victorian Garden on your stop in Halifax. This garden is very well maintained, with a wide assortment of floral displays, and also is an arborist's delight.We brought our coffee in, early one morning, and found a park bench to sit on and view the displays before us. Very relaxing, very refreshing. The beauty of...
In the heart of the historic district is the Public Gardens, this was a very pleasant place to walk and unwind after a long business trip. Thoroughly enjoyed the gardens.

Noticed many groups touring around the gardens, so stopped while driving by to see what the attraction was. It's free to the public and is a beautiful garden with a small lake, a stream, many, many flowers, bushes and trees in bloom (we visited in September). Just a nice, quiet place to stroll in the city.

We had time to kill before catching a flight and wandered to the gardens by chance. They are a wonderful oasis in the middle of a busy city. The flowers are gorgeous and so artfully planted. Several spelled out current messages (such as the Year of the Soil (as proclaimed by the UN). The ponds are well kept and free...

We passed through for the first time this weekend. A nice walk through gardens, flowers and fountains was a nice change from the downtown traffic and crowds. A good place for a stroll on a nice sunny day.
Enjoyed our time walking and relaxing at the gardens. Busy as there were 2 cruise ships in town. Very well maintained. A must see when in Halifax.

Being September, I was not expecting to see much garden blooms but was I surprisedThe grounds were in such good shape and the garden crew were busy keeping it that wayThe colours and condition of the plants was amazingGo go go it is a must visit but do not rush stay a while and enjoy

I am somewhat of a gardener and did enjoy and relish my trips to the garden each day. Even brought my husband along the last day on an afternoon outing.So much attention to detail is given here. Wonderful

The Halifax Public Gardens is like a small oasis in the city. You can still hear the traffic outside the gates, but the beauty of the garden surroundings will overtake your senses. Small children enjoying the geese in the pond, seniors reading in the shade, and others just people watching like you will help you feel relaxed and rejuvenated. Band...
Lovely flower beds and comfortable walking paths. A not-to-miss in Halifax. A true Victorian Garden with a great display of dahlias.

Right in the middle of the city is a great garden to stroll through and get a break from the hustle of city life. The historical gardens are like taking a step back in time to a much more civilized era.
A beautiful must see. It is like walking back in time to a Victorian garden that is simply wonderful
Peaceful and serene, always a new tree, plant or flower to discover. Staff is very helpful and willing to answer your questions.Great place for pictures.

We did not expect to find such beauty in a public garden. The gardens here are wonderfully well maintained and the flowers just beautiful. Small bridges over little streams bounded by lush vegetation and a pond equally pretty. The multiple pathways are easily accessible and each offers the walker a new surprise. Loved this place.Bob & Martha
Quite a lovely expanse of plants, trees, shrubs of all types indigenous to the area. Worth a walk through and maybe a sandwich at the local cafe in the middle of the park overlooking the bandstand.

Smaller than perhaps one would hope for, these are exceptionally well done with an abundance of seating. Cheap but high quality and well portioned ice cream will give you an excuse to stay around here for longer. Most of the plants are labelled too, it's practically an arboretum.

Very pleasant time spent walking around there for an hour. It is free. It is a surprisingly well cared for garden. The variety af beautiful flowers rival some pretty heady company. Congrats Halifax . . .
This park is absolutely beautiful, and should be a stop on your way through Halifax. Just immerse yourself in the beauty and tranquility.
Beautiful gardens which were near our hotel. Brilliant colors and restful setting. Well maintained. Family friendly.
Beautiful place to visit and perfect venue to have a picnic lunch. Great coffee in the pavilion cafe.
Just a beautiful and serene piece of paradise in the middle of downtown Halifax.Right across the street from the Lord Nelson hotel. Lovely coffee and ice cream shop inside the park.

Another place that was devastated by Hurricane Juan and made a come back.It's location is excellent with some attractions and floral arrangements.Keep expectations low and if so, you will not be disappointed
We loved the gardens, and the interesting minuments and history. Don't miss the replica Titanic in one of the center ponds, where we also saw a Blue Heron.

Take the time and walk to the Public Garden, you won't be disappointed. The flowers were all in bloom, with manicured pathways, water features, and gazebo. This garden area is well maintained. This is on the suggested route of a walking tour.

Wonderful park, could spend a quick walk or half the day here, easily! Many species of plant and flower, near to downtown attractions, great place for a walk after lunch on Spring Garden. The patio at Lord Nelson has great view of the park.

A local guide from Halifax included in part of the tour I was on took our group over various sights in Halifax. The Public Gardens was one of these. Beautifully cared for and maintained.Although it was raining whilst I was visiting the photos that I took were still amazing took look at. I am not a garden type of...
Beautiful trees and flowers, lovely statues and water features, and it's free for everyone to enjoy.

Beautiful gardens and a wonderful respite from the city. Absolute must if you like flowers and nature!There is no admission and a vast variety of displays. We saw a wonderful collection of several differing types of dahlias.Enjoy your visit!

Walked in to see the bandstand and have a coffee.Great coffee and took a panini to go as off on winery tour.Great public park that's in great condition with at least six gardening staff working on flower beds

It was a beautiful sunny day and we had never been to Halifax so we decided to walk around the city. The Public Gardens are free and they were in full bloom despite the fact it was already September. There was a wonderful Dahlia exhibit -- there must have been 100 varieties. The friendly Botanist spent some time talking to...
Well kept and gorgeous even into fall. A respite in the middle of the city. There is even a tea shop on one end of the park.
Beautiful gardens in the center of the city. Provides a refreshing break from busyness and/or touring.
Beautiful gardens to walk through and people watch, lots of different types of flowers, and pretty ducks and other wild life

The Halifax Public Gardens is definitely worth a visit. An oasis of calm in the city, it's a beautiful place to spend an hour or two. In the summer, there are free concerts at the bandstand, making it even more of a must-see.The gardens are amazing - local and exotic plants and trees with both formal plantings and more...
Beautiful, immaculate gardens - spend a few minutes or a few hours - gorgeous grounds, plants, flowers.

These are among the more beautiful public gardens I have visited, and I've been attracted to them the world over. These aren't spoiled by a lot of sub-attractions, which frequently are only distractions. You can sit here and recollect yourself without being disturbed, which is just as it should be. A good retreat.

Such a beautiful place, the gardens are simply amazing, the area is clean and well maintained, you can go for a walk through the different types of trees and plants or sit on a bench and enjoy the nature.
beautiful gardens, nice to walk around and admire all the care going into it, smelled pretty,too.it was an attractive addition to the tour of halifax we took that day.
Quiet, fenced, lots of beautiful places to sit, walk, and enjoy nature. Extremely well kept gardens and easy to find washrooms and water fountains.

Enjoy a peaceful stroll through these oldest gardens in North America! Take a book, buy an ice cream and watch the birds. These gardens are free and since they are in the center of Halifax, are easily accessible. Go up Spring Garden Road and enjoy the atmosphere of Halifax.

Beautiful, peaceful, huge...............anyone would enjoy strolling through these gardens!There were 2 ducks/geese??? that were extremely rare - feeding in an enclosed area.A little 'teahouse' - very cute and their ice cream cones for a single are VERY large!!
This is a very nice surprise in the middle of the town. Park is nice to walk and very well maintained.
It is a must see and experience true beauty when visiting Halifax for the first time or repeat visits. The wonder of natural beauty at its finest!!
Very peaceful, clean and beautiful arrangements. Great photo ops and a perfect place for a stroll when the hustle and bustle get to you.
Such a beautiful and relaxing place. Plenty of photo ops. A must see. The Gardens had a broad and beautiful assortment of plants. Plan to spend some time there.
We stopped here while we were touring for the day. Beautiful gardens! We walked from one end to the other.
The public gardens are lovely. Lots of pretty flowers and plants to look at. A quite and serene spot centrally located in Halifax.
Amazing garden a little distance from the waterfront (up hill!!). Very well laid out and maintained. A gem.

Beautiful Gardens - very peaceful walking through the grassy areas and flower beds . Small children and their Mum's can enjoy Story Time Under the Tree on certain days of the week in summer. Many free musical performances available as well
Beautiful mid size gardens providing a lovely green break in the city. Definitely worth a visit if you are nearby.
Well kept garden and worth a stroll for the whole family. I visited the garden twice since jogging around was too fast for seeing all the small things.

These delightful gardens have beautiful entrance gates with decorative plaques. The paths weave through a lovely stream and a lake. There is a beautiful band stand, an inactive fountain and other interesting statues. There are wonderful plants and flowers. The whole gardens are beautifully maintained.

We stopped at this park on the way from downtown. It has beautiful flower gardens and a lovely gazebo. It was a great place to rest and decompress after spending most of the day walking around downtown. We happened to see a wedding party there for pictures so that was nice. There are plenty of places to sit and everyone...
Luscious, beautiful grounds, loved the lake in the middle. Loved all the different types of plant life.Clean and peaceful, easy to find, easy parking.

The gardens are a lovely place to go for a short walk. Nothing strenuous, and just gorgeous. The geese are particularly cute!Good place for children as well.The gardens are well located, at the corner of the 'most busy street east of Montreal' therefore you'll have plenty of options for coffee / drinks / food.Enjoy!

This large park has many winding paths for pleasant strolling. There's a small lake with a tiny, tiny Titanic in it, an ornate bandstand, lots of huge and beautiful ornamental trees, flowerbeds - packed with blooms and foliage plants - dotted around, a number of ornate fountains and statues, and plenty of benches for sitting. Some of the plantings are...
Halifax Public Gardens is very close to downtown and is a great place to relax and hang out with a large number of benches and lawns.
We heard a band on Sunday, saw lovely flowers, and took pictures of a blue heron. They change the flowers to go with the seasons.
No dogs allowed. We booked across from this park so I could sit in the park with my THREE lb dog. Yes thats like smaller then guinea pig. Security will kick you out if you try this.

This is a historically significant garden, largely for the design (Victorian) rather than the plantings per se. The overall impression is that you enter this garden to "amble" rather than to be overwhelmed by a profusion of blooms. So there are wide walkways, smaller clusters of plants, some nice 'settings' and a small bandstand. It is very peaceful and you...

This is one of the most beautiful,well tended and colourful gardens it's been my pleasure to visit.It's centrepiece is a grand old victorian bandstand on which concerts are performed mainly on sundays.Radiating from the centre are beautifully ordered flowerbeds with flowers of all descriptions.There are several fountains and monuments worthy of a look but best of all there is a...

Take a coffee with you and stroll this garden first thing in the morning and breathe in the fresh air and beauty! Loved it! Ponds, statues, flowers and pavilion make this park a peaceful colorful and delightful stroll!
It is beautiful and well groomed.its not too bug so dont plan a day around it but its nice in the eyes ...soothing
Lovely gardens to stroll through after a day of site-seeing...AND, we were lucky, across the street from The Lord Nelson...

I have aways love gardens & particulary ones with a theme or particular 'flavour'. These are and have always been maintined with love and great care taken to keep them in the ture VIctorian period design and detail including keeping to appropriate plants. In fact, I believe that in the early 2000's a major effort was made to restore the...

It's so peaceful and relaxing. A great place to sit and read a book or use a computer. Lots of green space to sit (where allowed) and maybe do some yoga. Running or jogging aren't allowed so its a great place for a nice walk and for kids to play. It has ducks and geese and turtles just roaming around...
The Public Gardens is an absolutely wonderful place to take a leisurely walk, enjoy the flowers, have a picnic lunch or feed the ducks. No need to go far out of the city to enjoy a break .
Take some time to stroll through these beautiful gardens. Very peaceful and well worth you're time. Loved the variety of flora.
Don't miss these gardens. This is a perfect spot for a morning walk or jog with lots of interesting trees and plantings.

Wish we had been able to spend more time here! We did not know about the gardens until we stopped there on a bicycle tour. We couldn't believe how large and how perfectly cared for this garden was. It is right in the middle of the city but feels like you have stepped into another world as soon as you...

From the different colour flowers to the designs that they were in everyone in my family enjoyed this garden . It was a beutifull place and was very clean . We went twice once I the rain and once it is nice to take some of your pics in the rain for example a flower with water on its petals...

Our tour guide explained how Halifax has a close tie with Boston (where our cruise originated) & I thought the Boston Gardens were wonderful. These gardens were just as beautiful and maybe even moreso! Beautiful flowers, plantings that make a sea serpent, music gazebos, you name it. By all means, carve out enough time if for just a stroll through.
Absolutely beautiful! Tons of flowers in amazing colors and very serene and peaceful. Cute store also with ice cream or coffee and cute sweatshirts or t-shirts.
Good for a stroll while visiting halifax. The lawns and flowers are very well kept. It's worth a quick visit but I definitely do not see anyone spending alot of time here.
Extensive Victorian gardens with both broad vistas and beautiful floral tapestries composed of intense and carefully maintained planting beds.

This is a lovely (and FREE) attraction in Halifax. The flowers are beautiful and there are some historical spots in the gardens, such as a tree planted by King George VI in the 1930's. It was a great way to spend the early evening, I saw some unique blooms and enjoyed the old world atmosphere of many spots, as well...

Although the gardens are right at the top of the citadel hill, it is well worth the effort to visit them. They were in immaculate condition. Planting was well thought out, the Victorian Bandstand was well maintained, and the refreshments available in the centre were excellent - good coffee and cakes. Interesting water features and a fascinating Boer War memorial....
Was a very peaceful and well kept park on the first day I visited and then the next day was full of high school graduates in their prom dresses - great fun

It's certainly not the most "natural" park around the area, but its still very impressive. The plants are all highly cultivated and the animals are either domestic waterfowl or feral squirrels so if what you're interested in is nature I don't recommend it. If cultivated botany is more your thing than I would imagine this to be a very enjoyable...
Beautiful victorian style gardens. Perfect for a stroll in the afternoon. We went there in a sunny Summer day and the trees provided great shade. There are also many places to seat.
What a beautiful and serene place to visit.The lawns are well kept and all the flowers are so well presented.Well worth a visit
We thoroughly enjoyed the beautiful and creative public gardens in Halifax. I captured many great photos of the gorgeous flowers and beds.

This garden is open to all - no admission fee. The gardens are pretty, there is quite a bit of open grassy area and there are benches to sit on. Some trees have signs indicating what they are; very few of the annuals or perennials are marked, except the dahlias which had information about different types of dahlias as well...
Walked through the gardens during our guided tour of Halifax. Not too crowded and very pleasant break from the city.
I went into the gardens after a rain storm and got some really nice flower photos with raindrops on them. The garden is a little oasis in the city!
Surprisingly beautiful garden. You can spend just 30 minutes strolling through the various sections or linger over a cup of coffee at the small cafe near the band-stand. Definitely worth a visit.

Beautifully manicured lawns and flower beds create and urban oasis where we saw a peculiar breed of geese and a graceful heron wading in the pond. Gorgeous fountains where birds were bathing added to the ambiance.
What a beautiful spot - manicured gardens, looking quite British. Spend 15 minutes or a couple of hours.

Beautiful Victorian garden in the heart of Halifax! We have been to Butchart Gardens in BC which is lovely but this is what I call a more tranquil garden, probably just as much work but more relaxing. We went there in September and even though cloudy weather... it was magnificent!Plan on spending a minimum of an hour there. Very...

Beautiful garden well worth the visit. Nice variety of flowers. Excellent location near downtown area. Great blueberry ice cream at small concession in the park. Very relaxing with little pedestrian traffic.

Took a walk through here with my daughter. It is a great garden, somewhat isolated from the hustle of the city. It has beautiful vistas for photographs, would be a great place for a wedding on a sunny day or for wedding photos at the very least. It is a nice place to pass the time when you are ready...
As I walked through the Public Gardens I felt as though I was walking in a Monet Painting! Beautiful and so very peaceful!

We are not crazy gardeners but still really enjoyed strolling through the gardens and ponds. We walked from the wharf on a hot muggy day and it was doable but the hills are a bit of a killer. There are lots of benches in the park to sit and have a drink and snack. It looks like there is a...

What can you say about the Halifax Public Gardens....it is a beautiful spot to sit and watch the scenery whether it is nature or people. Have a nice meal on Spring Garden Road and take a nice leisurely stroll through the Public Gardens to see the flowers trees and plants. If you time it right there is a place for...

A great location across the street from our hotel, The Lord Nelson Hotel and Suites. A quiet city garden with beautiful, well groomed landscapes and flowers. Many available benches to sit and admire Mother Nature. A jewel in the middle of the city. Simply refreshing to see a lot of green and not concrete...

After a day exploring the Halifax Waterfront, we finished our day at the Public Gardens. We enjoyed seeing the beautiful flowers and all the varieties of trees. We even made it fun for the children, ages 6 and 8 by allowing each to take a turn choosing the path in the gardens to guide us on our adventure. Our day...
It is a beautiful garden, such natural beauty, plus we went during fall season, which we were told is the best time to visit, there's also a park area to sit and relax with plenty of shade

I experienced the Halifax public garden for the first time in August 2015. It is a relaxing walk with gardens of foliage and flowers. It has its own bandshell for weekend instrumental recitals. With many benches to sit and relax and watch the world go by, or read a good book, the public gardens is a must see if you...

The Public Gardens are beautiful for a quick stroll or for a long, lingering walk. The flowers and fountains are beautiful, and kids can run around for ages along all the paths. The gates close 30 min. before sunset, so be aware of that if you are planning an evening stroll!
Even guys would like this place, lots of beauty here. try to find a maintenance worker and talke to them about the place they are very knowledgeable and helpful

This is a nice park for a stroll. It doesn't need a lot of time and make sure you do the waterfront and Citadel in priority to this in my opinion. We went before doing Harbour Hopper Tour. I wish we went after as it gave some good history.
Beautiful garden/park that reminds you of a different era. Well worth the visit to step back in time.
We were there during the end of the season so many flowers were done blooming. It is however a great place to stroll and enjoy the beauty of the gardens. Stop for an ice cream when you're done.
Great for an evening walk! Loved the scenery, and the flowers. Had an amazing time. I would reallt recommend seeing it for yourself

Very nice place for a stroll. I took many pics of flowers and little scenes. They had a dalia exhibit on the lawn, they were incredible. Unfortunately it was unusually hot and humid that day otherwise we would have sat and hung out for a bit. oh yea ITS FREE

The gardens are wonderful and as my partner does not like dogs the addition of a ban on them in the park is a bonus. Be aware the park does not open until 7am and closes half an hour before sunset. There is a lake to walk around at one end, which had a heron and ducks in it during...
Ornate fountains. Towering gates. Flowers galore. Easy walking paths, even with a wheelchair or stroller. Plenty of taxi stands and dining options nearby.

If you are spending even a single night in Halifax it's worth the walk up Spring Garden Street away from the touristy boardwalk and waterfront to escape to the stunning beauty of the Public a Gardens. You could travel to any European city and not discover such a tranquil and gorgeous place for walking, sitting, and sipping a cup of...
The gardens are quite lovely, very quite for the middle of town. My sister and I had a good time wandering around and checking out the flowers and ponds and statuary. Not too stuffy either.

Although it was very wet - raining, our walk through the public gardens provided a great experience for the senses. There was a profusion a colour and scents. The rain and wet probably contributed to the sense of solitude because there were few others in the park
Great spot for a stroll and to relax. So many beautiful flowers here and the gazebo in the middle of the garden is the perfect spot for a picture. We spent about an hour strolling and chatting here.

Nice, well-kept up, with plenty of benches all around for sitting and relaxing. Restrooms are near the entrance. Not a huge park but very nice. Parking is paid parking on the streets surrounding the park.Great place to find a quiet corner and clear your head. Or to enjoy the variety and plants and flowers.

This is an absolutely delightful public garden. Beautifully laid out, immaculately groomed and small enough to leisurely enjoy in an hour or two. The plantings are thoughtfully laid out and labeled. During our visit, the dahlias were in full bloom. Even thought it was overcast with a bit of drizzling rain, but it didn't detract from our enjoyment. It's obvious...
We brought our kids here with walkie talkies and they loved exploring with us. Very relaxing and historic.

Beautiful gardens tended by volunteers. Large ornamental lake witha heron currently in residence. Free lively jazz concerts on Sunday afternoons in the bandstand. And Uncommon Grounds is an excellent snack cafe with with ice cream to die foe - especially the Oxford blueberry and Cream. Be warned though, the helpings are huge! We spotted a black turtle walking through the...

This is one of the most beautiful parks you will ever visit. I have been around the world and although it is not as big as some, it is superb. There are lots of varieties of flowers and tress with water fountains and a band stand for concerts. In late August they have a lovely dahlia gardens.

This is one of the best botanical gardens in Canada. Beautifully laid out, everything is labeled. Many of the trees are large and well established. there is more here to see than you might think at first glance and you can easily spend an entire afternoon here not to mention getting a snack at the ice cream stand . Also...

Very well maintained public park in the middle of Halifax, with various types of trees. There was a dahlia exhibition when we were there. Considering the bitter winter Halifax had, the maintenance staff must have spent a lot of efforts to maintain all the plants and flowers in the park. Halifax should be proud of it.
it was very serene and a pretty public garden. went twice on two sunny days, and it was nice to stroll through and look at all the plantlife!

The center of Halifax has easily one of the gems of the Maritimes. These gardens are spectacular... well worth the time. It is a relaxing respite from any hustle or bustle. A g;rea;t collection of old growth trees and shrubs that are kept in great condition. The water features, ponds and the birds that inhabit the gardens make it perfect...

What a nice find! The gardens are free and open to all. This is a great place to wander and admire the plants, or to sit and relax in a nice setting. There are different areas focussing on different sorts of flowers (dahlias, etc), with lots of lawn and loads of hostas (and I love hostas). It is well placed...
Great for a quiet stroll through a lovely park. Very nicely kept and we saw some unusual birds along the way.
Gardens are marvelous. Flowers are so bright & enough trees to get a cool shade when you need it. The walk around is easy to do with plenty of benches to reast when needed.
These are well kept gardens with colourful flower beds (at least in summer!), a nice respite from the downtown Halifax pace. You can sit down on a bench and coexist with the easy going ducks.
Beautiful and free day activity in Halifax. I was lucky enough to visit during the height of their dahlia bed display, very nice park.
Dahlias in bloom this time of year, lovely place to walk , close to shopping, restaurants, and many hotels close by.

The Halifax Public Gardens are lovely and a truly serene place to spend a few minutes. If you are interested in flowers and shrubbery, they are the place for you. If you need a few quiet moments to reflect, they will provide the perfect ambiance. If not, they are nice to walk through and move on.

A lovely spot for a breath of fresh air and some sunshine. The Gardens are extremely well maintained and a joy to visit. The cafe offers coffee, ice cream, baked goods and other treats.You can visit the large duck pond with the model Titanic (but no iceberg).Also note that the main gates of the Gardens are actually a...
Gorgeous gardens . Relatively small compared to map, but peaceful water bodies and beautiful dalias. Interesting birds and nice walkways
Stopped here on tour with a local travel guide. We walked through the gardens. They are so beautiful!! The flowers are magnificent!! So glad we could see them in high summer!!

The Halifax Public Garden is on the southern tip of the Citedal hill. It is surrounded by metal fences and open during the day time (free entry).The garden was smaller than I thought (after reading all the reviews) but it was a perfect place to relax and enjoy nature's beauty in the middle of a city. The landscape was...
A must see if you're in Halifax. It is truly a point of pride for locals - and for good reason. Take an afternoon and walk through at a slow pace.
Wonderful place for an afternoon stroll. The gardens are very well maintained, and a real treat to walk around. They are also walking distance to the Citadel, so you can do both attractions together.
Absolutely stunning display of flowers and plants. Everything is manicured. A perfect spot to hang out and enjoy the scenery or just walk through and marvel at the flora.
Many colorful plants in beds that show design.A pond with wildlife. A teahouse to get some eats and sit ourside to enjoy the garden. A pleasant place to walk around. Would recommend.
BEAUTIFUL GARDENS. We visited on National Dalia Day. The volunteer greeted us warmly. Definitely a must see if you are visiting Halifax.

A lovely and extremely well maintained garden. Small but vey well thought our with different plantings in interesting areas with lots of different features, Gazebo, water, local plantings and lovely hanging baskets. You can see that it is well used by the locals for lunch and just enjoying the day with friends and a place to bring your lunch.. We...
Maybe was expecting too much, but I was a bit dissapointed by the gardens.But don't get me wrong, it is very pretty and still worth a visit.Good place for some quiet time
Very nice urban park, worth a walk. Very well maintained, beautiful flowers in the springs, trees and ponds. Nice area of town all around it.

Beautiful gardens. Quite big and diverse in plantings and style as one walks through. It is adjacent to The Lord Nelson Hotel which makes it convenient to their guests and a place to relax after a day of sightseeing

We visited the park about lunchtime and it was very pleasant to stroll through. A small lake with attractive borders and trees. We called in the café for a sandwich (about 1.00pm but they had sold out, which was a bit disappointing so early in the lunch time period. Worth a visit though.
Calm peaceful and beautiful, such a variety of plants from peonies to cacti! Unusual fountain, lots of benches to meditate or just spend quiet time in the city. And there is no charge for entry!
Loved the variety of dalias in the park. I didn't realize there were so many types.Enjoyed looking at ugly gooses and say watched miniature boats.

Just so lovely and peaceful, you can walk through the park to view the beautiful flowers. It is so serin, sometimes there can be a band playing around the side entrance. Just sit and enjoy the ducks and the quiet in the middle of Halifax wow!

One of my favourite places to bring a picnic lunch. Lots of benches to relax to watch the wildlife. The gardens are breath taking. If you visit Halifax you must take time to explore. There are plenty of vendors and shops close by for you to buy a snack. My favourite take out restaurant is Indochine it is right beside...
the grounds are very nice and its a good place place to relax and talk stroll through the paths have an ice cream or use the washroom if needed .
Came across this garden while sightseeing in downtown Halifax. Very well maintained with a huge variety of trees, flowers and features. Definitely one of the prettiest public gardens I've ever seen.

The garden is just amazing. Good to walk around and meditate with beautiful enviroment and good smell from the flower and the trees. Many benches in the park and diverse environment despite hot being so large. We where luck one day some musicians were playing very beautiful music and one couple began to dance in the sunlite

column3: New York City, New York, USA
column4: One of the prettiest public gardens I've visited. So well maintained by people who truly care. I saw a memeber of security staff picking up bits of dead leaves and anything else to make the garden appear more tidy. Easy to walk, and every feature absolutely charming. We went in the early morning so there were few people about. Made...

I've visited several gardens in my time and the Halifax Public Gardens is second to none. The design, variety of flora, and the level of maintenance and up-keeping is superb. This is a must visit for anyone visiting Halifax.

It's very nice and peaceful. We had coffee and we walked around the ponds. The flowers were beautiful. My mother is in a scooter had no accessibility problem, which is always nice. Having spent more time in Halifax, I think we could have me lounged hours with a book!

Lots and lots of beautiful flowers and plants in Bloom , nicely laid out in historic Halifax . Worth it to take the time and smell the roses... Literally. Parked on the opposite side of spring garden road and the gardens so we would have to walk through the gardens to get to the shopping area on Spring garden road.

This is a delightful place, not only for the spectacular gardens, but as a respite from the sun if you're here on a hot summer day. I'm not sure if any of the Anne of Green Gables books had a scene that took place here but this would be the perfect backdrop.

This hidden gem in the centre of the city allows kids of all sizes to run around, while mom and dad can pretend there are in a more serence place. My two little ones, aged 2 and 4 spent over 2 hours exploring the gardens. They were especially captivated with the miniature boats that float on the pond.

As halifax has differing weather it is hard to gauge when some trees, plants flowers are in bloom, you have to visit most weeks so as not miss anything if you love plant life. It is kept quite well and in the summer there are various musical acts on the bandstand to enjoy. We go many times in the year...
It was just beautiful so well kept! I took many pictures and the scent on the breeze was lovely. The dahlia display was especially well done.
On our way out we took some time to visit this lovely garden near our hotel and the citadel. The dahlias were in full, spectacular bloom. A very pleasant quiet space in the heart of a jewel city.
A beautiful oasis in the City of Halifax, if you are visiting it is definitely worth a walk through to enjoy the sights and sounds. Plan to visit the cafe and enjoy an ice cream!
One of the highlights of visiting Halifax is the Public Gardens. It's a great place for a relaxing walk.

The Public Gardens are a true delight! We wandered through the grounds, taking in the beautiful flowers, trees, and landscape. What a nice, green space to enjoy in the city. It was only after we'd had our lattes across the street when we realized there is a little coffee/tea restaurant right in the garden center.

What a great place to just kick back and relax and enjoy the beautiful flowers, trees, and peaceful environment. Great photo opportunities also. There is a building you can stop and purchase refreshments ie ice cream. Beautiful ponds, gazebos, and very friendly security people. You feel safe and right at home.

We seek out public gardens wherever we travel. This is an excellent Victorian garden with beautiful flower beds, huge rhododendrons, old trees, water features and great photo spots. If you are a gardener and appreciate dahlia collections - don't miss the hundred or so on display and carefully labeled. I would recommend and return again.
Beautiful place to walk and to enjoy quiet time.Fantastic composition of the flower beds, tasteful structures, pretty monuments.Great memories.
Nice sanctuary in the city! Great little walk around the beautiful gardens. Lots of variety, much more than your usual city park!
This garden is just beautiful. I went at sunset and really enjoyed strolling around. So many gorgeous flowers. Stunning photo opportunities and even a resident duck!

We enjoyed the gardens, especially the display of Dahlias which were in full flower while we were there. The gardens feel a little stilted and old fashioned, with all the flowers set in raised planting beds, sort of like objects on a shelf, but really we had a wonderful time. A nice break from wandering about in the summer heat....
Beautiful oasis in the middle of the city! Peaceful, beautiful flowers and trees and a gorgeous gazebo!
Beautiful gardens offer a serene break from the city bustle. Lots of different flora to admire, and places to relax. Love to visit whenever in Halifax.
I vote that it is the best public garden in a city centre in Canada. Well taken care of and you really do not feel like you are in the city.
A lot of green areas to walk around, even to practice yoga if it's a nice day, have a picnic or just to take some pictures with the beautiful view.

On our way out of town, we drove around the fort to see the view but then dove down the hill to check out the public gardens. Were we ever in for a big surprise! It was obvious that the groundskeepers loved this small jewel of a flower paradise. Each grouping of flowers was carefully designed to allow each flower...
This garden was reminiscent of gardens we saw in England. It was a lively green space in the midst of Halifax.

This is a small garden. You can walk it in 30 minutes. A few statues, two ducks and some flowers. There is a dahlia show there now which is spectacular. Not a lot of seating for resting. I am not sure I would go out of my way to see it. And as others have said, why can't they label...

The Public Gardens in Halifax is a very old and well established park in the middle of downtown Halifax.When you enter the gates you are transformed into peace and tranquility. There are lovely themed gardens that you can admire as you stroll this beautiful park
Very nice park, quiet and with a lot to see from animals, birds and different plants or a concert in the park with life music.
We spent a pleasant half hour strolling through these well-designed and maintained gardens in perfect summer weather. Worth a respite from the waterside sun a few blocks away.

We loved this garden...plus, it was free! We've visited other gardens that have set us back $15-25 a piece. This place was lovely! It was pouring rain when we were there, but that didn't deter us. We just dug our umbrella out of the car and had a romantic stroll. In fact, our photos look just as lovely as those...
It is an historical botanical gardens. Peaceful and serene. A must visit for a sunny day, on most Sundays @ 2:00 p.m. There. Is usually a concert in the bandshell..one of my very places in our City.
We parked at the Citadel and stopped here before heading too the Citadel. It is a beautiful urban retreat. very peaceful and serene. We visited in August and the flowers were very pretty.
Lovely place to visit in the centre of Halifax, the tour guide was very knowledgeable about the flora, trees, and the history of Griffins Pond in these gardens.
Beautiful garden. Very peaceful and well appointed. This is a graet way to just relax and enjoy a quiet moment.

We were here in July, so the gardens were probably at their best. I do not understand the whingers giving it one or two stars. No; you cannot walk on most of the grass. No; it is not dog friendly which suits me right down to the ground. There are other restrictions none of which concerned us in the least....

Gazebos, cottages, quaint bridges spanning little ponds, flowers, centuries-old trees, wildlife and more. My camera couldn't stop clicking, the vistas are amazing! No dogs are allowed, and although I feel sorry that dog owners miss out on walking their pets through here, the well-tended, neat grounds are worth the sacrifice. We walked through here early on a very warm Monday...

THe Halifax Public Garden is oneof the most beautiful places you can visit while in Halifax. The gardens spread over afew squareblocksbut you dont even notice the size while walking around. A lot of high school aged kids were taking prom pictures while we were there which it was the perfect setting to do so. I would consider this a...
A beautiful spot to visit and right by the Citadell. Lots of flowers in bloom on our visit. The Dahlias were gorgeous. You don't need more than an hour to see all of the gardens.
Beautiful, well maintained park in the heart of the city. Not dog friendly but that is understandable.

The Gardens are a must see in Halifax. My daughters and I decided to take a stroll through the park which was so relaxing. The Gardens are very well maintained and it's so peaceful walking through. There is a coffee shop which we stopped at for ice cream...please do try the Grape nut flavor...so delicious. There is also some information...

When my adult daughter suggested we walk through the Public Garden I was reluctant as I expected a grassy area with a few trees similar to some in Toronto. It was a lovely oasis of flowers, trees and shrubs and a pleasant way to get a bit of exercise as we're road tripping from Ontario.
Visited in a hot day. Lots of shade and paths for the kids. Beautifully done. Spacious. Safe and clean. Kids loved the ducks. Lots of places for picnics

Went to university in the late seventies in Halifax and was never . On this visit we walked up Spring Garden Road and strolled into the gardens. What a peaceful and well tended place. It is a must to see when in Halifax. I thought much nicer than Stephen's Green in Dublin.

This garden/park is located just two blocks from the Citadel and well worth an hour visit. Leisurely walk through and enjoy the beautiful colors and all of the green trees. The day we were there it was being enjoyed by many.

The "wow factor" here is 5 out of 5. These gardens are spectacular. There are multiple sections and each section designed extremely well. There is also a pond with couple of replica ships (Titanic and a Canadian Navy frigate) floatingThe gardens are free to visit. They are just across Citadel and about 10 mins walking distance from the waterfront....

My father is an amateur botanist, so when on a family trip to Halifax, I knew we had to swing by the Public Gardens for a visit. The gardens are meticulously maintained and are beautiful! The garden had several thriving American Chestnut trees (which have almost been completely wiped out in the United States due to chestnut blight); seeing a...
Beautiful Quiet Spot in the middle of Halifax. Victorian gardens with a band stand and duck pond in the middle. Free band concerts at 2pm most Sundays in the summer. Great ice cream bar.

Although small these gardens are beautiful. They offer a lovely venue for a stroll, a quiet read, or investigating the plant life. It is unfortunate that not all of the plants are identified to further educate visitors.

We spent two different afternoons here. What a beauty in the heart of the city! The second time we were there, we took books and sat and read for a couple of hours, watching people go by. Just a delightful garden. There are washrooms and a little restaurant too, and the Spring Garden shops are right next door.

The 'Gardens' is a Victorian Garden with meandering pathways.A wonderful, peaceful place in the heart of downtown Halifax. This National Historic Site has a vast variety of trees and flowers but also shows off a collection of garden artefacts. Some of these include statues, a bandstand and fountains, which are representative of the Victorian era. A lot of the are...
the garden was very zen quiet not too busy..but it makes for a very pretty walk in the park..with beautiful flower and plant array..well keep super clean..
Have visited here many times. The gardens. Are spectacular. Old tree and rhoedehehrums are spectacular. Definitely. A place to see.
Very old and beautiful Victorian garden in the heart of Halifax. The park is loved by all the residents and we found it to be simply lovely.
this is a victorian garden because of the serpentine flower beds. there is even a cactus area that has to be pulled up every fall and put in the green house because of the winter weather.
Beautiful park.Excellent spot to relax, enjoy nature and have a wonderful walk.Perfect for everybody!
We scheduled a tour and it was delightful. The guide and grounds are well worth a visit. We were there in August, just before the dahlia exhibit. The fellow tourists were friendly as well.
If your in the area, this is a great place to walk around, get some fresh air, relax and enjoy ! Large variety of plants and flowers to admire. Look for large schools of gold fish in ponds.
A quiet tranquil spot in the heart of the city lovely paths which are great for strollers. So peaceful and quiet.

The Halifax Public Gardens is a treasure. Many old plantings, a Victorian type garden that is well maintained and valued and a lovely oasis in the middle of the city.This is really a spot to visit - note all the tour buses that drop off visitors at one side and pick up on the other. The Horticultural Hall is...

An amazing piece of greenery in the city. Plenty of flowers, trees and benches for a relaxing lunch or a quiet evening walk. Play chess at the permanent tables or watch a concert in the park. Not the most exciting place in the city, but probably the most attractive.

This Victorian Garden in the heart of Halifax is a gem. Beautiful, peaceful with lots of walking paths and well-tended flower beds. Add to that a duck pond, a bandstand and an ice cream stand, you have the ingredients for a perfectly relaxing experience which will be further enhanced if you happen to be there when a concert is scheduled....

Surprisingly beautiful oasis in downtown Halifax. Only one square block in size, but a great place to relax while in downtown. Grounds are curated beautifully.Across from Lord Nelson hotel and waking distance from the waterfront and Citadel areas.

Entered the gardens on a drizzly day and had the place mostly to ourselves. It is nice the way they put signs on some of the plantings to help identify them. I was surprised at the tropical plants and cactus that were growing. The water areas are nicely done and have that calming affect even though traffic is all around...
Spend a relaxing afternoon or evening at these beautiful gardens. There is no charge and the flowers are in bloom from earlt spring to late fall.

Growing up outside of Halifax, I have frequented Public Gardens since I was a young child. Now that I live in Edmonton, I make sure to visit with my two kids when home in the summer. Great for an afternoon stroll while you take in the beautiful historic gardens. The kids love the ducks and the birds and sitting out...

Loved everything about rhe gardens that we saw. Unfortunately we're only there for about 20mins though as the close he gates 30mins before sunset which we failed to notice when we walked in. Nonetheless, beautiful place to be in the middle of a city filled with rich heritage and culture.

The Halifax Public Gardens is the oldest Victorian Garden in North America. Situated in the centre of Halifax City's pretty Sound End, it has remained an important and integral part of our British heritage. Scene after scene of amazing formal flower beds are artfully arranged on sprawling lawns and curving gravel walks. It's complimented with ponds, architectural elements like Victorian...
A gem in the city. Very well manicured gardens with lots of park benches to sit and enjoy th scenery. Lots of historical plantings and dedications.

I had no idea about this place. The peace and tranquility are from another age. I never expected such a fine public space in a city so small. Extremely well-managed and civilised. Ice-creams are great value.
Beautiful, old-fashioned garden, perfect for wandering or just sitting. Plenty of benches scattered around and seating in front of the gazebo.
A must visit, sit and take in the stress relieving scenery! Stop and smell the roses! Nice walk from downtown.

We took a leisurely stroll through the garden. It was pretty. We lucked out, in that there was a band playing on the bandstand, so we had ice cream and sat on the grass and enjoyed the sunshine and the free music. What a great public park!

We come frequently when we visit Halifax. It is always great for strolling or sitting and relaxing. It is a great oasis in the city with wonderful, well tended flowers and trees. I love the new edible garden.

What a beautiful setting in the downtown area of Halifax and a wonderful way to relax in this magnificent city. A short walk to all the fabulous restaurants and hotels, the Metro Arena and the beautiful boardwalk and shops. Fabulous park, a must to see while in Halifax

We visited the gardens on our first afternoon in Halifax and found it an excellent way to relax after a long drive. The gardens would not be out off place in an Jane Austen novel. There was at least one wedding party there when we passed thorough.
Beautiful place for a quiet stroll. The plants and the flowers are just beautiful. The gardens are within easy walking distance to restaurants & shopping.

One of the best public parks I have seen. We like tourist stuff but we stopped there to have a look. so much beauty and splendor- way to go city of Halifax- we loved your public park.. Best park ever.
A real delight, and free, and don't miss the vast sumptuous ice creams. Look out for the flower sundials and the lovely lakes and birds.
Beautiful gardens in the heart of the city. Nice place to walk, reflect and find some solitude. Beautiful fountains and interesting things to see. Great spot to take photos.
Really enjoyed our visit to the gardens. The weather was great, the gardens are very well kept and breathtaking. Colors are amazing!
Went here 15 years ago on our first date. Now my wife and I go here every year to get away from the feeling of the city while still beeing downtown.
A must see. You walk through these gates that were bought over from Europe and find yourself in this magical garden of fountains, gazebos, a plush gardens. Really worth the visit.
A must in halifax. Glorious well manicured gardens with plenty of seating for relaxing. There is also a nice ice cream shop in the gardens. Another plus on a warm day. Great for families.

These are a brilliant example of fantastic municipal gardens. They are a nice size and have lots of variety and plenty of places to sit. It's a perfect place to while away some time and relax when in Halifax.
It was a beautiful summer day and the gardens were so nice. We had lunch at the restaurant in the park and listened to the bands playing there.

Just a few blocks up from the waterfront near the Citadel you can enter though the beautiful iron gates into the beautiful garden. Many flowers blooming, fountains, a pond, gazebo and even a gift shop with refreshments! Perfect place to enjoy an hour or two.

This was my first time to Halifax. The Public Gardens were a ten minute walk away from my hotel so we set out to have a look. We thoroughly enjoyed walking through the 17 acre gated gardens full of beautiful horticulture. We happened to be visiting on a Sunday afternoon and there was live music in the the middle of...
A large public garden with walkways through out the gardens. Large dahlia display and a nice gazebo.
Beautiful, very well kept, great for an afternoon stroll. Lots of trees dedicated to interesting people/causes. But don't feed the ducks!

This is a nice place to go and get a little something from the Cafe on the site and to get away from the crowds of people. I really like to browse the Arts and Crafts people on the outside of the Gardens.
Flowers were in bloom after a week of rain everything was green and lush. Wonderful place to ring a coffee or even a picnic lunch.
The public gardens are a beautiful, peaceful place in the middle of Halifax. The design of the flower beds is lovely.
I wish we had a public garden like this back home. I would spend every free moment there....walking, reading, listening to the sounds. Just wonderful.
We had a perfect day in August, with temps in low 80's. All was in bloom and found it very peaceful with friendly conversations if you wanted.
A beautiful and very lovingly garden to stroll through. The flowers are amazing and they even have a little pond in the middle...

This Garden in the centre of the city is 17 acres of beautiful floral displays.Numerous variety of trees ,a band stand,an a number of fountains,along with a large pond with a number of malard ducks,a must see on your visit to our great city.
Lovely garden to wander and feel like you are not in the hustle bustle of the city. Go when there is music playing if you can. Quiet, peaceful park in the heart of Halifax.

We choose to come to Halifax on a whim and really hadn't done any research. The public gardens were recommended by a few sites including TA. What a great place. This is a perfect Victorian garden. Very many flowers were in bloom. The landscaping is immaculate and true to the form.
We were passing by and decided to take a stroll thru the gardens. If you are a garden lover, it's worth a walk.

We stopped in the garden while on a bike tour of downtown Halifax, and then returned later that evening with my father-in-law to share the experience. An ice-cream and a walk in the gardens made for a lovely time. Found it quite interesting to see tropical plants i.e Papaya, coffee, avocado. More identification of the plants in the garden would...

We walked from our hotel to the Public Garden up the hill. It is a beautiful garden. A lot of variety and we took so many pics of the flowers that were in bloom. There were many places to sit and reflect. We spent a couple hours at the garden and would recommend it to anyone going to Halifax. It...

My husband and I loved the Halifax Public Gardens and visited twice on a recent trip to Halifax. Gardens are beautiful and well-maintained. And they are a lovely break from the city. Highly recommend.

Didn't spend as much time in the gardens as we should have! It is beautiful and has a lot of activities scheduled for tourists! A nice respite from the wharf and in a great location. Take a picnic and enjoy!

We had a some relatives in town for a few days so it was a must to visit the gardens. It is a beautiful spot to go for walk and is meticulously maintained. Coffee and ice cream is available from small cafe in the park.
Wonderful gardens, 16 acres of beauty with ponds and walkways. Every turn was amazing. Many of the trees and plants were identified. Only wish there was more identification.
We had lunch in the gardens after spending the morning at the harbour. There were plenty of benches to sit on and it was a quiet, shady place to eat.
Lovely Public Gardens with many different display beds and a "good enough" snack/lunch venue. Compact but worth a walk through.
Nothing exciting about it. Just a nice garden to walk through in the middle of the city. I have been to every garden in every city and it's a little disappointing.

Beautiful gardens in the heart of the city, and walking distance from harbour front! Was there early in July and gardens were not as yet at their peak. Lovely gazebo and also a nice tea room although I was not inside for tea! Lots of roses and nice paths for walking.
Beautiful place to enjoy a walk, or to sit and read,feed the ducks or just people watch. I love it here!

A walk through the Public Gardens was the perfect way to wind down after my epic weekend in Halifax!I was told it was a late Spring this year and that normally the gardens had blossomed a little more by the 2nd week of May, but that certainly didn't detract from a great experience. Although fairly small, it was beautiful...
Beautiful city gardens, were well kept by a large group of gardeners. Great place for a relaxing lunch break.
Beautiful! Quiet, peaceful space in a city. Bring a book, sip some coffee and enjoy. This is a well groomed park

This is an absolutely beautiful garden/park, extremely well maintained. I couldn't help but thinking to myself that there are many much larger cities that I've visited that have nothing compared to this. The fact that it is free is an absolute bonus (if they charged a couple bucks to visit it would still be worth it). Beautiful flowers, pond, lots...
