A well maintained, beautiful garden to enjoy. Walk slowly, relax on a park bench and admire the natural beauty.
Great place to take a stroll. Very well maintained. Worth a visit, or two. It is one of many public parks but probably by far the best.
Really didnt realize how beautiful the Gardens are when I lived there. They now have great family areas too. Havnt beem there in over 6 years.
This was a nice little oasis in the middle of the city. Very well maintained and historical. It is a nice walk in beautiful surroundings!!
What lovely place to unwind with the flowers, ponds, trees it is truly wonderful place to spend time in you will not be disappointed.
Situated downtown, this is a beautiful well kept garden. A nice place for a romantic stroll. Halifax is lucky to have such a gem, and it's visitors are free to experience this oasis in the city.
Nice walk, a bit crowded on sumday. Well kept to a point. Worth the walk. Wedding photographers blocking a bit of the venue,
Beautifully laid out. Visited on a walking tour and was given lots of historical information. Not open all year around I believe.
A great stop in the midst of city walking. Great flower, trees and ambiance. Wished I had even more time to spend enjoying it. Highly suggested.
people are so friendly, Vancouver BC should take note, just ask for great places to eat or walk to the waterfront, its beautiful

When we went in this park, flowers were beautiful, every Colors, and a ballroom orchestra was playing nice old songs. Many people were sitting all over the park listening to them. It is à very nice souvenir.
If plants and trees are your thing then come here. This place is well thought out and cared for. Splendid variety of botany and very informative. It is just plain beautiful.
Lovely paths through a beautiful Victorian style garden. There are themed garden beds and displays. Everything is meticulously maintained. A charming respite from touring museums or shopping.

This 16 acre park in the center of Halifax is a fine example of a Victorian garden with ponds, beautiful flower beds and trees. Ample benches and paths make this a terrific oasis in the middle of the city.

Right across from the Lord Nelson hotel in Halifax, this botanical garden is one of most pleasant places to walk through, and enjoy dozens of beautiful plants and flowers. The Rose Garden was an especial treat, in full bloom in July. And the little lake takes you to a part of Canada that doesn't seem to be in the middle...

WE have been here many times and always make a point of visiting here at least once during the summer. Beautiful, well kept, lawns, trees and wonderful flowers creating a peaceful respite in todays busy lifestyles. Spent our 40th Anniversary here a couple of years ago. Wonderful place to take pictures and also met some very nice people from different...
The beauty and the charm of this place is that it's located in the middle of the city but yet it's so quiet and calm.
One of the most beautiful and serene botanical gardens.The lake is a lovely place to rest by.Stroll the many walk ways and feast your eyes on the magnificent species of floweres.
We visited Halifax Public Gardens after being at the Citadelle. We were taken by the beauty of the grounds. Its a must see!

very beautiful flowers and bushes in the enclosed fenced in park. very quiet also. nice walking trail to look at everything and park benches to stop and rest and see the pideons and other small birds there

Great place for everyone! Everything was blooming and the temperature was only about 80 degrees. There were people working on the grounds, but they never made a mess or made you feel you were in their way. Under a big shade tree in the middle of the park there was a lady reading story books for the little ones. A...

The gardens are a pleasant 10 minute stroll from the Four Points hotel on Hollis Street through a lively shopping and eating area of the town. These are typical municipal gardens with carpet bedding and roses, well maintained but not to be confused with botanical gardens: they offer enjoyable surroundings but are nothing special if you have a particular interest...
Beautiful manicured and appointed 18 acre park near the Citadel. Local horticulture and water features are prominent.
beautiful flowers and shrubbery. nice quiet place to unwind.Parking is a little difficult and you may have to walk a little way. but it is well worth the effort
A little spot to stroll relax and enjoy some peace and quiet. Bring a book, turn off the phone and have some personal time.
The public gardens is worth a stroll! It is a great place to take a lunch or to just escape the traffic.
The whole place was very beautiful, though sadly the fountains were off when we arrived. Lovely for strolling.
This garden is beautifully situated near the Citadel and was lovely for a morning walk before the tattoo parade on Canada day.

About a 15-20 minute walk (uphill) from the waterfront, but well worth it. Beautiful and well maintained gardens. You will forget you're in a city as you stroll through the grounds. Public restrooms were clean. We really enjoyed our time here.
Beautiful garden and so well maintained. Peaceful oasis during a busy trip. Lots of photo opportunities amidst lovely flowers/shrubs. Well worth a stop.
Beautiful spot! Lovely gardens and a beautiful gazebo. Lots of people wandering about at lunchtime. A little tough to find parking though.

These are the most beautiful gardens I've ever seen! It's on 18 acres in the middle of the city, and they are extremely well-maintained. There is a cute coffee shop/ice cream shop there as well, and it was delightful also! Apparently the gardens are closed in winter, so go when you can!

This little park is a real gem. Big enough to walk in but small enough to tuck away in an easy to reach spot in Halifax. Beautiful trees, flowers and statuary. Everything is well maintained and planned. There are public restrooms and lots of benches for relaxing and daydreaming. Don't miss Sugah's excellent ice cream and coffee. My favorite is...
Very well-kept park in central Halifax. Spent a couple of hours there with peace and quiet. Liked the cafe and the small pond with the birds.

Beautiful, peaceful and historical. The Public Gardens is a great place to stop and refresh yourself whether you are on holiday in the city or living here. If you are a visitor, it is really worth your while to come through the gates and take in the beauty around you.
I work very close to the Public Gardens and it never fails to bring me pleasure. Beautiful Victoian-era gardens, ponds, meandering paths, and tons of people to watch enjoying them too.
Great walk through central Halifax, make a point to stop in for a while. Absolutely beautiful place to stop in and appreciate the natural beauty.
The gardens are very beautiful and very well maintained,and well worth your time,and FREE.Also if driving you can just park at a meter for about $1 .00 and walk right in.
A walk through the Public Gardens is a great way to spend the afternoon - it is a bit a quiet in the middle of the city.
Gorgeous, historic garden. Even after so many years, it retains its character! Worth a visit - just sit on the benches and soak up the tranquility in the middle of Halifax!
Gardens are nicely laid out and a pleasant retreat from the cityscape. Flowers are pretty but not overwhelmingly so, perhaps a result of the extremely harsh winter of 2014-15.
Lovely garden for a morning walk, beautiful flowers, just wish we had seen some music in the gazebo.

A visit to the Public Gardens in Halifax is a good spot to go to take a breather when visiting Halifax. Buy a snack or a drink and go here to sit and recharge. There are washrooms, shade and seating in a relatively quiet atmosphere.

This is s gem in the city. From the beautiful entrance comprising two huge wrought iron doors, the gardens occupy a number of acres and include fountains, a grand gazebo, geese, ducks, and amazing garden and tree scapes of all sizes and shapes. Take your time walking through these as there is a lot to see. While we didn't have...
Large (18 acre) cultivated gardens and numerous trails. In the centre is a large bandstand and seating area that doesn't intrude into the plan of the garden.

This was such a beautiful place. The park is being preserved so you can only walk in there, not run/bike/skateboard which made it much more enjoyable. It was right downtown so it was easy to access for a morning stroll
Spent the day before major surgery wondering these gardens. Beautiful day and I found the peace I needed to face the next day. I will be back later to see the seasons change

First off, if you can book across the street at the Lord Nelson which is a world class hotel with great rooms, restaurant, breakfast offerings and for the late night crowd a relaxing spot to enjoy a night cap. The Public Gardens are beautifully maintained including a tribute to the Boar War, a centrally located coffee/dessert restaurants, many, many places...
Great place to visit - it was June during our visit and everything was blooming. There was a band playing and folks were up dancing. Nice to see families taking advantage of this beautiful place.
peaceful,lush gardens. Plenty of places to sit and enjoy the gardens. Great opportunity to learn about new flowers. Staff very helpful and was ready to help at any time
Not too big but pleasant to walk through. Colourful flowers and plants. Some sculpture benches to sit

Since we were on Spring Garden Road checking out the new library we ventured to Public Gardens as well. They were bustling today with people enjoying the flowers, the sunshine, the Jazz Fest and just an overall beautiful day to be in a park. This park has beautiful vegetation, ponds, ducks, large trees, nice walking parks and great areas to...

We went to the gardens on a beautiful summer afternoon. The gardens are typical English Gardens with lots of statues etc. The gardens are obviously lovingly cared for. This was our first visit but you can be sure we'll be back.There were lots and lots of benches to sit and rest or just enjoy the scenery. The bathrooms are...
THe gardens are gorgeous. Lovely paths to stroll. An area for music and performances. THey had a free concert on Canda Day. It is a great place for a picnic and relaxing.

Beautiful gardens and atmosphere. A must to see when in Halifax. Beautiful flora and fauna as well as lovely laid out pathways. There was a beautiful classical music grouping playing when we visited on Sunday July 5th. Plenty of ducks to feed as well. Such a peaceful spot inside the city of Halifax

This is a perfect little break from doing the super touristy things down by the waterfront. This is one of the few Victorian gardens in North America. It's beautifully landscaped and you can get some ice cream at one of the entrances on a warm summer day.

What a lovely place to walk when you have some time throughout the day. Either you want to share your time chatting away with someone with some nice things to look at, or a lovely place to sit for solo contemplation.
Spring was a little behind here from home so many spring plants were still in bloom. Great variety of flower and trees wonderfully designed and maintained . A great place to wander or just relax.
When I was at the gardens, things were just beginning to get going, so it seemed a little sparse. Lots of seating, pretty paths and water features. Worth a visit.

Well laid out gardens, with curving paths, a small bridge, lots of tall trees and therefore shade. Flowers planted in large "S" shapes. Perfect place to rest on a bench or bring a book to read. Very quiet despite being in a city and well maintained. Cut through from one main street to heading to downtown area. Must go!

Great place to stroll through as you walk around town. Floral displays were beautiful and they had a snack bar and public restrooms as well. This isn't a huge park and probably not worth a special trip, but if you're walking by I would definitely stop in.
What beauty and splendor in the middle of Halifax. Very well kept and laid out. Loved the geese. Beautiful venue for an evening of music.

People usually take advantage of their city. This is one hidden gem. Yes of course many people visit but it is one area where you can disappear and just enjoy the beauty of nature. The hard work of Garden Crew is understated and under appreciated. If you see a Public Garden worker, say thank you. Take your time. Take a...

This site is an enclosed area where you can enjoy the scenery and much reduced noise of the city all around it. There are several well maintained paths which you can follow throughout the gardens several areas.

A nicely groomed Victorian garden in the heart of Halifax. Entrance and pathways are wheelchair accessible. Lots of flowers, foliage and shade trees. Conveniently placed benches scattered throughout. There is a duck pond but feeding the ducks is a nono. A very nice place for photos.
These gardens are a lovely stroll in the heart of the city. Never too busy and the peacefulness surrounds. Grab a book and relax on one of the many benches or enjoy an ice cream from the onsite cafe.
This garden is a beautiful and peaceful place for a sunny summer day walk and chill out .Just walk around and enjoy a picnic and the relaxed atmosphere !
We had the most pleasant day strolling through these gardens. They offer solitude, beauty, wonderful smells of flowers, trees and water and are impeccably maintained.
This park is very relaxing, you can relax and people watch or you can walk the paths and see the beautiful flowers and pond.

We loved our walk through this central garden. Beautiful flowers, wonderful architectural detail, interesting sculpture, this is a beautiful place to take a stroll well located in the heart of Halifax.
A great way to spend a cool, sunny summer day in Halifax. My regret was I did not have a best friend gardener to share the experience with.
Very calm.Less crowded.Scenic.Loved watching the geese n ducks. If you love scenic photography, try this place.

If you didn't know it was there it would be easy to drive right by the Gardens - so don't miss it. Within easy walking distance from the Citadel, you can wander through the beautifully maintained botanical gardens which features a myriad of flowers and plants. Take a break and seat yourself near the gazebo, enjoy the landscaping and do...

This is not a large public garden. If you have been to a botanical garden in a large city, you will be disappointed in this one. We went in the middle of June but still there was not much growing in the garden. Entrance was free. Parking on the street was reasonable. There was a band playing in the garden....
This Victorian garden is beautiful. It is excellently maintained. A wonderful place for a quiet walk surrounded by nature.
Beautiful garden to walk around or eat a picnic lunch in. The people watching is awesome at the coffee shop within in the garden or on a bench.
It's a neat place to walk through, for bird watching, and for looking at very large trees. It's not amazing, yet it would be a nice place to walk through if you are in the area.
well laid out, wish I could have stayed longer than 15 minutes though! Lots of great photo opportunities, well maintained. :)

Really enjoyed walking around the gardens, which are small but very beautiful for a public garden. Its obvious great care is taken to keep the place up. If you are tired of seeing the city, this is a nice break but will take about 30 minutes max to walk around the entire garden.
Simple layout but quiet and pleasant with lots of spring flowers. Spoke to garden staff who were very helpful .Very pleasant walk in a busy city
It's a well-laided out public garden with numerous walkways, niches, and wild birds. They have many different flowers and trees. It's definitely worth a stroll through and even a picnic.

Stopped by here to take a walk when we first visited the downtown Halifax area. Simply beautiful place to visit during your day. best place in halifax for picture .the grounds are beautiful. flowers and trees are in full bloom .very well taken care of

Stop by to go for a stroll, and relax. All the flowers are nice and beautiful, i saw elderly people going for walks, people reading books, and families having fun. Stop by here.

An well maintained gazebo is centrally located which regularly hosts live music. A very quaint cafe and ice-cream parlour is located inside another original Victorian house, just...
Beautifully manicured grounds and gardens. Nice place to wander about, sit and have a coffee or just read a book.

We loved the nice strolling paths the huge big trees and pretty stream running through the park. The huge ducks of a species i have not seen before and the ponds and pretty gazebo. The entrance is so lovely with its wrought iron gates.
Colourful (in the main), peaceful and easy to visit. Some wonder trees and flowers in pots and baskets.
A little oasis of calm. Even if you are not a gardener you can still appreciate the colours and planting. Great place to wander around or just chill. Not very big but very refreshing.

The Halifax gardens are really beautiful - it's like strolling through someone's private garden, full of informal plantings and you can tell it's cared for with love. Bandstand with concerts in the summer and a little teahouse as well.
beautifully laid out with a variety of different areas and some magnificent plants & trees. Bandstand with regular concerts and other music. A tranquil place in a vibrant city
Great tourist location in the centre of Halifax City. Beautiful gardens and relaxing atmosphere, where you can relax and enjoy the beautiful flowers and well kept lawns.

Wonderful place to walk and see the flowers. We saw many varieties we had never seen before. Lots of places to sit and relax. There are many paths and entrances. Great for a quiet time from all the sighteseeing.

We went by the Public gardens as a side trip the day we went to the Citadel. We walked from the Citadel. I was very impressed with the beauty of the lovely manicured garden. It was full of people enjoying all the walkways, flowers and lawns. We stopped to have some ice cream at a small store on the grounds....

These gardens are wonderful to walk round. Victorian style, well taken care of with many nice features, plants, flowers, statues, trees and ponds. There is a family area and ice cream shop. Well worth a visit and easy to work into your schedule. Perfect for an afternoon stroll to admire the Titanic floating in one of the ponds.
Beautifully landscaped gardens with excellent floral displays. Lovely place to walk around and sit for a while.

Well worth a visit. Very well designed and peaceful. Nice small cafe with outdoor seating to enjoy the coffee and the view. Spent the last few hours of my visit here writing my memories of my vacation. Most relaxing.

The ducks, geese, birds, flora, trees, people all harmony.in the middle of a busy work day you stroll through the gardens and ponds and forgey where you are.beautiful and tranquil.a must for everyone.
The garden is indeed a Victorian garden, nice place to relax and enjoy the weather, turn out to be the Dahlia day and we saw a great number of flowers, simply priceless
The gardens were beautiful, relaxing and peacefull. In the center was a wonderful dahlia display that many people were enjoying

Who knew there could be so many varieties of dahlias. Who knew that the kids would love discovering the flowers, and the geese of course. It's free, it's beautiful and relaxing. Go visit and see for yourself.
Colourful, quiet and peaceful. It is impossible to be rushed when you are looking around here. You forget about the traffic around the gardens when you are walking around.
If you are in Halifax, this is a nice short stop. Not a huge park but quite and very pretty. Right in the heart of the city.

The first time I ever seen this unbelieve gardens, I was amazed. There were so many areas to walk, or just sit and relax. There were ducks in the ponds, and bird singing lovely song was you strolled around. I must say if you are in the Halifax area, this is a most to be seen.

These gardens are so beautiful to sit and relax in. Take a lunch or read a book in this lovely downtown park. The trees are gorgeous. If the band is playing this makes you feel your are stepping back in time. Great place to rest your feet in between shopping on Spring Garden Road. Plus what better place to treat...

The tourist office provided me with a map with a suggested route drawn in blue which covered most of the attractions along the harbour front and surroundings. After a bit of a climb up to the Citadel it was a relief to find the Public Gardens and sit in the shade at the side of a very ornate fountain. The...
The public gardens are so colourful with the flowers and tree blossoms. The wild life and the kids playing in the pulled loving every minute .

The garden is beautiful and a perfect setting if you want pictures. You can see that even the locals are there to relax. The flowers are beautiful! They had dahlias featured, I've never seen anything like them. Go visit,you'll enjoy it.

Beautifully kept gardens that have been kept in the same manner they were founded in Victorian times. It is a great place to relax while taking a break from the office, a busy day shopping on Spring Garden Road or to explore the many varied trees and flowers. You may also be lucky enough to enjoy an afternoon of music...
Nice place to visit while in Halifax. Relaxing! My daughter enjoyed taking pictures there with her friend.

These gardens are beautifully we strolled through them it was so peaceful just to walk and see all the different plants and watch families strolling or playing with their children just gave me a little lift to my heart a must see place

This is a very colorful display of flower beds that are very,very well done with agreat balance of colors. You must allow at the very least 30-45 minutes to enjoyeach piece of hand planted art. What a beautiful back drop for taking pictures.After the stroll through the Gardens , you may sit and have an ice cream...
Public Gardens are beautiful. They are well kept with beautiful flowers, band stand, canteen, solar bathrooms. Beautiful day helped also.

a great place to stroll. beautiful gardens. stop for an ice cream then rest on a bench to people watch or read a book. The gardens come alive on "prom nights" if you are lucky enough to be there in June.
We happened to visit in August and there were many plants in bloom. The garden is well kept and it was just beautiful.
Well manicured grounds. Nice quiet place to relax outside with a cup of coffee among the flowers and trees.
Great spot to sit alone, with friends, have a coffee or have ice cream.The gardens are beautiful!!!!

A lovely large downtown garden area for all ages. Many species of plants are organized in a thoughtful design, Ducks, and wildlife inhabit some parts of the garden. The paths are accessible for those in wheelchairs. A delightful ice cream and tea shop for many to enjoy on a beautiful day.
This is one place that is a must to visit when in Halifax. The flowers and arrangements are something to behold.

The gardens are just beautiful and relaxing in spring and summer...a must see when in halifax. Relax on benches enjoying be beautiful gardens, watch the birds, read, people watch ...all at the Gardens
Great venue- exotic trees and shrubs - often good music on weekend - easy access - what more can you ask

Walked the whole park and found great ideas for my own garden.Great spot to mellow out as well.Watched how the gardeners edged the flower beds.The swans & ducks are wonderful to watch.People stroll through with baby strollers etc. Kids really like watching the ducks and swans.Some in wheelchairs, others just walking or sitting enjoying the...

The gardens were kept beautifully and the different varieties of plants was amazing. There is an ornate bandshell in the gardens that features musical entertainment and the bandshell itself is absolutely gorgeous!

The park was just infront of our hotel so we took a stroll in there on a sunday and they had a live band playing at the pavillon. We also bought ice cream in there and it was good. The flowers are beautyful and you can have a nice and quit time in the park.

This area was on our list of things to do! The gardens were restored after a terrible hurricane came by and ruined most of the gardens. It is refurbished now and is a pretty park to walk through if you are passing by. There is also an area for families to play with their children and just have your children...

I was in Halifax for business and had a free afternoon, so I took advantage of the nice summer weather and brought a book to read in the Public Gardens. I spent a little over an hour there and loved every minute of it, so very beautiful and well kept. Someone was working on the flowers while I was there...

What's not to like about a park full of trees, beautiful flowers, a pond with ducks and geese, an elaborate bandstand, and walking paths. Halifax Public Gardens covers an entire large block of the city.

Enjoyed walking in this free park. I was pleased there was no garbage lying around the grounds as plenty of garbage cans and were used by the people. The only part I did not like as you had to pay street parking to go in park.
At end of August, the gardens were in beautiful bloom. Bandstand and victorian fountains made this park unusual. Not huge, but interesting. Good cafe.
We spent about an hour here. Nice gardens, but if you are not into flowers...!? We went from here to a cemetery!?!?
I love flowers but hate to touch the dirt. Very good variety of flowers, very relaxed atmosphere, but became a bit cold for me. Would definitely visit again.

This park - garden, really - is a treasure for Halifax and a stroll through this remarkable Victorian artifact is essential for any visitor. When I lived in Halifax I was fortunate to walk through the Public Gardens on an almost daily basis.

The flower beds are spectacular. There was a Dahlia exhibition during our visit, which was very impressive indeed, but even apart from that the flower beds were lovely. I assume the time we went (late summer) is the best time to visit.There is a nice tea house serving simple food if you want to make a picnic of it.
Good for a summer stroll. We visited a bit late in the season, but many of the flowers were still in bloom. Some crazy fountains and a model Titanic in the pond are worth seeking out.
This was a really nice garden there are lots of places to sit and enjoy. there are lots of little details in the way the flowers were planted. a great place to spend a morning or afternoon
These gardens are a nice oasis for a quiet stroll. There are lots of benches in which to sit and enjoy. Beautiful plantings.

A very nice Victorian Garden with pleasant paths throughout. Although in the middle of the city it is large enough to isolate you from the traffic noise etc. Grounds are generally very well maintained although we did notice a section that had some invasive plants (Japanese knotweed)that should be removed before it becomes a real problem
Very nicely organized with lots of areas to sit and relax and take in the view! Flowers, ponds, cacti and ducks provide a beautiful escape from the city core!
Must do on any trip to Halifax or near it. Among the most beautiful and peaceful public gardens I have seen anywhere.
If you want to take some great photos, especially family photos, this is the place to come.We enjoyed a long leisurly walk through the gardens and took numerous pictures.

A small but beautiful park where one can listen to a free concert at the Gazebo, sit on a bench with pretty surroundings and read a book, or just leisurely stroll around and enjoy the environment. It was a break from our fairly aggressive tour schedule.
A very relaxing oasis away from the tourist hustle and bustle. Walking distance from the waterfront.

The Halifax Public Gardens is a centrally located beautiful park that you should walk through whenever you have a few minutes or an hour to spare. It will take your breath away. No matter how many people are there, there is always a spot for you. There is one area where families can throw a football with their kids. We...

I do not, as a rule, tour through large gardens. However, the group wanted to go there, and I joined them and had a great time. Lots of little places to sit, went there two Sundays with band concerts both times, people practicing tai chi. Wish Pittsburgh would spend some of our tax money on this type of property
The public gardens are a real treat, very close to the city center. Be sure to try out the coffee shop on the premises. It's ice cream is especially wonderful!
This park is large, beautiful and well maintained. We walked about the park and took time to smell the roses. We took photos and enjoyed our time in this beautiful park.

Its a great place to take a leisurely walk, enjoy a picnic lunch, listen to live music or have an ice cream cone. The grounds are absolutely stunning and a great place for picture taking. I love to take my lunch there on my break from the hospital. It is hard to find parking however as it is only meter...

Nice park that covers a square block. There are several walking paths where you will see fountains, statues, ducks, geese, ponds and lots of flowers. Plenty of places to sit and relax. No dogs or smoking.

These public gardens are a delight to visit and provided many great photographic opportunities for my amateur photographer husband. There are both nice restrooms and refreshments available in the gardens.

Travelled to halifax in August on VIA Rail's Ocean. Good food and service but sleeping accommodations horrible. Cabins a tight squeeze for one person let alone 2slim individuals. Two people cannot pass in sleeping car hallways. Halifax a treat and public gardens a must see but, at all costs, avoid the Ocean.
A lovely spot sheltered from the hustle and bustle of city life. Only a few minutes walk from the waterfront. The park has a lovely little café.
What a wonderful retreat inside a busy city. Immediately you feel relaxed and at peace. Love this place and highly recommend it.
Roses daliahs and evry kind of hosta you can imagine -trees and bushes bridges and pergolas ,statuary and ponds -beautiful place to spend an afternoon

The Public Gardens grounds keepers take pride in maintaining the grounds, through the 3 seasons this grand 17 acre Victorian garden is open.Symmetrical paths, lawns, colourfully flower beds,shrubs, pond, Bandstand, & fountain make it a great location to visit & it's one of my favourite places in Halifax.
Beautiful gazebo, attractive gardens on a summers day. Wonderful place for a midday stroll on a summers day

After walking at the citadel this garden was a nice place to cool down and relax. I had never seen so many flowers, shrubs and trees ablaze with colors and so vibrant. It had a very beautiful landscape with pathways, fountains and shady trees. I wish it was in my neck of wood. There is no charge to see this...

The gardeners do a wonderful job keeping the public gardens full of colourful flowers and shrubs through spring, summer and fall. There's always something beautiful to see.I've been visiting the gardens regularly for more than 30 years, taking my kids when they were still in a baby carriage. As toddlers they'd feed the ducks although that's no longer considered...

The Gardens is such a lovely, quiet, well-kept gem. I booked at the Lord Nelson hotel mainly for the pleasure of taking my parents through the summer gardens each morning. Lovely cafe in the centre of the Gardens, too!
The garden was very nice with many blooming flowers. While not a large garden like in Victoria Island, still nice with multiple benches to rest on and a ice cream shop.

On every visit to Halifax, I am sure to visit Public Gardens. Beautifully maintained and groomed and I on every trip I find myself bringing out my camera to snap a few pics of the lovely landscape. A visit to Public Gardens is always an enjoyable walk in the park, be it with a good book, a good friend or...
Gardens are nice, but there are only a few areas with actual flowering plants. As a photographer, I was hoping for more flowering plants and a Japanese type Garden.

The gardens cover several square blocks with outstanding trees, lakes, flower beds and lawn areas. There is quite a bit of labeling of plants as well the monuments which are spread out over the garden. Nice to see many families enjoying the park.
A lovely place for a walk. The gardens are free to visit. They aren't very big so you can get around them in a short amount of time. There are ponds, statues, fountains and birds.

Wife and I visited today, and it is amazing. Beautiful flowers, exotic plantings, a gentle and wandering path throughout. Very well tended. Whole place is designed for relaxing and enjoying nature. No dogs, no bicycles, no jogging and no smoking. Plan on spending at least an hour. Oh, and they have a great ice cream shop.

This is a must see Public Gardens. Our taxi driver mentioned these gardens and told us that we should find time in our schedule to visit the gardens. We are so glad that we did because we were thoroughly impressed. Every garden was different. We sat and relaxed in the luxury that nature can provide. Everything in the downtown area...

My friends and I strolled around the park for a couple of hours and enjoyed the beautiful flowers, trees of all sorts and grounds in general. Lovely fountains, statues and the assortment of Dahlia's is incredible. I have never shot so many pictures of flowers before and actually enjoyed it! Timed the visit for the Sunday in the park concerts...
Loved the plants and is obvious that is is well cared for. Statuary was lovely. Surprised by the coffee, pineapple and other tropical plantings.
A relatively small garden oasis of perfection in a lovely city. Don't miss a stroll through the gardens.

The gardens are a short walk from downtown and offer a pleasant getaway from traffic and sidewalks and tourists. One can meander around ponds and fountains, sit on a bench, enjoy and ice cream creation or ponder how a pineapple grows in Canada or why a model Titanic floats in the big pond. Dahlias and roses were in bloom during...
This garden was huge, you could spend a whole day wondering around looking at the trees, flowers, even the duck pond at the center.
Take an easy stroll thru the gardens and take plenty of pictures! Visit the coffee / ice cream shop in the park - great ice cream. Very peaceful and many different flowers & trees.

weve been spending a fair amount of time at the hospitals in Halifax and his is my favorite place to walk to instead of sitting around the hospital waiting for people :) its beautiful and free, doesn't get any better than that
This is one of the few things tourists can visit without paying an entrance fee. The trees, gardens and lawns were lovely. It's close to the Citadel. You should go.

It was a hot summer day. My husband and I were just walking around . He surprised me with that visit. We walked in the gardens for at least 90 minutes, It's well kept, clean, as green as green can be. I loved every minutes.

From the historic water fountains, charming duck pond and on to the tea room, August is the prime time to visit this beautiful historic garden. A bit more labeling of flowers and trees would enrich the experience for visitors.

Our group opted to not walk through these gardens, but we drove around them, and were very impressed by what we saw. I suspect that had we walked through I would have rated this Five Stars! Beautul flower displays everywhere.

These gardens are a sculpted beauty. Meticulously groomed they are a joy to behold. Take time to relax in the splendour and be sure to bring your camera as there is a photo opportunity around every corner.

Flowers and all the birds like ducks and geese were interesting, it is just a nice place to walk about and contemplate in a quiet setting with lots of places to sit and adsorb the peace and tranquility.
Very clean , interesting little sections and large geese. So much to offer for a public garden. I would definitely revisit
Great gardens for a stroll and a place to rest while shopping! You can also get some great pictures!

These gardens are a must to visit while vacationing in Halifax! Beautiful flower beds with flowers species too many to mention. A band stand which is still being used on a regular basis. Giant urns and statues . Many winding paths with bridges over ponds and waterways.
Peaceful, nice get away within the city. Benches everywhere, beautiful flowers. Large, good pond in the center.

Beautiful garden just to wander around in, a nice respite. Well kept, lot of general grounds keeping was going during our visit, but they kept to the background. Lots of history as you looked at the dedications of the fountains and trees.

Lovely gardens, a fountain, some statues and a gazebo, lots of shade, and a central location make this a nice place to go to sit and relax. Some parks are kind of blah (just bushes and trees) but this one had nice landscaping and a good selection of flowers and scenery. Small enough to walk around the whole park. We...
Short walk from downtown with beautiful gardens and sculpture. We were lucky to enjoy a Sunday concert.

beautiful flowers, and a calm friendly enviroment...clean and great place to pause and give thanks.... hard to believe such calm feelings while in the midst of the city of Halifax.beautiful flowers, friendly folks and kindness offered to all from what I saw..

This is a beautiful public garden, a bit on the small side but with many lovely features, such as dahlias and roses, along with interesting fountains and sculptures. But it is surrounded on all four sides by busy city streets, so there is nowhere within it where you can find true quiet. I guess that's just the way it goes...
A really nice place for a quiet walk - with the added attraction of providing some history to your day.

For a refreshing, quiet stroll, walk through these public gardens and get away from the traffic of Halifax. It was beautful and very well maintained. So many roses! There are also birds to watch in the park. It is worth your time to visit.
Pretty planting and lovely paths for walking. Great for a picnic by the small lake. There is a useful little shop selling lovely ice cream and snacks
The flowers of course! Walking paths through. There are public washrooms on site. The bandstand has concerts but not when we were there.
Well landscaped, beautifully maintained. Great garden display of flowers. Vintage trees. Great place for a leisure walk. Take your camera.

a very beautiful and peaceful park in the center of Halifax.magnificent array of flowers , colors and lots of areas to simply sit and enjoy the park. Rest rooms are clean and well kept up.Lot of local artists selling their work along the outer part of the park.overall a nice area to visit for families.
Wrong time of year to see much in bloom, but very well kept. Nice walk good for wheelchair users and those with walking difficulties.

Roses.. they had so many roses around the place! different kinds and colours. At some point I had to stop myself from taking a picture of every flower :)The larger lake has a replica of titanic "sinking" in the middle.

Very nice park in downtown Halifax. With the gazebo in the centre of the park, you can easily imagine families in the early 1900s enjoying the afternoon there. Lots of beautiful flowers and trees. Park is well taken care of and obviously loved by Haligonians.
Worth a visit, beautiful and serene. Nice ponds with ducks and fabulous flowers all in the middle of the city.
It's a large garden with many seating areas. There is a wide variety of flowers and plants to enjoy.

This beautiful Victorian Garden is a delightful oasis of calm and tranquility in the midst of the bustling city of Halifax. It's in easy walking distance of downtown, near the Citadel and Springhurst shopping district. You can wander for hours amidst the rich flower gardens, enjoy the ducks on the ponds and the elegant statues.

Lovethe gardens, and they way the beauty relaxes you as you walk through them. There is really nothing to dislike here, unless you are bothered by the occasional street person grabbing a short bath in one of the fountains. I've only seen this happen twice, and took no offence to it at all. There is also an Icecream stand with...
It is a really nice park laid out after victorian principles. Enjoyed walking in the park looking at the flowers and the trees, there was so much variation in the park. Absolutely lovely park
Nice place to relax and see beautiful flowers and big old trees. There are plenty of seats so you can enjoy every moment. There are even ducks.

What a wonderful place to while away a few hours in! Shades of the old country here with bandstand, fountains and a lake complete with a model Titanic (Caught on weeds rather than an iceberg). There was a trendy tea room by the downtown exit with a shady terrace and attentive staff. Delightful park - well worth a visit.

What a beautiful and enchanting place. We visited here in 2010 and it was a lovely and romantic stroll. Flowers attractively arranged. The Bandstand welcomes you to sit around and enjoy the surroundings. The trees beckons and the breeze encourages. Lovely place I say.

We came for a visit on Saturday and were so impressed that we returned again on Sunday to watch the free concert in the band shell that happens during the summer on Sundays from 2:00 pm to 4:00 pm. The gardens are beautiful and arranged in an orderly Victorian fashion. The gates at the entry are very attractive and are...
really enjoyed a stroll around these lovely gardens and a tea afterwards at the in-park coffee shop. Try to find the Titanic while you're there!

It was neat to walk around the gardens, look at all the different types of trees, plants and flowers and read the various plaques. The bandstand was pretty. I was impressed to see a pineapple growing!

Much has been written about how great the Halifax Public Gardens are. So, we decided to have an early evening walk just before dinner.The place was well-maintained and there were plenty to see, including not just flowers, but geese and ducks (and ducklings). There was also a Titanic scale model in one of its ponds.The area, however, is...
These gardens are beautiful, is an a really amazing place to go to, take good pictures and remember to have contact with the nature

My sisters and I enjoyed a wonderful afternoon walking about the gardens, All the mature plants, the colours, it was very peaceful and very well kept. Even after being there for several hours we still do not want to leave.

The variety of plants in this garden are really special. They have a section with American Chestnut trees and the most remarkable stands of Rhododendron. The gardens go for blocks and is so well maintained. I could have spent another few hours there.
There was a jazz band playing in the beautiful band shell. What a treat! The gardens are beautiful, so are the birds that inhabit the park. Well worth spending some time there.

This is a lovely Victorian garden with no fees. There are statues, ponds and beautiful flower gardens. There are lots of paths to follow and it can take as little or as much time as you want. Metered parking is available on the local streets.
A lovely garden with many places to sit and reflect - the floral displays when we were there were stunning!
Beautiful, serene, photogenic, great place to take a walk and enjoy natures beauty right in the heart of Halifax!

The Halifax Public Gardens are peaceful. They make an easy walk from where the cruise ships dock (we traveled there by boat). There is a coffee shop in the middle of the park which is nice. Definitely a lot of photographic opportunities.

we stayed at the lord nelson opposite the gardens and thoroughly enjoyed a daily walk there.the band stand which is particularly attractive is also used for many entertainments in the summer which we thoroughly enjoyed
These gardens are not exceptionally great but a pleasant oasis in the city to walk through--cool and inviting.
Very pretty plantings. An attractive, calming area to stroll and take a break from the city. Not especially impressive (if that's what you're looking for), but a nice place to be for a while.
Listed as the best Victorian Garden in North America. While I cannot verify that, I found the garden to be well set up, peaceful and a very nice place to visit.
Beautiful English style garden, with walking paths. Small but beautifully sculptured, with walking path, benches to relax on.

Stopping at the Public Garden in the middle of some hectic sightseeing was the best relaxing interlude. Shaded walking paths wend their way throughout the park revealing some surprising fountains, ponds, and beautiful flower beds. Judging from all of the lunchers, it is a great place to sit on a shady bench and enjoy a picnic lunch. We found this...

Some of the largest rhododendrons I have seen are there, along with ponds, paths, and plantings. There are lots of water features of different types. Some of the mature specimens were outstanding examples. It was a pleasant highlight of a waling tour. We saw photo sessions for several weddings.
My wife really enjoyed walking through the park and looking at all the different flowers and tree, it was a great day in the gardens.
We walked up to the gardens from the harbor and enjoyed the setting. We loved the flowers and planting beds. Everything was clean but we were surprised with the grass being so weedy and shaggy.
The gardens are absolutely breathtaking. We could have spent hours there. Many photo opportunities. Makes for a nice afternoon visit.

I absolutely love the Public Gardens. They're beautiful and calm. They're a nice place to just go for a little walk with your significant other, or with your family. There is usually a lot going on there in the summer that you can watch and take part in.
Nicely landscaped with ponds and paths. There is a walking tour of Halifax that includes the gardens and harborfront - recommended.

Some good design ideas. The flowers were half dead...The colors clashed with red salvias and celosia in faded colors...I saw the dahlias all"Caged" for next month probably.But, all that said, the walk was nice in the cool evening breeze.
These gardens are smack dab in the middle of the city and the blooms are amazing. HUGE shrubs (as big as my main floor of my house) all in bloom. Lovely gardens and wonderful to walk through.

By all means, you should visit this lovely park. What a respite in the midst of city traffic, noise and bustle. It is very clean, well laid out for walking or simply strolling. Plenty of benches that encourage you to stop and linger. Very lovely place!
These gardens are so colorful and clean and picturesque. Location is central and Tranquillity to visit
The gardens were well taken care of and full of flowers and trees.The roddedenrons were going by but they were still pretty and the size of the bushes was huge.

Coming from Vancouver, BC, this is no Stanley Park or Butchart Gardens. However, it is also wonderful to see public parks in the middle of a city and this is no exception. Every city needs a place for the residents and visitors to rest amidst the greenery of a park.It was lovely and on a sunny day, I am...
Nice, clean, bike and dog-free environment.Pleasant to visit. Interesting selection of flora.Also a model of the Titanic in the pond......
A little overcrowded with multiple high schools visiting the gardens for their graduation photos. That did not deter from the beauty of the gardens.

This is quite small but beautifully planted and cared for. There are flower beds, shrubs, trees and a small cafe which sells excellent ice cream. Very popular with locals, when we were there it was full of young people who had just graduated and who came with their families to have there photo taken giving it a lively and happy...

My wife and I both grew up in Halifax , Nova Scotia . As children and young adults , we had spent many days at the Halifax Public Gardens - enjoying the well manicured lawns and very beautiful trees and flowers . It was truly a place a beauty , peace and relaxation . We are in Halifax this week...

It is a beautiful place that hosts graduation ceremonies, wedding photo sessions and music bands throughout spring and summer. You can also check curious things like threes planted by member of the English monarchy. Public gardens close during winter. Public washrooms sometimes are not very accessible (they are closed).
Quiet place in the middle of the city. The rhododendrons were in full bloom -- they were beautiful! Make sure to look for the mini Titanic in one of the ponds.

Halifax is a great city. We stopped at the public Gardens to walk and take pictures. There are clean bathrooms there. It is shaded with plenty of benches to sit on. There are beautiful flowers and a pond. This would be a perfect stroll for a date. Safe and clean. Bring some snacks and a beverage.
What a wonderful place to enjoy a picnic lunch, stroll the gardens, read a book, enjoy a concert, play catch or re-connect. A well-designed park in the midst of a city appreciated by all ages.

Even in early July you can see the love and care this garden gets. I'm a gardener and I appreciate the hours of weeding, trimming, watering and general care involved in maintaining a simple garden. I can only imagine the countless hours etc involved in a victorian garden.
Lots of flowering shrubs and plants and folks just wandering about enjoying this bit of a retreat in central Halifax
This is one of my favourite places to visit in Halifax. The flowers are beautiful and it is a very relaxing place to spend an afternoon.

Absolutely beautiful, classy, manicured gardens. A peaceful, colourful oasis. I didn't give it 5 because I can't come to terms with the manufactured way the flowers are planted fully grown then whisked out and swapped with something else when they have outlived their usefulness. A bit of evolution from buds to flowers and subsequent pruning would not go amiss. However,...

Entered on on gate and exited thru main gate. Great walk very nice, quiet and peaceful. Lots of very nice plants, flowers and trees with some water features. Benches in different areas allow you to sit and relax easily. Paths are there in all directions.

After reading the reviews in Trip Advisor the Halifax Public Gardens became a priority on our visit to Halifax. The season is in full swing and many of the flower beds were ripe with beautiful colors. Of course, the waterfalls, statues, bridges and ponds all added to the photo opportunity. I took over 150 pictures and did not erase more...

The gardens are beautiful with plenty of benches to sit and relax. It is in a perfect location, with other points of interest nearby. The Sunday "free" concert in the gazebo was great. It was well attended by seniors to young children all having a great time. The gardeners are willing to speak to visitors as they go about their...

The Public Gardens are well worth the visit. Nice and peaceful, take a stroll and enjoy the beautiful grounds & flowers. See the oak tree planted by Prince Charles this May 2014 alongside the one planted by his Grandfather King George VI in 1939. An oasis in the heart of the city.

The public gardens are a special gift to residents and visitors alike. It’s a wonderful spot to take a leisurely walk and just enjoy the space; very peaceful. They have concerts regularly in the summertime. I highly suggest you visit-even if you only have a few minutes. You will not be disappointed.

Tranquility in the middle of the city. Take one of the meandering, tree-lined pathways and around every corner you will enjoy beautiful gardens. In the pond, swans swim gracefully while the bandstand at one end of the park could be filled with music for some afternoon concerts. Very enjoyable!

Beautifully planted and maintained, accessible for all, lunch available which we enjoyed sitting on one of the benches near the bandstand on a hot summer day. The ducks and geese were a favourite for kids, and the fact that this is such an accessible park is a big plus. Easy for everyone to navigate. Brought back childhood memories during a...
This garden is absolutely gorgeous. It is a beautiful place to stroll. It had a Victorian character, with a pond and a gazebo. The flowers were in bloom -- a wonderful sight.

We visited in the fall whilst the trees were all shades of red, orange and gold. It was a truly spectacular display. The gardens a a short stroll from the city centre and close to other attractions like The Citadel. Thoroughly recommend a visit whilst in Halifax

The fact the weather was spectacular probably helped this review, but the gardens are so well maintained, it has to be something that all the residents of Halifax can be proud of. Other reviews complained about the amount of rules and restrictions but those are necessary to maintain the beauty of the gardens for all to enjoy. I could only...

This is a must to see. Take the time to grab a snack/coffee whatever and go for a stroll. Beautiful!!!!! when you consider this place was destroyed during hurricane Juan, and the work that has gone into it, you wont be disappointed. You dont have to be a gardner, you don't have to love flowers, you just have to love...

Visited here on a gloomy, overcast day. The grounds are impeccably maintained. There were many flowers in bloom which provided a lot of color. Also a lot of history via signage, etc. A nice break from the hustle and bustle of the city.
A good place to spend some quiet time, just beautiful. Also a nice snack bar and places to just sit and enjoy.
They played in the garden for about 30 minutes, running around, little pond has a miniature of peggy cove lighthouse and titanic ship, very cute. cozy, beautiful place to have a short break.
This park is conveniently located in the middle of busy Halifax. It was beautiful! Relaxing and quiet. Great way to end our day.
Visiting the gardens was part of our tour - the flowers were breath taking, in full bloom and gorgeous! The little cafe in the middle had hot coffee or tea - friendly helpful staff

When visiting Halifax, you must take a walk through the Halifax Public Gardens. This Victorian park offers a relaxing atmosphere in the middle of Downtown Halifax. Please note: no jogging, no pets, no biking.
We enjoyed a nice afternoon walk through theses beautiful gardens. Lovely paths with benches to sit and enjoy the beauty.

I think the title of this review basically sums the entire review up. This place is gorgeous to say the least. Very very picturesque. Its perfect for a nice getaway from the hustle and bustle of city life. Very calm, peaceful, and beautifully laid out. Good for a walk, even a run or picnic.

Such a beautiful garden in a beautiful city. We visited in May just as the flowers were starting to bloom. It is so peaceful and doesn't feel like you are in the middle of a city. Halifax itself is a lovely place. Our favourite city ever.

This garden is so beautiful it is where everyone goes for prom pictures or wedding photos. There is a number of things to see: gazebo, bridges, pond with miniature Titanic, statues, flowers, and fountain. Great place for a stroll, picnic, or lunch. It is open dusk until dawn from Spring until Autumn. There is a little coffee shop in the...

A tranquil and lovely spot in the middle of the busy city, Halifax Public Gardens is a wonderful place to relax among the flowers on a sunny day, to enjoy an outdoor concert in summertime, to meditate and reflect when life gets too rushed. I spent an hour or so in late May with family members strolling the gardens, admiring...
Visited in June and the flowers were just beginning. Beautifully maintained and a wonderful place to spend a sunny afternoon.
very beautiful and well maintained. The flowers were very much in bloom and enchanting.it is an excellent place to walk and enjoy the peace
Just across the street from our Hotel, and out of the busy street traffic, this is a nice quiet, lush, garden with wide walk ways and open spaces. A great place to relax.

We were here in early June and the tulips and flowering trees were spectacular. What a wonderful place to soak in all the beauty and the wonderful smell of springtime fresh flowers! Bridges, a pond with a miniature titanic floating in it, and plenty of photo opportunities abound here.

What a wonderful, relaxing place to visit.....just strolling along the paths admiring the flowers and fountain. Be sure to look for the two large geese - these are the biggest I've ever seen. Perhaps they are too well fed despite the sign telling people not to feed them (I watched a man stand by the sign and feed the geese...
The public gardens turned out to be a nice discovery. They are not large but very colourful and with nice touches of miniature houses, lighthouse and boat. A nice oasis in the middle of the city.
The public gardens in Halifax are certainly worth visiting! It is a small and beautifully landscaped garden in town. The garden is easy to stroll through for any age or activity level.

The park was a nice change from the shops and restaurants on Spring Garden Road. There are plenty of benches to sit down and relax on. It is a great place for a picnic on a warm day. There are a few places where you can pick up snacks/lunch etc... nearby.

The Public Gardens is a wonderful place to relax, watch the birds and children playing, and enjoy the beautiful flowers and trees. The Gardens are only steps away from great shopping and restaurants on Spring Garden Road.

Beautiful garden in the heart of Halifax. Stroll along Spring Garden Road window shopping and then step into the gardens. There are hundreds of varieties of flowers and trees. If your lucky a band will be playing in the bandstands. Many wedding photos during the summer. Lots of benches to sit and read a book. A must see while in...

A beautiful English style garden in the heart of Halifax.Small by some standards (the size of a city block) but it has a variety beautiful flowers, a serene pond, small babbling brooks with arched bridges, and historical statues/fountains. There is also a small house where you can purchase ice cream and limited snacks. But as the garden is in...

This historic park is a lovely place for a stroll in downtown Halifax. After a shop along spring Garden Road, drop into these gardens for an ice cream and enjoy an oasis in the middle of our downtown.
Spent a lovley afternoon walking through the park admiring all the blooming flowers. Park is nicely laid out.

A walk through Halifax's Public Gardens is ultra-special in the summer once it is in full bloom. You can't avoid weddings, graduations, family picnics and performance in the gazebo....but I have been using it regularly during autumn, winter and early spring and it is still enticing, inviting and tranquil. It takes you our of the city bustle and as an...

A beautiful area to walk-through or maybe spend an hour or two enjoying the variety of plants, flowers and the slower pace. It is located adjacent to the main shopping street of Spring Garden road and is one of the few places where things slow down and remain quiet.Spring, summer and fall each have their own colors and aromas....

The Halifax Public Gardens are a real treat to walk through, sit and read or meander around. The diversity of the plant material here is well done. There is a lot of history tucked into every corner and design. Set in the middle of Halifax it is an awesome place to "take a breath" and totally enjoy a part of...

A little place to have some peace and beauty within the city. Flowers, trees, bushes and birds to add to the beauty and maybe a little entertainment. It is great to go in and see how the gardens are growing and transforming.
Love going here, either for quiet walks or with family. The Halifax Public Gardens is a beautiful spot that leaves you forgetting you're in the middle of the city.
Visited the gardens just after Prince Charles - beautiful display of spring bulbs. Azaleas and tulip combo awesome. Lovely spot for a walk before dinner.
All visitors to Nova Scotia should stop for a visit here. Absolutely beautiful, very calming in the centre of Halifax. Great for families or couples.
This is a nice spot and very clean but if you wish to be impressed head to the royal gardens in anapolis royal.

Located in the heart of the city, in the "shadow" of Citadel Hill is a large Victorian garden that is free to the public to enter and enjoy. In the fall its along the path to the Zombie walk and in the spring its the backdrop to countless wedding photos.
Nice little pond, lovely trees, blooming bushes and flowers. Nice pathway. You forget you are in the city.
A bit of a surprise to discover an English garden in this part of the wold. Though it isn'it very big, it is worth a visit!
We went to visit this beautiful garden on a day when it was filled with hundreds of people, all celebrating graduation of this year's class.

I am completely in Love with these gardens and cannot say enough about them. These gardens will leave many breathless and astonished. They are one of the top Gardens in Canada and are worth the visit.
Very British feel to the garden as you stroll the many paths admiring trees and flowers, Kind of a mini Boston Commons.

This was honestly one of the most gorgeous and breath taking experiences my wife and I have ever had. The beauty that is within this garden is absolutely astonishing. Now, obviously, if you try to take the kids here they might get a little bored. But regardless of age, this is something everyone should see if they have the opportunity....

These are well groomed gardens downtown Halifax that are free and open to everyone whether it be for a stroll, a picnic or to read a book! It is seasonal so the flowers reflect the time of year. Recommend this picture stop!

I have been coming to the public gardens since i was a little girl, and each time is as good as the one before. The flowers are beautiful, the scenery is excellent and if you're lucky, you can watch live music on the gazebo. I always reccommend bringing a little bread to feed the ducks.
Everything looked really nice but it would definitely look better if I had gone during the Summer, and would especially be more enjoyable with the warmer weather.

Beautiful gardens, great history and a great way to relax on a hot summers day or any day. Gardens are well laid out and very well kept. Hivhly recommend this walking tour and at no cost. Go and relax and enjoy.
Great on a nice day, and close to Spring Garden rd. with food ,shops etc. all in walking distance from the gardens.

Beautiful gardens, well maintained within the city downtown Halifax. Well worth a stop by to spend a moment or a couple hours walking or sitting on a park bench relaxing. Some food is available, coffee and ice cream treats.Approx. 10 min walk from the water front along Spring Garden Road.Would recommend for any one visiting Halifax.

This is an old Victorian type of gardens with beautiful flowers, fountains and ponds with swans and ducks. Walk through the paths and take in the sight of all the flowers, shrubs and fountains or sit and enjoy music at the bandstand. In summer there is usually music on weekend afternoons. On weekends you will see many wedding parties having...
Enjoy strolling through Halifax's Public Gardens. A lovely place to sit and relax while enjoying the well manicured park.
This is a beautiful place to spemd a few hours relaxing and enjoying the beautiful vegetation in the gardens.
I would recommend this place to anyone that visits Halifax or is a residence. A great place to relax & then go on with your day & you can even go get an ice cream and enjoy.

If you love flowers, you will thoroughly enjoy this park. It is great for families with small children,and seniors, as it has easy and flat walking trails. Admission is free but you will have to use a parking meter. There are lots of coffee shops close, and sometimes in the summer free entertainment.
the park was founded in 1836, it is a Victorian style park. Very pretty when in bloom, probably starting in June. grab a blanket and have a picnic on the grass or for a walk.
National Historic Site. Victorian Gardens. Oasis in center of city. Beautiful floral displays.Visit website www.halifaxpublicgardens.ca and blog http://alongthegardenspath.com/

When open, usually May through October, this Victorian-style guardian is an oasis of calm away from the bustle of the city. Kids can feed the ducks or race around the many paths, visitors can sit in the shade of established, stately trees, and the thirsty can get a beverage from the tea room. It's not large. But it's a place...
Free entry, meandering paths, and beautiful manicured gardens in a park setting in the city center. Great shopping and restaurants close by or you can bring a picnic for the park.
Great place to stop and smell the flowers, take a load off your feet and enjoy nature in the city center, Great place to read and relax,
a very ice place to relax in the middle of the city.....feed birds and ducks and just enjoy nature....

The Public Gardens take up a large block in the city. Entrance can be made from the 4 corners. Very peaceful and relaxing. The locals break up their walk to and from work by walking the pathways. Beautiful plants and fascinating trees. Read up on its history. It will become a favourite spot to read or sit and observe.

The Public Gardens present a constantly changing array of flowers and trees and fountains, with carefully planned walkways that make the Gardens seem larger than they are. There are ducks and geese and, around June, wedding parties. Off to one side are some chessboards, and of course there are benches on which to rest and a spot to buy a...

The Halifax Public gardens is a great place to sit and have a quiet break while downtown.Always quiet and relaxing they also have a great coffee shop, concerts some afternoons in the summer and a good variety of flowers which evolve over the summer.

Halifax Public Gardens is a beautiful strolling park in central Halifax that is lined with Victorian gardens, duck pond, swans, Band Stand and canteen facilities. The paths are well maintained and completely wheelchair accessible. It is situated in and occupies the whole block surrounded by Spring Garden Road, Summer Street, Sackville Street, and South Park Street.. As a native Haligonian...

The Public Gardens is a beautiful spot..The many different types of flowers and bushes are extraordinary..The little streams with ducks..the gazebo with entertainment during summer months is a must attend..Walking paths throughout the park...Try to visit ..You will not be disappointed!!.

The Halifax Public Gardens is a beautifully maintained Victorian garden. It's a great place for a stroll or to sit and enjoy a cup of coffee and watch the people, ducks & swans. It's great solo, with kids or for a romantic afternoon stroll.

Entrance on Spring Garden where also shops and restaurants. Lovely flowers, duck pond, free entrance and places to sit. Lots of office workers take lunch there during the summer to just enjoy the space. It is closed over the winter.
Once we get rid of this horrible winter, the flowers will commence. Its as pretty a garden as you,ll find when its in bloom. In a rustic natural way its equal to the Luxembourg gardens in Paris.

Located right downtown in the heart of Halifax's main shopping and dining area, the Public Gardens are beautiful place to enjoy some peace and tranquility while strolling the winding paths of the English Garden design. The Gardens are very well maintained and have both common and rare plants, trees and flowers. Said to be one of the finest surviving examples...

I live here so we go a few times a year , all kinds of flowers, trees, shrubs, Ponds, Ducks ,Swans, Geese, benches & quiet areas if you just want to sit and relax and enjoy the sites. There is also a bandstand with Music at times

column3: Nova Scotia's Bay of Fundy and Annapolis Valley, Canada
column4: Nice quiet place to sit or walk & enjoy the view. Paths are paved so easy for families or seniors to navigate.

We live in Halifax, so our view might be somewhat different from the view of the casual visitor. For us, it's a charming oasis in the center of the city. It's well-kept and lovely in all of the three seasons during which it's open...it's closed through most of the winter. It's a formal Victorian garden, with wonderful displays of flowers,...

This Victorian garden park in the midst of a noisy city is well worth the visit. Flowering plants among trees, shrubs and water features create a relaxing place to stroll or just sit on one of the many benches scattered throughout.

Local like me know to use the public gardens as a relaxing getaway in the middle of the heart of Halifax. Lots of history if you take the time to read. Well taken care of, with pride.Must see if downtown Halifax as it is right next to the Museum of Natural History.

I have been visiting "the Gardens", as we Haligonians call it, since I was a child. In Spring and Summer, this is a beautiful place to spend an hour or two. The roses are exceptional as are the huge Rhodedendron bushes in Spring. There are plants and trees in the Gardens that no longer exist anywhere else in the world,...

This beautiful Victorian garden has an unbelievable assortment of flowers and trees from all over the world that are maintained impeccably. It also home to has various birds, ducks, and swans that fill its ponds. To see the garden at it best go during the High School prom season, around June 20-24, and see the garden full of young ladies...

The Halifax Public Gardens are a sort of horticultural period piece. When you step into the garden, you step back in time. The styling of the various garden beds and other features such as the pond and bandstand are drawn from the Victorian era, so it has a very unique feeling to it. Uncommon Grounds Cafe serves locally made ice...

A beautiful and quiet oasis in the heart of the city. Fabulous for a quiet few moments, for a romantic stroll or as a place to grab a sandwich lunch on a warm summer's day. The surroundings are beautiful in an 'old world' sort of way. If you must be active and have noise around you all the time, this...
Just walk and look at the amazing gardens. Stop for ice cream and feed the ducks. Lovely for a walk with your sweetheart or your children. It's peaceful and casual. lots of history to experience.

The Public Gardens are a jewel in the crown that partially establishes Halifax as a tourist destination. With its walkways and ponds and overabundance of flowering shrubs and gardens, the park is an oasis in the city landscape. Dating back it it's early Victorian history and prior to that as part of the common land declared by George III, it...
Beautiful Victorian Garden with walking paths, ponds, flowers, and live entertainment in the summer. Sugah! hand paddled ice cream and right in the city!
Grab a coffee, sit on a bench and take in the fragrance of Public Gardens in downtown Halifax. Absolutely gorgeous landscaping, swans and history.
A beautiful spot for a leisurely walk, appropriate for all ages. Great setting and back drops for picture taking.
Very pretty little park with lots of different kinds of flowers. Lovely little pond. Cemeterey across the stret worth a look at as well.
Must go!!! amazing gardens, just beautiful to walk around.. quiet in the evenings.The sourrindigs of Nova Scotia are amazing, the people is very friendly.
Pleasant walk. Not something we considered a must-do, but a nice time-filler during out trip. The gardens are quite large and we were able to navigate with a stroller well.

It is the most beautiful and inspirational place to visit in this historical city. From the main gate, to the bridges, the carpet flower beds, Victoria Jubilee Fountain, and the graceful Roman goddess statues, all present long-lasting craftsmanship for the enjoyment of every visitor.
Romantic, beautiful and relaxing! A real gem in an already magical city. If I lived in Halifax I would spend many hours weekly at this place!
If you are in the downtown area, this is a great place to stop in and relax for a break. Beautiful gardens and the walk around the park is short and relaxing.

We were here on a cold day in September. I think we have probably caught one of the last really pretty days. The flowers were absolutely gorgeous! I can't imagine any bride in the area not wanting her pictures done here! The displays were bright, vibrant, perfectly manicured. Such a nice way to spend a morning!
I enjoy plants and took the walk up the hill to the gardens. I was delighted in the flowers, trees and landscape of the gardens. It was still very pretty in mid October.

Have a relaxing walk in this beautiful Garden. Trees and flowers from around the workl with nice water features also. Many years ago there was a Hurricaine that uprooted many of the trees but the garden is almost completely restored to it's former glory.

This is a lovely formal garden with swans and many plants named, I live in Halifax and if I am visiting Spring Garden Rd I always park by the gardens to have an excuse to walk through. They are open most of the year so I go all seasons as they change. The huge rhododendrons are especially wonderful in late...

This is a great place to go to unwind. Although it can be a bit crowded in the nice summer months, it's still nice and relaxing. Take a little stroll, feed the geese (and get attacked) and maybe sit on a bench and read your book.
Loved visiting the gardens a peaceful place to go for a quiet visit or just to see the gorgeous flowers!

The Public Gardens is a beautiful spot. I have lived in Halifax for many years, and have been there many, many times. On a sunny summer day, it's a great place to sit and eat an ice cream and enjoy the scenery and music. Over the years, I have spent quiet time studying there, taken my kids there to feed...

A walk through these victorian gardens will replenish your spirit. I used to live in Halifax and always chose to walk through the gardens on my way downtown. There are many attractions i there including a cactus garden and gigantic rhododendrons which thrive in the acidic soil. Geese (which have replaced the cantankerous swans) and ducks as well as pigeons...

Amazing and free place to visit, most beautiful when all the flowers are in full bloom. No worries about Wheel Chair access it's all on one level, the bathrooms are WC accessible and the store/snack bar has a ramp. Famous for and popular with brides from all over Nova Scotia to have wedding pictures taken there. (no charge for that...

The Gardens are quite lovely. Take a nice relaxing stroll & enjoy. It would be nice for those that do not care for pigeons to be able to enjoy the gardens. If you take a snack to eat, the birds practically bombard you for your food. A BIG DRAWBACK FOR ME!!

One of only two Victorian Gardens in Canada -- a place where hundreds of species of trees, flowers, humans and birds congregate in an peaceful oasis within the city center. Many historical statues and pieces of Public Art dating from the 19th Century abound in thsi peaceful place. See coffee table book by Barbara DeLory entitled Three Centuries of Public...

This is an awesome green space in downtown Halifax. It is great for a stroll enjoying the gardens or enjoying reading your favorite book on one of it's many benches..In summer, there are bands playing in the gazebo & special events on holidays. A must do on your visit to Halifax.

Visited in October and though it was getting late in the season the gardens were beautiful and well worth seeing. The landscaping was extensive with numerous different areas and a wide range of species, many of which are hard to imagine growing in this climate. It is beautifully maintained by the staff who were in evidence working on the plantings....

This is truly a walk through the park. Trees, shrubs, flowers, wildlife, a great place to enjoy nature in the heart of the city. and if you are lucky the turn of the century grandstand will have live music

Lovely Public Gardens with a history. Beautiful plants in summer and fall but an interesting visit at other times too. Concession which sells ice cream , bird food and other treats is great and sometimes there are performances from the beautiful bandstand. Lots of ducks and swans.

This is a frequent and beloved spot in Halifax for me. On my most recent trip, a friend and I took my baby grandson for a walk in his stroller and enjoyed some ice cream at Sugah! which is always delicious. We chatted with a wonderful lady at the next table, enjoyed the blooming dahlias and checked out some unusual...
Right in the middle of the city, a lovely Victorian garden. Stroll or just sit and watch the world go by. Lovely.
these gardens are amazing, not to be missed and a beautiful walk. Visited with a few friends after having lunch on spring garden Rd.. Not to be missed!

An excellent example of a Classic Victorian garden located in the heart of Halifax. Flowers and plants from every Commonwealth country are truly spectacular. Located on 17 acres and maintained by an army of gardeners, the Gardens are sure to inspire even the least green-thumbed visitor. Free for all and open from May till November, several visits are required to...
beautiful the array of colors and foliage is awesome as well as the swans and ducks and they have concerts on the grandstand.
A beautiful park to visit in the summer. Lots of flowers, ducks and places to sit. If your timing is right there could be entertainment at the grandstand.
Perfect break from the traffic and noise of the city and a beautiful walk through history. There's also a excellent ice cream and good coffee available.

The gardens are absolutely beautiful in the summer. Take a nice relaxing stroll and feed the ducks. They sometimes hold concerts in the gazebo. If you want you can make it a quick walk through or you can spend hours reading about the different plants & tress or simply sitting and watching the people go by. I used to eat...

I have taken my children to Public Gardens annually since they were babies. They are now teenagers and still love our trips. We love sitting there watching the ducks or listening to the entertainment in the band stand.

On their own the Public Gardens are wonderful. They are a relaxing interlude in the day to just 'be'. For visitors who are getting tired of the walking...they are a haven and a must visit. Have some refreshment, watch people and ducks, watch wedding photos being taken, just 'be' and recharge. They will enhance your visit to Halifax.They're only...
I have spent many a day having lunch in the Gardens or attending the musical performances on the Bandstand. My grandchildren going with me just as theteit parens did 40 years ago

I live in Halifax and work quite close to the Gardens; they are so beautiful especially in the summer months and it provides somewhere to go on your lunch hour to enjoy the greenery right in the heart of the city.
