We picked up a cup of tea and a cookie at David's and walked up to the garden. We sat and chatted and admired while we drank our tea and then walked around the gardens. Just a great spot to spend an hour or so on a gorgeous autumn day.
We had a cloudy afternoon when we visited the HPG and still were impressed by its beauty. Imagine it on a sunny day !

I visited the Halifax Public Gardens recently but not for the first time. This was one of many return visits. When simply looking for a nice walk or place to take pictures for a special occasion, the gardens offer many perfect spots. Seasons change the scenery with nature's splendor on display. There are massive Rhodendrons in bloom in June, flower...
When I entered into the garden it looked for me as I am in a little paradies. Many different trees and plants, a little lake in the middle of the park - many places just to take a seat and relax
The gardens have a charm and beauty unsurpassed in Canada.The gardens were damaged during Hurricane Juan, but it is even better since it was restored.A must do in Halifax.

We went on a beautiful day. We were on a cruise and read these gardens were a must see. The variety and arrangement of the gardens are amazing. We went on October 2 and the weather was perfect. I would imagine certain times of the year are better but the park is terrific and laid out well.

Beautiful gardens - refreshing break from the regular museums and touring. There's a cafe and washrooms there, but I didn't use them myself so I can't speak to the quality. I just loved all of the water and ducks and was thinking how much my mom would love the flowers :)

The gardens are exquisite and within walking distance of the port (if you are in great shape). Something the cruise lines do not tell you is that there is a free bus that will take you all over Halifax. Don't pay the $45 for the Hop and Ride (I think they call it the pink bus) when you can get...

Originally from Montreal, I visited the gardens with the expection that it would be much less than other parks in biger cities but what a surprise!!! This is a great spot to take pictures or just stroll through the park with the wife and kids. The kids enjoyed the ducks and all the wildlife and my wife really enjoyed the...
These gardens are magical. Smaller than England's Hyde Park, but just as pretty. Plenty of places to sit and take in the many unique gardens, statues and bridges.

What a wonderful place to go in the middle of the city!!!! Crazy how beautiful it is in there...... I am happy to take my granddaughter there and have so much fun with icecream, then seeing the flowers and the ducks!
A definite stop. It is candy for the eyes and peaceful for the mind. During a busy vacation this is a required stop.

With a very engaging guide, we thoroughly enjoyed our stroll thru the gardens - not only learning about the history of the garden, and about the many species of plants and trees - but about the importance of gardens in Victorian lifestyles. Everything has a purpose - not only for looks but for feelings/ ambiance , mood-creation -and for exercise...
In my opinion, May/June is the best time to go, watch for the beautiful wedding parties coming from the Prince George on the weekends. Stunning!
A must see when in Halifax. Located in Downtown Halifax. A nice place to take a relaxing stroll. The gardens are very well maintained. Please do not feed the ducks!

We have been to Halifax twice and love strolling through this park. It is very unique, has some interesting water features, beautiful and well-maintained flowers and some peace and quiet. Within walking distance of waterfront hotels. Also, try one of the hot dogs from the street vendor and the french fries from the food truck near the hot dog stand.

We walked through the gardens on a particularly wet and misty day. This didn't deter from the beauty of the gardens. In fact it was nice to stroll round on our own and have no one getting in the way of our pictures. They are extremely well kept and the plants are well labelled. Particulary enjoyed looking at the Dahlias.
This was a beautiful park. A great place to walk around and enjoy the giant Dahlias and beautiful flowers, ponds and gardens.

We walked to the public gardens after seeing the Citadel, and just loved the grounds and colorful variety we found. We were there in early October and found a small dahlia garden/exhibit. The gazebo is lovely. We would have loved to been able to visit again the next day and just spend time wandering around.
What a lovely garden so unexpected. Good cafe, well maintained flower beds, nice lakes and a variety of garden features. This is a fine city park. An oasis.

It is amazing that this a city block is harboring this beautiful park that is all gardens of all kinds.There is a pond area, roses, huge and gorgeous dahlias, flowers all over as you wander the paths. We were there last week in September and flowers were still blooming happily all over. There were big washes of color and...
This public garden is a modest size, but beautifully kept. A nice place to have a bag lunch. I sat on a bench, watched the nearby ducks and the many tourists, and enjoyed a few quiet moments.
That is about all I can say about this place!! It is a great place to spend an afternoon and take pictures. Memories will be nice!!

As with most Canadian parks, this one is spotless ... no trash anywhere. Beautiful plantings well maintained and an amazing Dahlia garden in full bloom when we visited. A small restaurant serving coffees, pastries and ice cream ... all locally made and delicious. Well worth the hour or so to visit.
I loved the flowers and the trees and the water. So glad I got to see it and that flowers were still in bloom!

We loved the ice cream shop in the park. My husband and I spent a couple of hours on a beautiful and sunny September afternoon in the Gardens after arriving on an overnight flight to Halifax. It was the perfect location to just relax on the grass, people watch and enjoy hand paddled ice cream.
Beautiful small garden, wish we had something like that. Bring your lunch and enjoy it there. Not far from the citadel.
Elegant victorian gardens. Features flower varieties that have been developed by locals. We visited on a Sunday so parking was not a problem.
Always a nice place to visit in the middle of the city. If you are a bird watcher it is a nice place to go. The plants are great also.
Loved the historical aspect ... way too small to allow you to escape the noise of the city, though. Paid dearly to park nearby. Things were well maintained, but not spectacular.
These gardens are absolutely lovely and had a great little bakery/coffee shop in them as well. It was refreshing to go somewhere for free!

The Gardens is one of my favorite locations to visit. The beauty sparkles on its own but it's always nice to share a stroll around the park with friends or take a book and relax on a beach during a lunch break. It's a great location for pictures, just ask all the brides strolling through on the weekends. If you're...
We went with a Grayline tour and learned so much about these gardens. Honestly it was just like being in England without having to fly there.

The borders with flowers were very nicely created. Very bright coloured and nice to walk in. We were ther with 2 children who could run around.Also there was an exhibition of dahlia flowers which was really marvellous. We stayed there until a guard told us that it would be closed in 10 minutes and that was at 8pm.
It took us an hour or so to get a good look at the Public Gardens, which held a lot of variety and color.
Beautiful gardens in the middle of the city. Close to hospitals and busy Spring Garden Road. A perfect oasis!

Beautifully landscaped with variety of flora, little stream, fountains, sculpture and bandstand. No admission fee. Closed in the winter.Pete's Frootique, a 5 min. walk from the Gardens is a great place to pick up food for a picnic. Ask anyone on Spring Garden Road for directions.

OK, this place is an oasis of calm; so why only 2 stars? They have a grassy area where people can play and run around on the grass. Yet take two steps onto any other grass and this nut security guard will zoom over on his lazy mega golf cart and bark at you for being on the grass. It...
So beautiful at any time of year, always something new to see.Can't beat the price.Very close to shops and restaurants but peaceful and user friendly.

The public gardens provide a lovely setting for a stroll, or just a break from exploring the city. They are beautifully-maintained - they put most of the public parks in the UK to shame - and keen gardeners will be pleased to find many of the plants and trees are labelled. Among the lovely displays there's a particularly gorgeous Dahlia...

I have to stroll through this garden every time I go to Halifax. I love the pond with the little lighthouse and ocean liner. The dahlias were in bloom this trip. Every season is different and it;s free!
Not far from downtown (though a decent walk if you're down the hill towards the water). We really enjoyed a nice, morning stroll through this large garden. Probably best in summer.
There were a few looking for handouts but the grounds were impressive and very beautiful. It is free to get in.

The gardens are always a highlight of my trips downtown. Paths that criss-cross with fountains, bridges and flowers to intoxicate you for an entire afternoon. The asters were unbelievable. Every variety and so huge. Never saw them like this before. The paths are dreamy with ponds and little bridges, a swan or two and a magnificent gazebo. Go for an hour or two.
Gardens were pretty but nothing spectacular. Worth taking a walk through if you have some time on your hands, don't put it at the top of your list.
It was pleasant just walking around the gardens, glancing at the ducks, appreciating the flowers, and taking some time to just relax. Go take a break there!
These amazingly planned and cared for gardens are a refreshing and educational stroll in a beautiful city.
In the summer this is a really nice to walk around in on a hot day. There's an ice cream shop on site and the trails and flowers are beautiful.

This small garden occupies a block in a busy area of Halifax. It is free and nicely maintained. Definitely include it in your downtown stroll. The dahlias are at their best right now

Stopped here after biking all around town. (no bike racks, by-the-way...bicycles not allowed in park, so we chained bikes to outer metal fence).So lovely- the flowers, gazebo, statue and pond.All flowers are labeled by name and well-manicured.The pond made a wonderful home for some happy ducks- with cattails and a toy Titanic boat plus lighthouse to adorn...
A great example of a Victorian Garden, and within walking distance of the waterfront. Weekend music from the gazebo.
Colorful, well maintained gardens in Halifax. We enjoyed these gardens more than the Royal botanical at Annapolis Royal. This one is free, too!
Just a grand place to walk and sit for a nice afternoon,live music,feed the birds or just read a book

A Lovely and groomed garden on par with botanical gardens in the states. Funny little Ice Cream and coffee shop filled with friendly staff and customers. Clean restrooms and wheelchair access.
In the middle of the city, what a wonderful spot to relax and enjoy! Acres and acres of trees, shrubs, flowers and water features. Every city shoud aspire to a gem like this one!
A great place to relax and rest your feet. There is an old church in the middle that sells coffee and snacks. Great water features. A nice place for a break, quiet.
Great gardens in a great townWe had a nice little walk around the gardens on our last day and were pleased to spot a red squirrel (pics attached)
This was decent but very small. The only good thing about it is its free to get in. I think point pleasant park is much better than the public gardens. its overrated

The Garden, in the middle of the garden district, was beautifully designed and maintained, and had a significant history. A fun side trip not to be missed.
Very nice garden with a beutiful land scape and nice flower and roses. I was staying at the hotel facing the garden and loved to walk in the garden every morning. It was relaxing.

This garden in the middle of Halifax is the heart of the city and a historic place. Four generations of our family have visited this place and one couple were married here!
Normal garden.Beautifull a sunny day. Good place to read a book or enjoy the sun.But I've seen nothing special about this garden.
Full of beautiful flowers and always find people have their wedding photo shooting there. Nice place to spend an hour or two to relax in the downtown area.
If you like gardens you will like this, If you like quiet places to sit, sit and read you will like this, if you like music check out the free Sunday concert.
Beautiful place to take pictures and take à rest. You havé to go.Clean and quiet garden. Little restaurant on thé site. Ici créma is wow.

A nice place to bring a book and read and go for a gentle walk. There are some good sit down places to read but mostly a walk through place, worth the detour before you tackle the climb up to the Citadel.
Right off Spring Garden Road, the park is a perfect location to take a break in. Lots of benches and nice grounds.

The Public Gardens are a must see when you go to Halifax. The foliage and flowers are wonderful and the many points of interest captivate wanderers and reinforce the city's role in our Canadian history.

Nice to look around and explore the gardens, including the so-called "upside down trees" that had always grabbed my imagination since my father told me about them when I was a kid. The band box and the duck pond are nice places to sit with a sandwich/coffee and take in the sights of the people passing by.

It's a really nice place to go when you are in Halifax. It is close to downtown Halifax but completely different scenic views-green and green everywhere. It was a nice walk through the garden, my dauhter ranked this place 'excellent'!
An amazing park in the middle of the city. A quiet refuge from the day to day drudgery. If you're in Halifax for any length of time, this is a must see.
What a nice place to walk around. Free admission. Beautifully kept gardens. Really liked colours and smells.

This is a marvelous public garden, with a huge variety of flowers and plants, very well laid out, with a bandstand from 1887 or so to mark Queen Victoria's golden? anniversary year. Pretty gardens but some work was being carried out whilst we were there. Great spot for wedding photos on a weekend..often invited to join in!

On August 22, 2012 my partner and I visited the Gardens. We really enjoyed the walk around the gardens, viewing and taking pictures of all the beautiful flowers. I would highly recommend a visit to the gardens to all my family and friends. And it does not cost you a Canadian dime.

The flowers are in full bloom, and the park is so lovely to sit in and enjoy the birds, ducks, geese and squirrels. Peaceful after the hustle and bustle of Springgarden, the universities, and just life.The signs tell how the park has been lovingly restored after hurricane Juan. Beautiful gardens - one any gardener would enjoy. Large floral display. Wish we had been there to hear a concert which they do have.

Great location in the city. The wide array of flowers and peacefulness of strolling through the gardens. Well-kept and clean grounds for all to enjoy.
Well worth visiting .. take time for a walk through the trees and flowers. The rose gardens are wonderful.
This park is one of my favorites. The flora is beautiful and if you so desire you may feed the ducks and you can also find out of the way places to just relax and enjoy the view.

A beautiful piece of landscaping, the Halifax Public Gardens, located in downtown Halifax is a gorgeous place to take a stroll, have a picnic or just take a seat and relax. Upon entering the Gardens the noise of the city just seems to disappear. The beautiful flowers and trees are well looked after and are beautiful to look at. The paths throughout the Gardens allow for an easy stroll through the whole area. The pond is home to plenty of ducks and although you can no longer feed them they still...
Beautiful gardens! So nice to see in the middle of downtown! Perfect walk on a summer evening! Very close to other shopping and a huge cemetary. It reminded my husband of alice in wonderland.
Pretty amazing gardens. Very lovely plantings. Make sure you have your camera as there are a lot of photo ops here.

Oh well, it's good for the garden. A beautiful Victorian garden (well-earned as it must have a certain number of characteristics to qualify as a Victorian garden) located downtown. Nice wide paths for walking and beautiful spots to stop and capture some snaps (or pictures). We spent the day in Halifax and found the town delightful. Not sure when, be...
Beautiful historic Victorian gardens in the heart of Halifax. Great fun to feed the ducks. If you are lucky you might hear a concert in the Bandstand.
There was a special exhibit of local DAHLIA- great flowers!The garden is not «spectacular» but it makes a perfect place, mid-town for a stroll

The gardens are a great break for the visitor or local in Halifax. They were pretty crowded when we visited as it was an exceptional summer day. The gardens feature a great variety of exceptional flowers and trees and a few geese and ducks. If you are a photographer, the visit is even more rewarding (and it's a great place...
A great place to sit, enjoy the flowers, fountains, and escape! Wish it was a bit bigger, could have spent even more time there! Glad it exists, though!
very pretty and clean, lots of various events going on all the time. we staid at the hotel across the street, it gave us a lovely view :)
I like naturally wild gardens but must admit that the Halifax Public Gardens are wonderful to stroll through and enjoy.
Beautiful flowers, ponds, ducks etc. Special of the day...the zombies were also visiting the gardens.

The Halifax Public Gardens were a total surprise to my family of four. We walked into the gardens during an early August 2012 afternoon and ended up spending 2 hours walking around and enjoying this great space. Very peaceful and well maintained - great place for a quiet, relaxing stroll through beautiful gardens

Even after a storm destroyed many of the trees, the gardens are spectacular. A particular favourite was the vegetable bed laid out like an ornamental bed. The coffee in the garden is among the best to be found in Halifax.
A beautiful Victorian public garden with a magnificent ornamental gate! It's a great place to stroll and enjoy the many floral displays, statues and fountains.

This is as English as it gets, formal beds, rose garden, tea shoppe and band stand with a 2pm Sunday concert. Closes at dusk and for the cold season. If you are walking from spring Garden north go through and across the street to the graveyard with Joe Howe's grave
Amazing something so beautiful is free. Looking at beautiful flowers in lovely combinations as you walk along tree shaded paths is a great stress relieving activity.

The public gardens are beautiful and impecably maintained. It's the perfect spot to spend a couple hours walking around, reading a book or people watching on a nice afternoon. Make sure you stay on the paths and benches though, we got in trouble for daring to lay on the grass... they take this park seriously!

My husband and I visited these gardens early on a Thursday morning so there were very few people there and parking wasn't a problem. It is fun to walk around and very safe. Many cute paths and walkways. Felt very safe. It is a traditional Victorian Garden in walking distance (but uphill!) from the harbor.

This was by far the most beautiful place in Halifax. The flowers and their frangrances were amazing. There was a band that we sat and listened to for an hour. If you love beauty, peace, and tranquillity, this is the spot to visit.

A very beautiful area, it is worth checking out. You can sit and have a peaceful lunch or a nice stroll through the beautiful scenery. It is right by the Citadel so if you’re in the area definitely make the side trip.

Everytime I stroll around the pathways through the gardens there issomething new to enjoy ... more foliage ... baby squirrel ... little duckwaddle ...Mother Goose ... lovers holding hands on the bridge ...
Pleasant side trip--plan 30 - 60 minutes.I hate the fact that reviews have to be a minimum of 50 characters.
A nice relaxing place in the center of town with a number of resturants, hotels and the Citidel close by.
Water, flowers and statues were all beautiful. You can even see a model of the titanic floating in the pond!

Located next to the citadel, it is a lovely small park to spend a couple of hours under a tree. Flower beds were well kept; gazebo was very clean. Look out for the oak tree planted by the royal family.

A beautiful park right in the middle of the city! It was the perfect spot to sit and eat lunch? I understand that much of the vegetation was lost in a hurricane, but it has been brought back to a wonderful beauty.
The paths, the trees, the flowers, everything was so beautiful. The types of trees and bushes and flowers were amazing. This should not be missed. This should not be missed.

This is a wonderful place to relax, to wander or to take photos while you are visiting the city of Halifax The gardens are inspired and inspiring and take you out of the bustle of Spring Garden Road to somewhere cool and green and shadey..do check it out!

After visiting the Citadel, take a short walk to the Public Gardens. Get an ice cream cone from the original house on site. Sit/walk and enjoy the tranquility and beauty of these formal gardens. The gates of the Public Gardens alone are worth seeing! This is a great place to spend an afternoon relaxing and enjoying nature in the middle of a busy city. And its free admission makes it a must-see for frugal tourists!

absolutely beautiful gardens in center of town-well maintained with paths, gazebo for bands, many places to sit, relax, enjoy the ducks in the pond--for those of us who live in town, it's a great place to take a sandwich and sit and have lunch for a restorative hour in your day--it's a source of pride for Haligonians, and a source...

You can not go to Halifax without visiting the Public Gardens. Nothing special but nice enough. Pond not very clean, but probably due to # of geese.

This is a great, beautiful park in town with lots of benches to sit, read, appreciate the beauty. What a great resource....made me think every town should have such a spot. So well manicured...with an ice cream shop inside the park!
A nice place to enjoy peace and quiet in the middle of the city.
Make sure to take a break and take a stroll in the Public Gardens. Very lovely.
A great completely free way to relax for a few hours. We walked around for about an hour and then stopped for some Ice Cream.

The pride of halifax , this is a garden worth visiting . In the spring the ancient old Rhodo's are in full bloom and fabulous . The Old bandstand has been restored and stands to remind us of simpler times. There are free tours throughout the summer ...times posted on their website.
The perfect place to walk, take photos, or read a book!
These Victorian Gardens are stunning. We were there on an overcast day too, but didn't overshadow how beautiful this garden is. I'm not even a gardener, but I appreciate the gem this is.

This beautiful park is a lovely setting and a wonderful place to slow down and enjoy nature. The gardens are well done, but not overly fussy. If I lived here I'd walk this place daily. We enjoyed sitting on benches, having a coffee, and just watching the ducks after an afternoon of shopping.

You can do a very nice stroll in about an hour - it's not hugh, but very well taken care of, and has lots of little niches and corners with varied character. Bits reminded us of London gardens. Worth reading up on as it's one of the best remaining Victorian gardens. this is one for the gardener!
Halifax is so fortunate to have this wonderful garden in the heart of the city. Worth a visit if you're in the city!
Went walking in the public gardens several times. Great place to unwind and slow down after a hectic day.
There could stand to be more flower beds and less grass, but it is a nice place to just take a short walk. The ducks are also fun to look at.

One of the gardeners proudly told me that this garden is rated the best Victorian Gardn in North America. I easily believe it.If one is interested in gardens, this one may alone be worth the visit to Halifax.The best gardens transport the visitor to another world. This one does just that. What a great place to stroll, read, relax, and "smell the roses!" We actually visited the Public Gardens twice while we visited Halifax. I loved the Halifax Public Gardens. Everything was so well-kept and beautiful. We did not get to spend a lot of time here, so I would love to go back some day.
My wife and I enjoyed a nice stroll in May through the Public Gardens. Beautiful, scenic Victorian park. I recommend it to all who visit Halifax and would like a relaxing afternoon.
Beautifully kept garden grounds. ponds, ducks, gazbos, Such a calm place in the middle of Halifax Really enjoyed the walk

A romantic walk through the gardens is a must. Grab an ice cream at Sugah and sit under a tree. An inner city oasis.
A beautiful place in the middle of Halifax, N.S. The grounds are like a postcard, very well maintained. Very peaceful place to go. Wonderful place for wedding photos. Beauty in the middle of a city.
this garden is free and really beautiful and in the middle of the city! concerts on sundays and a great place to rleax.

The gardens are very well kept with pebbled walking paths that take you on little bridges and around ponds. We strolled through the gardens twice. The first time was to see the people as the local teens were dressed in prom clothes and getting their pictures taken by family and friends. Love!! Beautiful and peaceful...love going there for a walk at lunch..

a peaceful space in downtown Halifax. Lots of variety in the gargens. Relaxing walk and we had a great sunny day for it. Parking was free on the street too due to the meters not being checked after a certain time.

The gardens are beautiful whether you know anything about flowers or not. It is peaceful there. A great place to read a book or enjoy an ice cream from the shop on the grounds. Beautiful - take your camera. A nice meandering path through a victorian garden. Great photo opps at every turn.

Beautiful location for all different photo shoots: wedding, engagement, prom, etc. Plus the flowers are so perfect here that you can brush up on your macro skills. of this Natural gem - soft and mystique is the Gardens

Halifax's Public Garden is a very tranquil escape from the Haligonian hustle and bustle. Located across from the Citdel, and a short walk uphill from the waterfront, it serves as a pleasant place to relax with its wooded paths, benches, fountains and pond side hide-aways, where ducks are tame enough to walk up face to face (just don't feed them)....

In my 3 nights in Halifax, I spent more time at the public gardens than at any other attraction!The space has been nicely restored follwing the devestation of Hurricane Juan in 2003, and is kept-up beautifully by full-time staff.The park sports ponds and fountains, beautiful statuary, manicured lawns, bright flower beds and mature trees.
